I came out to bingo and the girl ANA that was serving the drinks was very rude and disrespectful I ordered a 1water and a 1cocktail when she came around in the middle of the game she asked if anybody needed cocktails I asked for a cocktail she said I already have 2 drinks and she served the guy across from me 2 cocktail and 2 beers and he already had 1 beer so total of 5 drinks   She is a very rude bartender and disrespectful person

What a complete and total disappointment. Had a massage here a few months ago, that was horrible, the masseuse was actually texting on her phone as she was rubbing the back of my leg with one hand, anyway we didn't stay the night at the hotel a few months ago, but we decided to give it a try for this weekend. I booked our room two months ago, requested non smoking, upon arrival they were complete booked and only had smoking rooms. We said we would give it a try and it was unbearable. Even the bellman said it was awful. So we requested to move. We the only room left... the "70's" room. And it looked just like that, straight out of the 70's. Not impressed, everything was 70's inspired but without the amenities of the 20th century. The tv does not work, the bed is hard and I wouldn't dare sit on the couch. Yuck NEVER AGAIN!!
Live like a king. Great food, great pool, great view.

Very nice and new resort. When I first walked it I was really impressed by the beauty and charm of it. It's a very clean and nice resort with a nice contemporary decor.   The pool area was really gorgeous. All of the pool chairs were cushioned and extremely comfortable. Also, there are a ton of misters around to keep you cool.  The activities at the resort are really clever. I think this resort is one of the more kid friendly resorts around and in Vegas. They have an arcade along with a movie theater for kids to enjoy. They also have a drop off kids camp that has a bunch for kids to do.   The food and the service at the resort was what the resort needs to work on. We went to the grand cafe for breakfast and we were there for over two hours!!! I waited about 15 minutes for a cup of coffee and another 45 minutes for my food. Plus, the food isn't worth the wait either.  Overall, beautiful and homy resort with really beautiful rooms (at least ours was.) I especially enjoyed all that the hotel had to offer and just all around had a great decor. But the food and service wasn't up to par compared to Vegas standards. I would totally recommend this resort otherwise.

The Manager at the Grand Cafe is very RUDE and does not do his job well. He should find a different line of work that does not involve customer service! Sean is his name. Wow is all I can say. Just wow.   It's making me leave a star. I don't want to tho.

Good Station Casino right off the 215 freeway in Henderson. It is a modern casino with good attention to detail. Nice renovated sportsbook. Could use a cafe. Over all the restaurants are ok with Hanks being the best but severly over priced.
Very clean, no overwhelming smoke smell in the air! Great place to watch the fireworks on New Years Eve!

Nice hotel/resort. Very pretty. Big room & bathroom.  My only disappointment was they closed the pool down one day for a "party" or group. It would have been nice that they informed the guest this ahead of time. No sign nothing. Pretty disappointing.  Lastly, the shuttle service is the worst! Doesn't seem to go to or from the hotel when you arrive or depart to the airport. Other hotels on the strip take you as you need to go. So should this hotel.

Beautiful resort. Great amenities. But given a 2 for the establishment employees. That all seem so unhappy.  I have been coming for the last 3 years. Either they are unhappy or racist and don't want to smile or help me.  Gone to all the restaurants.  Really disappointed. See we'll go somewhere else.

This casino is GREAT if you want to have the fun of gambling in Vegas without all the riff-raff and dirt of the strip.  It's a fantastic spa/hotel/casino and it has a wonderful view of all the hotels below on the strip...just far enough away to feel like an oasis yet close enough to still cab it.  I'd say it's about 12-13 miles so prepare for a slightly more expensive taxi fare than say if you were going from the strip to downtown.  GVR is so nice if you are going to relax with your honey, chill with family, or for even celebrating a bachelorette party.  I've done all three and can attest that the resort accommodates all three!  The rooms are great...marble counters in the bathroom, a full size hairdryer, separate tub, shower AND toilet (own room!).  The bedroom area is equally lovely...either 2 queens or a king...high thread count sheets, pillows that are squishy with the right amount of firmness, a mini bar complete with a "sexy" kit, medicine for hangovers, and all the ingredients with which to make your own, in-room 'tini!!  The spa is a tad confusing but nice...indoor and outdoor hot tubs.  Be prepared to pay a resort fee JUST to use the spa even if you're not getting a service.  Oh, and the services are WAY pricey...like upwards of $150 for a 50 minute massage.  If you want something cheaper, head across the way to the Aveda salon where they offer an $80/hour version and it's a close walk.  The Cafe in the casino has great late-night dining and the Sports Book has some kick-ass, huge screens on which to watch your favorite team( ahem, GO PATRIOTS!) play.  Oh, and if you bet on a sports, be sure to ask for a FREE drink ticket.  You get one free well or domestic beer with a bet. :) Also make sure you get a player's card if you play blackjack or slots, etc.  You'll get "free" stuff the more you gamble...so if you are going to lose that cash anyway, might as well get a few free bets and/or a free pack of cigarettes if you are into it. lol  The Whiskey Bar is also nice...especially in summer when you can chill out under the cabanas outside and get bottle service. Fun place to dance...and if you DON'T like the bumpbumpbumpbump of the DJ...I suggest you request a room NOT facing the pool lest you want to hear it ALL night while you sleep. lol

What is that smell in my room the place Stinks like sulfur. We just checked in and it smells like a bad sewer smell I called down there they switched my room from way up to Tim Buck too never again this place sucks. Wait to I see my travel agent at AAA

I liked staying here, for the most part. It's gorgeous and our suite made me feel like a princess. Everyone was pretty friendly and accommodating..... until I got to the casino.   The only issue I have with the entire place are the terrible attitudes I ran into there. There is one particular female dealer who shall not be named and I'm sorry to say this, BUT she has permanent bitch face. She acted genuinely irritated as hell to be doing her job of playing games. It was bizarre. Also, when I went to cash out the cashier was irritated because I didn't stand in the right spot or walk up to the counter fast enough. She berated me like I was a child and said, "it says RIGHT THERE that this is the line for chips." There was only one line open in the whole place, so I'm not sure why that mattered at all. Also, the other closed lines had the same sign?? She made me feel ridiculous after I had waited for her help for almost 15 minutes. It took her 3 seconds to count my money and then she basically threw it at me like I couldn't leave fast enough for her. I'll admit, this was my first time in a giant casino, so maybe I'm ignorant about where to stand myself. How. Ev. Er!, if I'm dropping a billion dollars on my weekend maybe chill the hell out. I'm so sorry you picked a job working with idiots like me, but I promise it's not deserving of your nasty eye roll. Not the best first impression. I'll probably gamble somewhere else next time.

What an incredible disappointment !!! A few months ago I purchased an auction item for St Jude's children's hospital , it featured 2 nights in a Luxury suite at this "hotel"... With breakfast etc... I live  in Los Angeles  and as an active member of  The charity it seemed right to bet on this deal and come visit my Vegas friends, I invited  the manager of a CVS pharmacy, the CEO of a major Coaching company, and a lactation expert in a Summerlin famous hospital, along with 3 ,17 years old ....their kids...A very civilized and educated group of people who came to have Thai food with us in the Tuscany suite of 2000 sq feet with a large dining  table that seemed to be " inviting"....in Any case after 20 min in our dinner , as civilized and normal as could be , 9.20pm someone knocks at that door , my husband sees those 2 men, one claiming he received several complaints from guests about us making too much noise to which all of our faces dropped !! How could it BE? Were we in the famous Las Vegas on a Sunday night November 10th  ?? No School on the 11th right ? only chewing our foods and laughing here and there to our friends jokes. By the way they all intended to go back to their respective beautiful homes early (and  decoration-wise much prettier than that overdone Rococo suite) .... I think that this pretentious hotel thought we planned on ALL  sleeping there ! What a joke! They kept on coming back and the 3rd time planned on getting my non-registered guests outside the room cause they were now 6 men, 2 of them in yellow plastic suits claiming to be security ! My friends and I  took our phone and started filming ,which immediacy calmed them down ... I forgot to say that we are a group of 50 year old people and our kids were there NO WE MADE NO NOISE!!!! A DINNER that left such a bitter taste to my life after my guests heard twice they will be asked to leave!!! We all left!!!  I feel that The Green Valley Ranch is the worst experience I ever had.... Very disappointing to look forward to a nice and relaxing 3 days week end in a "luxury " hotel and get a very angry little man, telling us to behave or else .....  It is the first time in my entire long life that I have been subject to such a treatment. I have been a fan of the red rock hotel for a long time and stayed at the top floor suite for events, and parties  ,many times ,This really does not reflect right on the owners of the stations nor to their commitment to their guests.  And guess what... I left a message at the very apologetic reception desk asking for a follow up from someone different than the angry power tripping man in charge that night (after all I left  after 5 hours instead of 3 days )  No news.....!    . .

I am highly disappointed with this hotel. It is a beautiful hotel. The food is great! I am an extremely social person but I continuously felt like an outsider. Each dealer I talked to I felt as if I was a burden on them. I played craps for hours listening to the dealers crack jokes and have a great time and ignore me the entire time! And I was the only player!!!! Don't come to this hotel or casino unless you are a local! They even have "we  locals" on each employee badge! I will not be returning! I hate doing bad reviews. And do not take them lightly. I spent all day trying to disprove my experience! Just didn't happen. There are so many other places to stay as a "non local"... stay anywhere else!
What are the greatest places that I've ever stayed at home to Tony Curtis while his house was being built this places is just like Palm Springs

Recently bought a groupon for Green Valley Ranch.  Purchased it for a staycation. Although It is a gorgeous property, their resort fee is ridiculous, being about $29.00 per day.  Also they put a $100.00 per day hold on any credit card you use.  This is very inconvenient.  And to top it off, got home and found out my credit card had fraudulent activity on it.  I know it came from this property, because I never use that credit card.  I used it because of the $100.00 hold per day.  They put wine glasses in the room, just in case you want to drink the wine in the mini bar that is in your room. However no coffee pot, no complimentary coffee at all.  This will force you to go downstairs and purchase a cup for $3.75 at the cafe.    Also I believe my sunglasses got stolen out of my room when we were at breakfast.  They were expensive Maui Jim sunglasses.  Beware if you go to Green Valley Ranch.

I reserved a King bed room at GVR and hit the road from Los Angeles excited about adding an extra day to the start of my trip.  I got there 5 hours later, after the long drive, ready to shower, relax and have a great time.   The rude woman at check in said they had no more king beds but they'd give me two queens.   I told her I specifically confirmed a kind bed.   I asked her if they had any Kings on the entire property.  She said I'd have to pay the upgrade fee for a suite.  I asked to speak to a manager and she said, "I am the manager".    I went to find someone else in the hotel because this woman obviously wasn't looking to help me.  I found a floor man on the casino level.  He went off to "look into it" and then didn't even have the balls to come back and talk to me face to face.  He called the security guard at the station he left me standing at, and the guard told me the same thing. They couldn't do anything for me.  So they'd rather leave my reservation empty and a king suite empty than comp me a suite due to their mistake.     I left furious and to top it off they had the audacity to try and charge my card the reservation fee of $178!!    NEVER stay here, EVER!!   Worst Vegas experience I've had.

We stayed here two nights using a Groupon deal that included $50 credit and breakfast buffet for two days.  The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and quiet.  The place is a resort and is upscale all around.  You can get to your room without going through the casino depending on where you park which is rare in any Vegas hotel. The lobby though is not easy to get to as it is on the floor below the main floor.  Plenty of parking.   We used the adult pool and regular pool.  The adult pool is small but the lounge seats are nice.  The regular pool has sand to simulate a beach and the pool staff is good eye candy for both men and women.   The hotel is across from a shopping center that was practically empty.  There are sit down restaurants and fast food places in the hotel..  We ate at their buffet and Tides restaurant which I reviewed on Yelp.    The place is about a 15 minute drive to the strip with no traffic.

The rooms were clean and very nice, but the lay out is horrible, we had to walk miles to get to our room which overlooked the top deck of the parking garage, easy enough for the hotel to fix by adding some other security doors/entrances.  Station Hotels are all over the Las Vegas/Henderson area but do not understand why Green Valley charges 5x more then the Sunset, Fiesta, or the Santa Fe, they all have plenty of different food choices, all have a nice movie mulitiplex,  and spa and swimming pools, and  if you want to see the Las Vegas strip you have to drive or take a cab, they all have retarded resort fee which is hidden till you arrive and check in. weekend room at Green Valley will run 100.00+ yet the same room type at Santa Fe is 29.00.  They also offer a kid day care area with plenty of stuff for the kids to do, but feel if you are a guest or come to play in there casino you should not be charged, just leave a tip for the persons working there, If they can give you all the free drinks and comps on your players card, then why not daycare to allow parents to gamble and not have to pay.

This is really a solid place, depending on what you're looking for...  Food? Great choice! There's Pizza Rock that serves great selections of both pizza and beer (even some rare ones every now and then). There's Borracha that serves great Mexican food, Bottiglia for great Italian food....  Entertainment? This is one of our go to movie theaters. Not big gamblers but I did play craps here once and it was fun, dealers were chill and cool guys. Haven't been to the other bars or played table games, honestly if I was looking to just gamble I'd probably brace the strip but all the people I see playing seem to be enjoying themselves.  If you're local it's really worth stopping in and checking out.

First, I want to thank the casino for my winnings.  Second,  I have never in my life felt so upset because of an employees complete disregard for service.  While it obvious they have new team members on board because of season, the managers need to set expectations and ensure invited guests are given respect.  The casino cage was so out of in their comments made toward me.  Just because I'm Hispanic and dress casual doesn't give anyone the right to discriminate. When bought to a manager the issue was basically brushed off.   Horrible treatment!!
Steaks are among the best.  Service always good.  Prices within reason.   One of best off strip.

Staying here as I write this. Great looking place! Rooms are very nice. Big and roomie. Mattress is so comfy! Food is everywhere and all good!  Now the best part.....I hit two royal straight flushes within 4 hours on the 100% payback video poker machines and there are quite a few of them!  Pool area is spectacular! Rivals any one on the strip! Rooms aren't cheap, about 150 after that resort fee ripoff but they're all doing it here now.  Definitely would stay here again! Friendly staff, great buffet.

I must say that I expected more. First of all I check in and I am given a room with double beds versus the single king bed I booked. Then I get to my room facing the casino parking lot with lots of noise. The sink in my restroom is painted and peeling with mildew! Yuk! I call the front desk and I am moved after already being unpacked!  I paid for upgraded internet that didn't work and tech support said they would send a tech to my room that never did show up! Grrr  At check out the clerk has a bad attitude! Screws up my bill by $205! I ask to speak with a manager that has me waiting for 45-mins! Wouldn't recommend this place!

Being caught up in the Christmas season, my girl and I were invited to Green Valley to enjoy some holiday cheer with friends. We were, get this, poolside with a fire pit, jingle jingle. There was an ice skating rink set up a stones throw away, cocktails a plenty and fixins for smores, it was so grand. I do not skate but my woman does so she tore it up, I do however drink and eat smores so this is where I did my triple toe. Music was playing,  toasts were made and I even had a hot chocolate with plenty of spirits. Lots of love to GV staff.

We have finally stayed here for Our Anniversary. It was so nice and clean. We overlooked the pool area which was beautiful. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was awesome. There is a huge vanity and makeup mirror, deep tub, glass shower, toilet by itself and double doors to get into it. The staff was really sweet and offered us a bottle of water when we checked in. It was room temperature but, my husband likes it that way. We had our car valet and did not cost us extra except for a tip. They made you feel like you were someone special not just another somebody. We will be back.

Poker Room Review:  Great room to play.  Enough tables and people to make it lively but not so  much to suffocate.  The cocktail waitresses were attentive and frequently came back to check on us.  It's definitely a nice stop before heading out to the Whiskey Bar. Now the locals playing here were a different story.  Well, there was only one annoying dude. For the most part, locals like to play just to play.  I know this sounds naive but the truth is if locals wanted to make some real money they'd probably go play on the strip and work the tourists (unless they work for one of the big casinos that is). Anyway, there was this dude bent on winning millions at a 2-4 table.  2-4 is by very definition a starters table or just wanted kill some time table.  It is not the win it big and retire tournament table.  Here's the hand that typified this guy's disillusionment:  Dude:  I got aces so I'm going to raises $2 (this is after after the flop and with only $8 in the pot) Most people fold because who bluffs at a 2-4 table? My Friend: I'll pay to see that (calls the $2 bet) Fourth street come out Dude: I think my aces are going to hold.  Raise $4. My friend call $4 again. River on board. Dude: This pot is mine.  Raise another $4. My Friend: All I got is nines, but I'll call your $4. The dude had king high.  My friend did have pocket nines.  Total amount of the pot: $28 Amount dude put in: $12 Looking like a jackass: free.

If I could rate a negative star rating I would. I have been going to Green Valley for over 10 years. I am a local. On September 14th we went to go get something to eat at the buffet during the breakfast time around 9 a.m. . We were seated and our server was really nice and great. We went to get our food from the buffet the selection was decent but nothing to Rave about. I went to get a bagel to toast and low and behold I found four Bagles that had mold and things growing off of it meaning they've been sitting in their back bakery storage facility for quite some time. I was Furious not because of the price but because the lack of concern that this company has for their consumers. I asked to speak to the manager on duty I wanted the food and beverage manager his name was Jeff I showed him what I found and I wanted an explanation as to why his associates failed to do their job correctly meaning to protect the consumer and spoiled rotten food. He said he couldn't give me an answer he didn't know why. He gave me an excuse that one of his associates who was putting out the food didn't have her glasses on and that's why there was moldy Bagels. Really.!?!?# Are you kidding me ?!? That was a joke .Be very very very careful when you eat there and inspect the food. Just because it looks fresh doesn't mean it is. Also make sure that if you do go to the breakfast time inspect all the bread that they have laid out and all the food because you don't know how long it's been sitting there and you don't know if it's fresh I will never step foot back in there again.

This is as classy as you're going to get this close to the suburb of Henderson.  This station casino location is much newer and cleaner than Sunset Station (a few miles down the road), and has more upscale options including a shopping district with an assortment of restaurants and stores.  There are several great bars on property that are great to meet friends local to the area.  Quinn's is a mock irish pub with cheap beer, for instance Hoegaarden for $3, and usually live entertainment.  Beer pong is available on the weekends, for those still wishing to pretend they're in their college years.  Hank's and Drop Bar are also near in the area.    I've lost my hat a few times at the table games, but their lusture always convinces me back for more.  This casino also has electronic craps and roulette, which have much cheaper minimums than their live counterparts - its just missing the yelling dealers and the shame associated with losing in front of an audience.  Overall, a great casino with plenty of offerings to keep locals and tourists alike happy for an evening or two.

This review is for the Green Valley Ranch Buffet...  The buffet at Green Valley Ranch is unique in that they will cook your king crab legs in butter, garlic, tomatoes, and other spices!  It makes the king crab legs 10 times better.  You simply load up your plate with king crab legs as you would at the Bellagio, Wynn, or any other buffet.  You then bring it to the center grill area and the chef will cook your crab legs.  King crab legs will never be the same again once you have tried it here.  The trick is to ask for everything and go light on the butter, because they will soak it with butter if you don't tell them otherwise.  I prefer mine with less butter.  This place is located about 15 minutes from the Vegas strip but it is worth the drive if you have a car.  I wouldn't take a cab ride here unless the craving for these crab legs is so unbearable that you have to have some and pay for it with a hefty cab fee.  Everything else at this buffet pretty much sucks but for $20, the crab legs itself was well worth it.

Pool and Hank's are the only good things in this hotel. Don't buy their gift cards as they will wipe out all of their value  within two years. Was given $500 on gift cards, all zeroed out, called and emailed customer service, they directed me to inexistent phone number.

I used to live down the street from Green Valley Ranch and I hate it. First of all, there is never any parking. They also took out the middle of the 3rd floor of the parking garage and made it for VIPs. Also, the food prices are astronomical and there is always long lines as well. Security guards are rude to minors, especially at the District. If they sit at a bench in the District longer than 10 minutes, security tells them that they sat there too long and that the District is only for adults. The security at the arcade is also strict, they make sure everyone is over 13 and they follow you around. The movie theaters always has long lines and they don't have great showtimes and the concession stands have poor customer service as well.
This is a beautiful spa boutique. Small intimate but with lots of extras. Locals get discounts so make sure to check those out we did the Travel Zoo couples special. Great day.

In town for a conference and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Typically when I visit Vegas it's with family & friends so we stay on the strip. This is a nice hideaway and clearly geared towards the locals looking for a staycation.  The front desk was super friendly and helpful. My TV wasn't working and they promptly sent an engineer to work on it! The AC is a little slow to cool down but was okay. The room decor is a little outdated but it gets the job done.  After settling in to my room I headed down to take advantage of some gaming before the work week started. The casino itself was pretty loud and offered a decent selection of table games at a reasonable minimum. There are a few spots where the cocktail service wasn't great.

I receive monthly brochures in the mail. It has a 2 for 1 coupon in it for the buffet. I asked a friend to join me for dinner. The buffet at GVR is amazing! Fresh carved turkey, chicken and beef. There is shrimp at the salad bar. Very clean and our server was attentive.

Oh GVR, you bring back so many memories from back when I first ever lived in Vegas. And yeah, I kinda liked you better then. However, you are still 4 stars in my book even now. (Though, I do miss the old you. And am I the only one who remembers the GVR reality show?)  There are good bars, decent restaurants, a great lounge for shows, a nice pool, a great spa, and a coming soon fantastic salon (Brannon Hair is opening a location here).  Plus, you can actually afford to game here. And, oh yeah, it's just up the street from me, so there's that whole convenience thing.  And the rooms, especially the suites, are actually quite fab.  So yep, GVR is a great off-Strip casino.

My company recently held a conference at this resort.  The rooms, grounds, food and staff were fantastic.  it is not located on the Strip, which to me is a good thing, as I think the Strip is kind of trashy.  It does have a casino in the hotel if you wish to gamble  The hotel, conference and pool areas are beautiful.  The rooms seem a little dark and could use more lighting, but the beds are comfortable, the bathroom has a separate tub/shower and a speaker in there so you can hear your T.V. - plus a phone in the bathroom.  I forgot one more thing - so you don't have to knock on room doors, each room has its own doorbell - pretty awesome.  The staff bent over backwards for us during our conference.  We had to change several arrangements for rooms and transportation and they were right there and changed things without complaining.  I know I would not have been so patient.  Thank you, Green Valley Ranch for a great conference.  I hope to come back someday and will tell everyone that it is a great place to hold a conference.

After an awful check in due to some complications with the travel agent, I was a bit irritated. I don't think anyone wants to deal with any kind of complication when they check into a resort for a relaxing weekend after traveling 5 hours to get there. The manager was absolutely amazing, he stepped up after seeing how frustrated I was and took such good care of us. It is a little ways away from the strip but I loved that it isn't filled with drunk, loud people. As someone who visits Vegas often for a quick weekend getaway, I can say this has got to be one of my favorite places to stay in. My husband and I stayed in one of the Grand suites, absolutely beautiful and super clean. Staff were all quite pleasant. The view was absolutely beautiful from our suite, the pool was perfect for the awfully hot weather. The atmosphere was just all around perfect for a nice, relaxing weekend getaway. I have, for sure, bragged about our wonderful stay here to everyone I know. What a lovely place, I can't wait to go back.

Green Valley Ranch is one reason I love living in Las Vegas. The rooms here are super gorgeous, and the view is amazing. The pool is so unique and always a pleasure to spend an afternoon. I can sometimes be found in one of their restaurants or bars, they are mostly good!! The Movie theater here is one of the best in the city and the pool bar cannot be beat!! I love spending a faux vacation at GVR! The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5, is that Red Rock, the sister property beats it somehow!

I very much enjoyed my stay here!  I was here for a business conference and absolutely loved it!    The bathrobes are to die for!  So comfy and soft!  Love the bathrobes!  The Starbucks in the establishment was literally steps away from the conference room my business meeting was in - a huge bonus!  I love easy access to Starbucks!  The room was very nice.  I loved the deep bathroom sink.  It was beautiful and functional which made washing my face feel more luxurious.  Loved the size of the bathroom!  And loved the bath mat!  There was your typical bath mat for the shower and tub, and a soft and delightful small carpet like mat for the sink/vanity.  So appreciated that!  Very nice make up mirror too.  I enjoyed a king size bed and slept so well - very comfortable.  The staff was always courteous and pleasantly helpful.  I particularly appreciated the excellent customer service by the woman who brought me my room service.  She went out of her way to make sure I was happy with what I ordered.  The first day I ordered a small pot of tea and when I ordered it on the second day and the pot was half the size, she brought me an extra pot, even though I told her the smaller pot was fine.  She wanted to make sure what I received was consistent to my expectations.  Above and beyond nice!   I enjoyed the Lobby Bar (except for the horrible smoking by a few patrons).  They had a live DJ and I enjoyed the fun pop music they played.  There was a woman who came from the spa and gave great massages on the spot!  The grounds and pool area look beautiful.  Being winter it wasn't appropriate to use the pool area.  Very inviting to come back!  Cabanas are very cool.  I liked the tall ceilings in the lobby and main hallways.  Gave a feeling of spaciousness and luxury.  The reason I gave GVR 4 stars and not 5 is because of the smoking.  Even in my business sessions my eyes were burning with the affects of the cigarette smoke in the air, even though we were in a separate conference room away from the casino.  I wish the entire establishment was non-smoking.  Smoking really makes for an unpleasant environment.  Overall my stay was very enjoyable.  I would definitely stay here again!

This is literally my favorite place to hang out, a very nice and calm casino for those who don't enjoy the stress and chaos of the strip casino's. (I live 10 minutes away so that's a plus lol)   But I've just had a staycation at the hotel for just a couple days. They gave me the room an hour early than check in time since it was already ready which was awesome I was expecting to wait. The rooms are spacious and clean, and I really liked the bathroom it was fancy and big as well.   The pool is beautiful and I had the most relaxing day there, and they gave a restaurant and a bar there to get food and drinks from. Didn't try the food and but all the drinks were awesome. They have a spa there that looks awesome for whoever can afford it, and a fitness center that's pretty large for being part of the hotel, I was impressed with it!  I ate at the Cafe, it's open 24 hours and has lunch and overnight specials as well as the regular menu 24/7. It was delicious and service was pretty good.   Too lazy to keep writing more haha. But other pros is that there are multiple great restaurants in the casino and in the district (which is a shopping center right next to it.) As well as the buffet in the casino which I recommend. Haven't gotten to try all the restaurants yet but working on it. There's also good gambling and a movie theater, and a food court as well. Great shopping as well. And if the weather is nice the neighborhood has nice running and biking trails and the area is quiet and safe.  So yes I really do recommend! Also if you wants to go to the strip it's only a 20-30 minute drive away depending on the traffic.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 Days and when I say the staff here waits on you dam near hand in foot it really made it a incredible stay. About a 15 min drive to the strip. The amenities are so great , if you stay here I highly suggest trying out the spa in the resort a bit pricey but honestly totally worth it. It is so peaceful and so quite in the resort and it's surround areas I would definitely recommend booking here if you want to go to Vegas.

Ever since this resort was featured on the show Hells Kitchen in 2007 (where the winner became the executive chef of the fine dining restaurant in there) I've been anxious to check this place out & I finally did!  It's one of the cleaner, neater, non-smoker friendly , swankier "local casinos" in Las Vegas.   The casino floor is huge. Multiple wings with chock-full- of Slot machines ! Plenty of table games also.   Plenty of food around - from "food court" quick fixings to  buffet to restaurants.    Outside in the immediate area is plenty of shopping and restaurants.

Me and my husband stayed here booked a suite for our wedding. Our bridal party also booked rooms here.  The staff made a comment to my bridesmaid for not upgrading to a suite to her coworker. I guess they get bonuses for getting upgrades.  I was requesting a late check out which they charge your fee no matter what. I expressed I got food poisoning and I booked the suite for multiple nights and asked for the fee to be waived the employee on the phone responded "I'm sorry you feel that way" what the f!? I felt like I was talking to cable company customer service not a so called "resort"  The valet was also rude to my sister who was driving an older suburban they didn't believe that she was staying at the resort. She was just trying to drop off our champagne and breakfast for our bridal party suite. They kept trying to direct her to self park instead of helping her.  Booking a resort for such an important event you expect the resort staff to be more than helpful and kind. During these events and stay the staff did not show any empathy or professionalism. I think they really need to review the management, the management is allowing employees to be so rude to guests.

Green Valley Ranch is my absolute favorite casino in Las Vegas. Staff is professional and super friendly. There are things and activities  for everyone and the buffet has awesome food. You can't go wrong on this property.

I tried the buffet here lastnight and it was absolutely repulsive. The ribs were dry, corn on the cobb tasted over cooked, and the entire hispanic section looked like dry dog food. My girlfriend and I both spit out the food in a napkin after realizing that the raw shrimp seemed to be luke warm.   We completely gave up and moved to dessert, what a mistake that was. I tried the chocolate cake and she had banana cream. The chocolate cake had no flavor, and the texture reminded me of rubber.   We paid about $34.00 for the two of us and regret every single penny. I will never return!

We received a complimentary weekend stay courtesy of "The Price Is Right" for attending the taping of the "Military Appreciation" show.   The resort is very nice. Despite the fact we got a free stay, the staff are all incredibly friendly and professional. We drove in and I'm sure we looked a sight after a 6 hour car trip with a squalling baby. The valet acted no different than if we had come out of a limousine.   The lobby is beautiful just like everything else here. Check in was quick and easy. The room was spacious and the temperature just right. It smelled clean and the bed was spacious enough to accommodate us and our baby's sleeper in the middle of the bed.   The show stopper here was the pool/cabana/garden. It was almost completely deserted so we had it to ourselves. Gorgeous! This resort is away from the strip and was heavily populated by retirees so no drunk young guests.  I would call it family friendly.  Everything was easily in driving distance and room service was reasonable. When we come back we will definitely stay here again.
My fave for sportsbook, the pool, oyster bar, and local specials. So pretty too!

This was my first time staying off the strip and I must say, I was pleasantly surprised. It was nice to be away from the  hustle and bustle.   SPA: Let's start with the Spa. We happened to wander over to the fitness area to check it out and unexpectedly we found the Spa. Too bad it was on our last day because once we found it, we spent the rest of that day relaxing in that area. The staff were all friendly and gave both my husband and I a tour of the facility. We had lunch and drinks on a day bed near the pool, occasionally dipped in the pool when it got warm and then moved over to the co-ed jacuzzi and relaxed and caught up on some reading. The whole vibe was so enjoyable.   Pool: The main pool has everything you look for. Plenty of cabana's surrounding the pool to relax in. There is also a 21+ area called the pond that shows old movies on Sunday evenings.   Rooms: The room we had was fairly basic (King bed, flat screen TV, fridge, etc.) but I know they have upgrade options, so I might have to look into that next time. Plus our view was the parking lot but when in vegas who sits in their room and stares out the window.   Bingo/ Tables: Kerry in the bingo hall goes above and beyond to make you feel special. She was such a sweetheart and I hope she's still there the next time i go back. Tip she gave me: ask the bartender in the bingo area for her house special "cash ball." Michael, Doug (dealers) and TN (pit boss) were so friendly. We took over the 3 card table for a couple hours and had so much fun!   Drinks: Things to note: they don't comp tito's vodka but they comp belvedere.   Restaurants in hotel were all very good. I will write separate reviews for them.   Bonus: The shops at The District has my favorite store, ANTHROPOLOGIE! A little small but a nice option.

I was recommended to go here by a good friend that knows I love to eat, so she recommended the seafood buffet! I hate buffets; but she said I would Not be disappointed and she was right!!! The buffet is only on Friday's so be prepared to get there when it first open, or stand in the amusement park line for 2 hours. My feet hurt like hell; but it was definitely worth it! Most buffets have cold crab; not here! They season it with a variety of Flavors to your temperature. I even had them season my shrimp. Which was perfect b/c the shrimp was de-veined and easy to peel! I wish I could've eaten more...Folks had their plates stacked with crab like it was the last supper!

New slogan: GVR Hates Locals!  I won't be bringing my out of town visitors here ever again and I'll probably never come back myself. During midday on a weekday, the pool and hot tub were both extremely crowded and overrun by children. The service at the cabana was awful. The drinks were so watered down that my coconut water tasted like tap water. The waitress was totally inattentive and barely came over. There were dirty cups and dishes everywhere.   I came here as a local several times in 2013 and I had no problems with service. This is not the relaxing and quiet sanctuary I remembered from past visits. It is a beautiful place but not worth the awful atmosphere.

Stayed here for three days in July for Cake Camp, a conference and workshop for cake decorating business.  I was very impressed by the decor and design of the lobby and the public areas: very posh, but not too glitzy and overwhelmingly 'vegas'.  I was upgraded to a 'pool view' room which happened to be ADD accessible.   The room was decorated nicely and had upscale finishes, but there was a definite lack of attention to detail.  The lamp on the desk had a very bent shade, the towel/robe hooks in the bathroom were all crooked, my message light on my phone blinked all the time, walls were thin and there was a very pissed off little dog a few doors down, the TV remote wasn't much help, the phone only called the front desk,  the key card reader to the hotel from the nearest entry point in the casino didn't work so I had to go around and about to the lobby and back up to the tower to access my room, and there was no in room book of services or restaurants. When i called down to inquire, he said that it was being redesigned. He gave me a run down of the restaurants in the hotel/casino, but really how was I going to remember a list of 12 places? There was a set of brochures for the spa and room service, but not even a CVB town guide or a hotel map.  (i did call down to mention the damaged light so I wouldn't get charged, and was told maintenance would replace it. never happened).   The meeting rooms were overall nice and the banquet food was good plus the $10/glass of house wine made it taste all the better (seriously, how do they get away with that markup!).  The pool looked nice, but I didn't have time to visit. And with a 7 p.m. close except for the tiny hot tub (so i heard, didn't see it on a map), it seemed a bit unreasonable--especially considering night swimming is the most comfortable option for July in the desert.   And I wonder if I am the only one who visits from out of town who is a bit confused by the "We LOVE Locals" campaign going on through the entire hotel. Yeah, I came 500 miles to stay here for a conference, sure glad you 'heart' locals the best!

Wow a day at the spa. The massage therapist Thresa ---oh my goodness sooo amazing. I do massage for a living in California and she gets a five star. Incredible. All the girls employees were so wonderful-Sylvia, Lindsey, Mika were so helpful and so nice. Great job girls. Went in the lap pool and did laps, jacuzzi, hot steam sauna. Excellent! Highly recommend this resort  and so very clean the facility. Thanku-you.

I went here for my birthday last year. The martinis are amazing!!!! The food was ok. The price for the food, I would have expected it to be better than it was. I hands down would recommend the dirty martini. The stuffed olives are amazing!

Really nice little area off the strip to dine, drink and gamble. You can avoid the hustle and bustle of the large casinos and enjoy a more conservative approach. Pizza joints and healthy food joints bring different people out here. It's like an outdoor mall with an indoor casino.

I do really enjoy coming year. The rooms are always playing great eating and shopping. The movie theater doesn't hurt. You only problem I've ever had was getting a drink from a cocktail waitresses. I said something to one of them once about the long wait. She replied because it was she had two stations that Evening. I know how rough that could because  I have friends who are also cocktail waitresses.
My favorite resort and spa. The spa is the best for locals and the pool is amazing too!

We stayed at GVR; only because we had our dog with us - GVR accepts pets, albeit with a $100 per stay charge.    You've read all of the cons about cab rides to the strip being expensive, lack of excitement, etc that are all true - but these may also be good things depending on the type of Vegas you're looking for.  Hey, if you're looking to hook up, people watch, or tear it up every night then GVR isn't the place for you.  If you're looking for a relaxing get-away in a serene environment with a great pool & spa, then do consider GVR.  My wife and I go to Vegas at least four times per year (staying at strip hotels) and really liked the laid back off-strip concept.  The restaurants were good, the spa excellent, and overall about 30% cheaper than similar strip offerings.   Oh, and our dog had a great time too.  Lots of places to go for walks, and they have a dedicated doggy-do area too.  This was a VERY different Vegas vacation for us - but we really liked it.

First came here for a few days recovering from back surgery one year ago. The pool was perfect for me. Easy access, the price (comps) was right, the time was perfect. Now we're back a year later and we think it is even better than before!

This is a locals casino, lots if action slow beverage service but tip em and they be around often. Lived out here for 10 yrs and Stations is a locals place. Cheap but good food reasonable perks with gaming

This is a review of the casino not the hotel.  It's spacious and well maintained.   Having visited other Stations Casinos over the years, this property is probably the nicest in my opinion.  It was well thought of in terms of layout and design. You don't feel cramped when playing or even while walking around the property.  The tables and machines are clean not cigarette burns that I noticed. The trash bins weren't full, which means they have enough staff/porters.  The only thing I encountered was a down roulette machine which needed attention. A crew came out and tried to work on it and was accompanied with a floor manager. Also, the pit bosses were unable to keep track of play as their base computer was also down. Weird as a $1.4 million payout had just happened the previous night on the Buffalo Machine.   The restroom I went to was clean and bright. I felt safe on this property.  I would probably come back again. It's off the strip but worth the visit.   I probably earned a comped stay based on my play.   See you in a few weeks!

I have no real complaints. Really clean. Responsive housekeeping staff. I had a problem with their light switches... had to call for assistance with a high tech switch as it would not easily respond to my touch. Otherwise the stay was great. Loved their soap and bathrobes.

I enjoy coming to GVR to gamble. It's my local casino and the staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is very welcoming. The reason for my less than perfect review is based on my experience at the buffet. The food was okay, but that wasn't the reason I was disappointed. As soon as I sat the waitress took my drink order, a glass of water. I'm not sure what exotic body of water she was fetching it from, but it never came. When I asked another waitress after waiting 30 minutes, she expressed her enthusiasm of not helping me. Just to recap I will return to GVR, but will eat at many of fine places along the district.

Green Valley.....almost perfect....almost paradise.  Went for spring break, just for some weeknight gaming.... Clean, comfy, relaxing, friendly, TONS of VP Machines.... cocktail waitresses not the prettiest, but always comes around like clockwork.....  Dropped over a K in 2 nights......come now....looosen up those machines.....

WORST STAY EVER!!! The only reason why I'm giving this place even a star is because my bedsheets were clean. I booked the hotel as a last hoorah before the kids went back to school. We woke up to no power, no internet, our TV blew a fuse and started smoking, and then our freezer was leaking. I went to the front desk, they said the power outage was out of our control(not a problem) and they would fix it as soon as they could. I had to work and upload information to my site while I was here, (which I was unable to due to the fact the internet wasn't working) I tried to make the best of it. My husband said he requested To speak with the manager, but conveniently he was in a meeting and promised to contact him When he was done. We spent the entire next day at the pool, not one phone call... And just came back to no television because the fuse that blew has still not been fixed. Can't wait to take a photo of that one! Ross was the manager. Gehrig was the loser front desk that " was taking note." I never write horrible reviews. EVER! This one is one for the books! Shame on you GVR!!!!!!!!

AVOID!!!  AVOID!!!  AVOID!!!     WORST CASINO IN NEVADA!!!      0 stars!!!  Horrible gaming---Horrible customer service!    My friends, family and I will NEVER play/stay there again.  I tried to play a game of blackjack there.  I sat down one spot next to 1st base.  My father was already sitting at 1st base.    There was a lady at 3rd base---as soon as we sat down, she said that bad luck had just entered the table.    She proceeded to lose the next 2 hands, and blamed my father.    A couple hands later, I was able to play (I sat down a minute after my father, but missed the beginning of the shoe).  Not much happened after a few hands, and then there was dealer change--to Alberto.  I played a hand or two with Alberto, then was dealt a 16 with an 8 showing.    Typically, I play by the book; however, when a 16 vs 8 came up, I wanted to get the table's opinion.  The lady at 3rd immediately snapped:  if you have to ask what to do, you shouldn't be here.  OK, whatever.  She proceeded to lose the next 2 or 3 more hands, while my father was winning.  Pissed off, she left muttering some words about us.  I thanked God the bitch left.  Alberto the dealer said to me:  hey, don't call her a bitch--she's just calling it like she sees it.    I was just trying to get the opinion of the table--I know how to play 16's vs an 8.  Besides Alberto--who asked you?  I didn't ask for your opinion, so don't say anything more and deal the cards.  Alberto threatened to kick me out, then called the pit boss over.  So, let me get this straight, she's nasty and mean to me and my father since we sat down, get blamed for her losses, and when I try to ask for her opinion, she snaps back with a nasty comment.  So, I call her a bitch--yet I'm the one that gets in trouble?  We left after 10 minutes and went to another of the 1000's of casinos in the area.  Why even bother with this post?   Because Green Valley Ranch  -doesn't treat everyone the same,  -has extremely bad customer service,  -and hires people like Alberto --taking my statement completely out of context, offering his unasked for opinion, and threatening to kick me out.    I can't believe this place is rated like this--this place is a dump--we only went there because it was in between the people we were meeting.  Needless to say, I will NEVER go back--who wants this kind of action (with the lady) with this kind of dealer who takes things out of context, when there are 1000's of casinos in the area?  Just wanted to share my experience.

I really wanted to like this place but couldn't. We wanted to relax at a pool and didn't realize it was Memorial Day weekend when we booked, so we ended up here, far away from the crazy Strip!  Firstly, my taxi dropped me off at the casino. You must walk about a mile to the lobby and it's incredibly confusing. Most taxis have a hard time picking up and dropping off here. It's really stupid the layout. It causes so much wasted time and headache and confusion.   Secondly, the food is crap. We asked to see the buffet and quickly walked out. The salad looked awful. They wanted $40 to eat garbage. No thanks. We took an Uber to Served to try a local brunch and it was great! Avoid the food here at Green Valley.   Thirdly, the Starbucks in the lobby is painfully slow. We waited 15 minutes to order and gave up.  Fourthly, our main purpose for this trip was pool relaxation. We arrived at the pool and nobody was there to give us towels or help us. We finally found a place to sit and then the wind picked up, knocking an umbrella over and it hit a woman in the head. Fire department came and took her out in a stretcher. Wind stopped but they made us all close our umbrellas. That was MISERABLE in the sun all day. It cut our pool day very short.  Fifthly, the girls who work the pool as waitresses are some of the biggest bitches I've ever met. We wanted to ask a girl about the reserved seats and she couldn't be bothered. In fact, she said she'd be right back to speak to us but never did, so we never rented the $100 seats. Glad we didn't because they had to close their umbrellas too. Poor service from Nevada girls that looks like burnt toast.  Sixthly, the walls in our room were PAPER THIN. I mean, I could hear the lady next door talking in her normal voice. Around 6 AM I had to knock on her door to ask her to be quiet. She apologized but wow, we could hear EVERYTHING. I did not get good rest there at all.  Overall I find it hard to say this place is a "resort". It was more like a glorified Motel 6.  Pros: pretty driveway and plants. Great valet guys. Lobby service is helpful and friendly. Pool looks pretty. Vineyard garden is pretty.  Cons: paper thin walls. Pool full of children. rude ass pool waitresses who lie and hate girls that are prettier than them. $14 mojitos in a tiny plastic cup. $8 Heineken 12 ounce cans. Pool umbrellas can't be opened when they send someone to the hospital. Sunburns. Casino is a maze with no exit to street (be warned). Taxis can sometimes take forever. Starbucks in lobby is slow as mud. Buffet food is of poor quality.

Gorgeous local casino! Probably one of my favorites.   Rooms are spacious, bright and clean. Huge bathrooms so thats a plus!  Tons of Amenities. Spa, pool, restaurants...  The pool..love it! Its not tiny like some lol casinos. It has a beach side sand entry. Fun for the kids! They also have an adult pool if your traveling without kids.  The district is right outside the casino so that allows for shopping and some extra spots to eat.    Super cute area!!!

We had some flooding in our room via the next door neighbors so we asked to get moved to another room.  Luck for me and my wife they were sold out and they had to bump us up to a high rollers suite.  OMG this suite had two rooms and two bathrooms.  Had an outdoor patio.  Huge flat screen TV.  They said they hardly have anyone in this room and I couldn't imagine how much it would have cost. They have an excellent spa.  We both got a massage.  It was fabulous. The casino is cheaper than the strip so I gambled there then we took the shuttle to the strip to see a few shows.  The downfall was it only drops you off at the end of the strip so we had to hike a bit to get to the show. A little hint.  If you are a Coke fan and can't stand Pepsi (like my wife) there is a theater within the resort you can get a large Coke there.   We peeked in the adult only pool.   There were a few elderly people there so we didn't walk in.

I recently spent 3 days here on a quick trip to Vegas. I wanted to stay on the strip but a conference was being held at Green Valley Ranch which we were attending, so I didn't have a choice. My overall impression of the place was positive. Very clean and beautiful exterior, friendly and helpful staff, nice grounds and pools about the place.  When I first arrived I wanted to upgrade from a standard double queen bed room to a suite. I was told that would be no problem, and I even signed an updated "contract" (or something) guaranteeing me the room. The next day, when I was supposed to change rooms, they called me and said due to a poker tournament, there were no suites available at all. Despite my signed paper and guarantee of the suite being available. Now this place is huge, absolutely huge, there must be at least a thousand rooms - I know all hotels and resorts keep a certain number of suites available for "special reasons." I was not happy about this.   Apart from the suite blunder, I had a good experience here. The rooms were spacious, clean and well-lit. Old tube-style TVs (not flat panels) and a lack of a fridge that was capable of staying cold however put a damper on things. Beds were thankfully comfortable. At times, the over-21 pool would be blaring rap music which was obnoxiously loud, but I can look past it. Self parking is quite far from the hotel which somewhat forces people to utilize the valet - free, but you've gotta tip.  I would say this is a decent place to stay if you're looking to save some money and sleep off of the strip. It's about a 15 minute drive to the strip via I-215, and because it is not confined to the limited space of the strip, the resort is sprawling and does not feel boxed in (like many of the strip resorts). I'd stay here again.

I love this spa! The 2 attendants that's checked me in were very friendly. The 2 attendants and he bottom of the stairs were very friendly but they didn't tell me exactly where to go. The amenities are wonderful! I love the hot tub waterfall in the women's lounge although There were towels everywhere on the floor. I wanted to try the eucalyptus steam room but it did not smell very good or eucalyptus-y. I skipped it and enjoyed the steam room. Tina was my technician and she was divine! The epitome of hospitable service!

It might not b as exciting as bellagio aria or the Venetian but this is a solid hotel casino with great restaurants and a nice theater.  It's always clean and maintained. The spa and pool are  next to a vinyard. The district, located next to GVR has many more restaurants and stores.

We love GVR!  We are locals and visit either GVR or the M on occasion.  These are the places we take guests and suggest they stay if they are not staying with us.  Always good reviews.  I agree that the M usually has some sort of convention going on and that drives up the room rates and also fills up the table games.  Disappointing.  However, no matter what's going on at GVR they are on top of it.  The staff is great! They have the best/friendliest dealers in town, well, maybe other than The 4 Queens.  We usually have a great time here!  The buffet is ok.  Not great for the money.  The M is much better food and food quality.  However, The Grand Cafe is a GREAT option!  Wonderful food and great service at great prices.  We usually just go there.  Table games are great and there are plenty of options.  The reason they don't get 5 stars is that's very tough to get drink service while playing slots.  Very slow and not attentive, also the $25 "resort fee" is a stinker.  Just tell me what the price is and quit adding stuff.  Not cool.  Overall, you'll have fun here.

GVR is simply amazing in every aspect. The property is high class and you feel like you're in this majestic palace every time you're here. The rooms are fantastic, spacious and comfortable. Everything on property is immaculately clean also. Look at the floors shine!

Bait and Switch.  I suffered an illegal tactic here.  i was offered a nicer room at a slightly higher charge than the original room I was getting.  When I left the hotel they added the old room charge with the new room charge and doubled the bill.  The manager Ross Crane could not be reached or bothered to come out of his office.  Since they failed to post any room rate information on the back of the room door (as required by law), I now get to sue them for triple the amount.  These idiots sent the debt to a collection agency because I refused to pay the bait and switch demand.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL

I have not been back here for awhile but I was in the area and figured I would try it out. Mistake...  Horrible horrible horrible....once again servers walk right past me. Or they are running through so fast that they don't even give me a chance to flag them down.   What is the deal with getting drinks while you are spending money like they used to???   I might as well go to tribal casinos where I have to pay for drinks because that way I wouldn't feel so bad for complaining but it's seriously ridiculous. Servers are pointless. Why do they have them if they seem to pick and choose who they give drinks to. I spend quite a bit of money in stations casinos so if it's because they think I'm not spending enough...how do they know??   So, I use my card to check the perks at the kiosk. There was a guy using one in front of me. Something seemed to go wrong because it cut his sessions short and then the card wouldn't work. He tried several times but left. Then, the same thing happened to me. While trying to access the multiplier, it cut out and my card wouldn't work. So, I head to walk all the way to the players card desk.   First problem, some guy cuts right in front of me and not one employee stopped him. They helped him. I saw he was president but so am I. Not cool. Then, the guy that finally did help me had a really bad attitude and his manager MICHAEL was standing right there and did nothing. The employee was telling me I had to enter a pin code But I didn't want to. So, I asked him if he was making me change my code or just to enter to verify. He got upset and threw up his hands like I was supposed to know what the heck was going on. He repeated to me again to enter my pin and again I asked him if I was supposed to enter a new one or my old one and the gut couldn't answer. It was really frustrating to ME but the guy was acting like I'm the one bothering him!!?? And still, Michael the manager, was standing right there and did nothing. So, I actually stepped aside and asked him to assist because I was confused and my patience was running out with this guys attitude.   I still don't even know what happened but I guess I changed my pin...no one told me why or anything.   This is what makes me not want to spend any money in casinos. I'm already losing my money, So, can you at least talk with a smile and do your Damn job when it's needed?? I really don't appreciate bad attitudes towards me when I'm the customer or for any reason, for that matter.

Went to have dinner at the buffet and GVR raised their prices once again and now it is way too expensive for a buffet! Much better at Wicked Spoon over at Cosmo for around the same price for a more gourmet experience and way better desserts! Even Ceasars is much better for same price! The staff are nice at the buffet but the Sea Food wasn't worth the $29.99. GVR management should rethink  how they run GVR. The once nice hotel is failing fast. Needs updated design and better management. Casino has plenty of games that do not pay which makes the experience that much worse!

I don't understand some of these less than stellar reviews below... I've always had a fantastic time at GVR. I've stayed here many times and am impressed every time.   GVR is a resort hotel in Henderson, a suburb of Las Vegas. Unless I'm going to Vegas to rock the Strip until 5am with friends, I'd much rather be here. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and well-appointed. The bathrooms especially are really lovely and large.   The service is superb; you can call housekeeping and ask for anything and it will be there within 15 minutes. There's also an in-house movie theatre.  The restaurants are fantastic; Terra Verde and Sushi + Sake are some of my faves. The Grand Cafe is an easy choice for a casual meal any time of day and the Feast is a fine choice for your classic Vegas buffet.  The pool area is my favorite - there's a sandy beach walk in area for the kids, a shallow lounge chair area for the drinkers, and a lap pool for the swimmers. The waitresses are friendly and never too far away. The music is energetic and loud enough. They also have PLENTY of umbrellas, so you don't have to bake if you don't want to.  The spa is lovely. I've used it about 5 times and each time, it's the same. Lovely. There is a well-stocked locker room with all the toiletries you would need (and you can request others). The treatment waiting room is stocked with water, fruit, nuts, and really good teas. The treatment rooms themselves are a good size with low lights and soothing music. After many (if not all) of the treatments, you're given the opportunity to shower in a fantastic waterfall rock shower with about 10 jets. I always leave feeling happy and relaxed.  The hotel is also right next to The District, an outdoor promenade and shopping area. When it's hot, they have misters, and there's a nice mix of shops and restaurants there. In the evenings, there's music and a kids play area. It's also very dog-friendly with designated doggie bathrooms.   This is my go to hotel for a relaxing Vegas trip.

Great hotel! I love the rooms, the nature themes, the fun sand pool, dining outdoors... This place is seriously nice. Unfortunately, its REALLY far from the strip. Like $40 each way kind of far. Which realistically does not fly for anyone who actually wants to party in Vegas and hopes to hook up. I like to stay where the action is and this place is absolutely dead in the evenings.   I did the whole spa treatment here too-- my massage was heaven. There was good shopping in the area too. Again, for gluttons who want to get away.   If you want to go to Vegas but reject the whole concept of the strip, try Green Valley. It's pretty sweet. If you have a pulse however, you may want to opt for something else.

Great off the strip place to stay at. Rooms are quiet, spacious, comfy and very reasonably priced although you'll want to note that they tack on a $25/day for resort hotel fee. Guessing it's for the "free" wireless, pool use etc??  Awesome pool and really regal looking property. The pool beds are so comfy and nice to sunbath on.   The staff- so so. A mix of jaded and hard workers. Last time I was here I got lost trying to find my room (the layout is really weird and kinda annoying) I asked a worker they pretended to know and pointed me in the completely wrong direction. This time I asked a housekeeper member a basic question about towels at the pool "I don't know, never been there".  Casino is nice enough. Though as another reviewer wrote "casino is tight" so are the tables. They haven't treated me so nice (yes, I'm on day two of three at the hotel still). I'm hoping it will change around. If not the I'll be at the Palms on day 4. Yes, yes I jump around alot in Vegas.  The Sushi place is A-ok. A lil overprice, not exciting or very good quality sushi. I got a thing against sushi being served anything but slightly chilled.   The Pancake House, YUM! Great breakfast and lunch items for regular prices. Anything you want breakfastwise. Including some new stuff like Bacon Waffles or Pancakes. Not my thing but a friend of mines says they're bomb.  NEWAYS...I prob should go enjoy the premises. I guess Yelp has become serious part of my life...uh oh!

Beautiful, newer, clean, located in the swanky "District" area great for shopping. Large parking lot. Perfect for getting away from the madness of the strip but still feeling like you are in Vegas! Hit and miss on the staff - wonderful hosts, some terribly sour waitresses. Games not too tight, had a great time. Some good eats there from the lower end Panda Express food court type stuff to a higher end steakhouse. High limits bar a good one, lots of machines and a lot of smoke, ugh! No getting around that in Vegas though. Similar to Red Rock casino - I think, same owners. Worth a drive to Henderson for sure!

We were here for a whole day at the pool and we were treated like VIPs with the utmost respect! Our server her name is Danielle she was Fan-Tastic!! This is a resort not a hotel. THAT is where people mess up. IT'S called a resort for a reason you go there you get treated as though your VIP everywhere you go. Don't be mad if you lose while you're gambling. That's part of gambling we took our grand children there to go swimming and we had such a wonderful day I can't thank you all enough! Sincerely, Kim

I don't live too far from this establishment and so as a local I do frequent this casino more then I do any other station casinos. If I can give any one advice it is to definitely get a players card and use it if you play. They mail free rooms, free bets, and free meals each month. Recently I received a free $75 bet each week for the entire month of July. So far I've won 1 time out of the three times but I will only use it if I'm in the area and I don't play more then the bet as I know that it is a way for them to lure you in and get you to play so much more and lose so much more so really $75 is nothing to them when you wind up losing more then that. Now with the free room coupon...Book it as soon as you receive it because they go FAST and it is only good for Sunday thru Thursday. Unfortunately I wasn't able to use mine because they were all booked for the dates selected. As for the rooms, although it is comped, it is worth it. Very clean, spacious, and doesn't give you a feeling of roaches dancing in the dark...so I'm sure the non-comped rooms are even better.   The pool gets a new paragraph because it is by far one of the best pools. It is half beach and half pool so it is fun for the kids because of the sand. I warn you that it gets extremely HOT during the summer so your children feetsies WILL burn so have them wear water shoes so they can enjoy it. There is also a wading section that is under a bridge so if you want shade during those HOT months then you got it. You can even put a chair in the water for relaxation. To use the pool it is free if you're a guest and you just have to show your room key; however $20 if you're just visiting. They're no too strict on this as we've managed to slip by without anyone charging...again, bring your room key (Hint Hint).   As for the Feast Buffet, it is decent. They used to have crab legs but they got rid of it a few months ago and just lowered their buffet prices. I'm thinking since they have a seafood restaurant in the casino, they were not making money because everyone was just going to the buffet. There is a nice lady that goes by "Mama" who used to saute the crab legs with garlic, tomatoes and some secret spice then she would ask how spicy you want it and boy were they yummy. She would always have a line and I remember waiting at least half an hour just so she could saute my crab legs...but worth the wait. Since they don't have crab legs you can still go to her and ask her to saute the shrimp from the shrimp cocktail bar. (don't forget to tip her)   As for bars, i like going to the sports book bar, play a little poker and get free drinks. My bar tender of choice is "Tyler". He's created my favorite Mai Tai drink with a twist...just ask him for his famous mai tai and he'll know what you're talking about.

This resort has a beautiful grounds and atmosphere, however, I give them 3 stars for two reasons: 1)  because of their outrageous resort fee of around $25.00.  2)  during our stay, a family member needed a wheelchair as they were not feeling well. The hotel was only willing to accomodate and provide the wheelchair if we gave them our drivers license for the entire day. Since I didn't feel comfortable giving them custody of our driver's license, I asked if they could just make a photocopy and keep that--they refused.  After speaking to several managers, we were told the wheelchairs belongs to the security company, and that it was THEIR policy to keep the drivers license. The hotel said there was nothing they could do to run interference with their security company.  Even though this was not Green Valley's policy, they are complicit with their security's policy and make it difficult for handicap people to get the aid they need.  We will not be staying here again. Simple as that.

We were upgraded (gratis) to a grand suite! Holy shit balls! I felt like I was on an episode of cribs! Beautiful room. I was the princess of the valley!!! Well, at least until check out!  I LOVE this place. If I run away from home - you will know where to find me. I love the relaxed atmosphere of the GVR. Quite lobby, semi-quite casino (not sure if that is good) Workers all seemed happy - their smiles didn't look forced. Beautiful decor. Beds - AMAZING! Towels - good. Water pressure - excellent. Jacuzzi tub...we bonded... Shower stall size - small. Not to mention someone forgot to install bathroom vents! What's up with that? Slots - the goddess of gambling was not in a good mood during our stay. Make sure you have a car - cab fare is about 30 bucks to the strip.

Really horrible service. Like other reviewers, I was at this hotel for a conference. The check-in process was horrible--waited 30 minutes in a huge line and it was chaos. My two friends had booked a room with two beds. Instead, they were given a weird "Austin Powers" room with one bed and shag carpet, and no apologies or promises to make it right form the staff. This property seems completely mismanaged. The food is also mediocre and boring. Lacking in accessible coffee in the morning and ATMs (on purpose?). The shuttle bus at the strip drove right past us and the staff was rude when I called and asked the shuttle to come back and pick us up from the strip. Also, interactions with the staff...some seem pretty "off" and colorful. Wifi was a joke. Would not stay here again.

My wife and I have been coming here about once a year for many years.  I like the relative quiet of being away from the strip in a self-contained resort.  It's a much easier drive from LA and avoids all the traffic of the strip.  My wife likes the adjacent shopping promenade that gives it an extra dimension.     Some people have complained that you have to do a lot of walking from the parking lot to your room to the casino, etc., but once you've been here a few times you get more efficient and know where to park and where to request a room (hint, staying in the West Tower will save you a lot of steps).    Rooms are comfortable, maybe a little dark. No longer do the guest rooms have coffee makers, but the coffee in the lobby is excellent.  Just get there before 9:00 am.  The casino is pretty spread out and has a lot of machines.  We like slots, but only the old fashioned spinning reels, not the pretty penny picture games.  Unfortunately, the trend tends to be to replace the old with the new, so there are a very limited number of slot machines that we like to play, and this is sad.  There are a lot of video poker machines as well.  The crowd in the casino is a mix of guests and locals, mostly locals, and it's a pretty friendly crowd.   We like the pool, my wife can spend the entire day there.  Water temperature is just like returning to the womb (I'm guessing).  Food at the pool restaurant is unbelievably good and has gotten better than it was.  I'm a little confused about their policy towards locals after reading another review from a spurned local.  When we were there early this week, the place was packed with locals, who seem to meet there each afternoon to party in the pool and make some noise.  This was annoying.  NIce spa, which we didn't use, and excellent fitness center, which we did.  There is a lap pool in the spa.  Food in the casino offers a lot of choices from the food court to the buffet to some high end restaurants.  I'll eat at the buffet if there is little or no line and I'm hungry.  Maybe a late breakfast there and go to a good place for dinner.  We had dinner at the buffet the day we arrived.  It's standard buffet fare, which some people really eat up. Our best meal was at Hank's (steakhouse), and it was truly memorable.  We will make it a point to visit Hank's on all future visits to GVR.

I played over 12 hours of poker here with the locals and it honestly beats any place on the strip. The room's aren't cheap, but definitely one of the nicer room's I've ever stayed in, especially at a casino. As a bonus there are a couple late night bars/clubs AND Fatburger is located seconds away from the poker room (and is open 24 hours)...

Hanks is amazing! I'm not a huge fan of going to the strip this is my go to to for date out any other local restaurant. My filet is always cooked perfect! I'm a creature of habit so I always get the same things, a few recommendations- the shellfish platter, tuna poke, cream corn, Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and the lobster chowder is killer. I get it every time! Hanks is so delicious I can't wait to go back. Side note- I'm big on customer service especially when dining at a formal restaurant and the staff here is always great

LOVED this place. The hotel was gorgeous and every aspect was just great...check-in, the room, view, the pool. Got it for a great price (there's a resort fee...boo) so if I could book it again for $60ish/night I'd definitely recommend it. I think I paid around $100 for the night after all fees were included. Just beautiful overall and would love to stay here again if I had the opportunity!

I have nothing bad to say about this hotel/casino!! I had a wonderful Memorial weekend here with my family and we all enjoyed it!  I think the only CON is trying to find valet but other than that here are my PRO's:  1) once u leave ur car at valet, all the workers there are SUPER welcoming!!!! They are all smiles & also open the entrance doors for you! The Valet drivers even offer you complimentary cold water when they bring you back your car!   2) They have starbucks at the lobby! Great for coffee lovers!  3) The hotel looks very luxurious! I love the interior designs!  4) The pool area is really nice! They have a beach club party on the weekends too until 4pm!  5) The beds are super comfy   6) Housekeeping is great!!! They brought my towels and sheets up super quick!   7) They let me use their mini fridge to keep my baby's milk cold (They dont charge you if you need to keep your medications cold & its $15 a night for personal use)  8) If you go eat at the buffet and sign up for a preferred card u get a huge discount! So worth it! Only paid like $15 for lunch! I also love the desserts they have at the buffet! Esp. Their ice cream 8)

Front Desk Very Rude, and that was two of them. My sister was checking in at the same time. And remember they get you for the resort fee per night 28.00.   Room Very Clean Need extra Electric outlets NO COFFEE POT They say free WiFi.. didn't work Short on towels and to call.  Restaurants The worst service I have ever had in the Coffee shop. And the coffee tasted like Folger's (ugh).  Went to Starbucks in the food court, gave them my debut card with my picture on it, they wanted to see my ID. For one cup of coffee. I have never been ask by Starbuck for a photo ID when I have it on my BofA card. So I went over to the Coffee Shop and got the Folger's Coffee (ugh). Whats a girl going to do when she needs her coffee fix.  Pool  Wonderful warm and clean Order lunch, Club with Fries, sandwich was as hard as a rock and cold. Fries where cold. Diet Coke was ok. Closes very early, like 7pm. which is a shame, night time swimming is so nice.  They have an Adult pool, which I wish the drunk's would use it and not have foul mouths at the pool and slobbering actions. Maybe they got kick out of the Adult pool?
