Didn't like my grand kids to see that. Had to explain why the women kept falling in the pool drunk and her drunk friends had to help her.   My obinion of Green Valley Resort and Spa, that cost an arm and a leg.  They need to update there rooms Have their staff go to a class on how to treat customers Get a new Chef in the restaurants  Get another type of a Coffee Bar in the food court AND INSTEAD ALL THE CANDY IN THE ROOM PUT A COFFEE POT IN THE ROOM
a great place for relaxation.  had a great new years eve party there!

We stayed here one night, and the next day my husband and I found bed bug bites on various parts of our bodies. Our room was not super clean either. A thick blanket of dust on the furniture, hair in the sink, and an itenerary from a previous booking was found in the top drawer. For these reasons, I do not recommend this resort.

It seems like Green Valley is a world away from the Strip and you don't want to stay here if you're planning on enjoying all that the Strip has to offer, but if you are looking for a high quality destination resort, this is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas.  Kids can be happy here with lots of food court, movie theater type amenities to keep them interested and entertained, and adults can enjoy the casino, nice rooms and some really good restaurants.  I especially enjoyed Hank's where the steaks were first rate. Rooms are very nice as well, and really the only complaint I have other than the distance from the Strip and price of a cab ride to get out here is the hotel layout is confusing, not well marked and downright bizarre.   It's the only hotel I've really every been in where I found it difficult to find my room and get around, and there doesn't seem to ever be any staff in the halls to help guide you along your way.  There is also a nice variety of shops attached to the property, so shopping can be fun as well. They aren't really as nice as being at the Encore/Wynn with its Espanade, the Canal and Palazzo shops at Palazzo/Venetian and having Fashion Show Mall across the street, but it's still not bad.  Overall a nice, inexpensive place to stay and enjoy a trip to Vegas.

Hotel is nice but there are some annoyances. Signs for parking are stupid and are misleading. Parking garages are not close to the rooms. I requested a room close to the elevator but got put at the end of a hall (difficult for someone with foot problems).

This was the perfect place to stay during my business trip in August.  The best part of my stay was Cherry, the mat Pilates instructor over at the fitness center.  I assumed it would be cake, but she really pushed me and I got in a great workout!  Cherry was extra nice, outgoing and accommodating.  Thanks Cherry! :)  The rest of the staff were also very courteous and helpful.   Rooms were large, clean and well appointed.  I ate at several restaurants in the casino, and found the "Grand Cafe" to be the most consistent.  To be honest, the food was pretty mediocre and my advice would to be stay in the $13-18 price range to avoid being disappointed.  Still, the dining options and quality did seem on par to what I'd expect from an off-strip Vegas hotel.  When I checked in I did have some issues with my room.  They booked me into a "smoking optional" (quite the doublespeak!) room, so i asked to have the room changed.   The next room  had problems with the HVAC.  They were fully booked, so I ended up with a smoking room anyway.  It's amazing how the smoke smell that's in the carpet and wallpaper still seem to get into the towels and even your clothing.   Still, it didn't ruin my trip.  I'd totally stay here again.

Beautiful and Has fun with my parents playing blackjack for my birthday. This is a regular stay for my parents and famiky.. Very clean beautiful rooms and friendly staff..  could have better food selection  but other than that. This place is classy and off the strip and the D ONT charge for parking! Very classy! Thanks for Making my birthday AWESOME!!

First time staying at Green Valley Ranch.  I enjoyed my stay and would be happy to return.   LOCATION * About 10 minutes from the south part of the strip without traffic. * Adjacent to The District shops and restaurants, which is nice.   ROOM I stayed in a "Superior King" room in the East Tower.  It's clean and comfortable, though not as large as other "entry level" rooms I've stayed in around town.  There's a desk, a lounging chair and ottoman, two side tables (one with a Bose stereo), and a mini-bar which is really just a tray with a few items on it.  No refrigerator in the room.  (I mention this because if you have medications that require refrigeration, you'll have to keep refilling the ice bucket.)  The bathroom is quite nice: large and clean with a separate large tub from a walk-in shower.  There is also a free-use safe in the closet.  Note: there is apparently free wi-fi in the room.  It never worked for me, and it never worked for friends in a different room.  I called the help desk; they walked me through some steps to try to get it to work, but it never did.  Air conditioning worked great!  I wish electrical outlets were more accessible -- for phone chargers and such.  I had to unplug the stereo behind an end table to plug in my charger to have my phone near me.   CASINO Fine.  I visited from Sunday through Tuesday; the casino was never too crowded.  Casino staff is friendly.  I love playing Bingo; the Bingo room is very nice -- but the Bingo session is a little pricy for a very modest payout and quick (55 minute) session.   RESTAURANTS Many of the restaurants were closed for remodeling during my visit.  I did visit Hank's during happy hour, which is fantastic.  The Feast buffet at breakfast was great as well -- just $8 for a large selection.  The food court has Capriotti's subs, a pizza place, Fatburger, a frozen yogurt place, a Starbucks, and another place or two.  I did not visit the Grand Cafe, but I did purchase from their pastry counter.  Delicious.   POOL Beautiful.  Nice 21 and over side pool as well.  Varied seating areas, from traditional lounges to sofas and cabanas.  Great area -- even after the pool closes at 7 p.m.   SHOPS There are two very small gift shops in the hotel, but GVR's adjacency to the District shops and restaurants is awesome.  Note: the District is an outdoor mall, so during the summer it will be hot.     SPORTS BOOK, MOVIE THEATER, ARCADE, EVENTS CENTER Of these, I only visited the arcade (disappointing as a 40+ year old, but probably enjoyable for kids).   SERVICE Very friendly staff at every stop.   NUTSHELL I enjoyed it here.  I love the look, decor, location, service, and amenities.  I visited because of a Groupon deal, which was fantastic, so be on the lookout for those.

My very first time being able to gamble!!  This review is strictly for the casino. My grandma lives around here and I finally came to Vegas to start house hunting and she wanted to show us around LOL.  This casino is so nice and I didn't feel like we were in a boatload of cigarettes either! They must have good ventilation even though there were quite a few smokers it wasn't unbearable! Most casinos make you plug your nose from all of the smoking!  I mostly went for the penny slots and they had a huge selection! I'm happy to say I made my money back LOL! There was only one weird thing that happened while out on the floor. My mom and I were sitting next to each other at the machines and one female employee walked past me giving me a weird look and then a few minutes later a male employee asked us if we wanted to sign up for their rewards card, he did my mom's in two seconds but then when it came to my turn he took my ID somewhere and was gone for a bit, I'm not sure if I looked so young that they wanted to card me but it was random and awkward.   He should of just asked me flat out, and I wouldn't have had any problem showing my ID. There's a few other casinos my grandma wants to show me so I'm not sure if I'd come back on a basis.

Complete jerks. Asked to see my ID, told them it was in the room. They followed me like a criminal back to my room and when I showed them my ID they continued to 86 me from the property because they were embarrassed that they were wrong. They refused to give me a refund for my hotel costs and refused to let me collect my things from the room. I will smear campaign them like no ones been smeared before.

Nice place, the staff was very pleasant however they did not seem to be very knowledgeable of the facilities.  Even with their website directions it was very difficult to find the valet parking entrance.  Quite a hike from the rooms to the Casino which is on the second floor??.  The "off strip" room rates kind of compensate.  We did not go to the strip because it seemed like a lot of extra work to get there.

First off I get it, your pockets are not going to be affected by the loss of my presence but I've spent thousands of dollars at your casino. So today I won a bet on the KC game so I decided to treat myself to prime rib. I pay, tip the same amount as much check and then on my way out I grab a pastrie. I gave the lady $5.25 and then I walk away. I suddenly get stopped by the same lady in which she tells me that I still owe 18 cents. For taxes. I get it. So I go to pay and use my points. Which came out to 15 cents. So I am short 3 cents and all I have is $100 dollar bill. I see 3 cents on the register thinking the lady would gladly offer me the three cents. NO. She makes me break my $100 dollar bill for 3 cents when I just tipped the bar tender nearly $20 dollars. I live across the street and always place my bets at your casino. Even when I told the lady your willing to lose my business over three cents she laughed. So I will never step foot in your casino again. Over three cents.

Maybe if you end up coming here for a vacation with your own schedule, the place is perfect, but my main complaints are the offerings for the working professionals who have to attend busy days of conferences and seminars.   Some of the decor is very dated, but they are undergoing a very large and loud remodel... so maybe that will bring it up to 2016 standards.  There are several events going on here throughout the week in the many venues, conference centers and function areas. Concerts, business meetings, seminars, trade shows... So, after a busy day, wouldn't it be great to relax at the pool? NOPE! Closes at 5:00!!! WTF?! Why does the pool have MOM hours?! The same goes for their Red Rock location.   Have to attend a dinner after a hectic day and want to swing by the gym later to move around a little because you've been sitting and gorging for hours? It closes @ 7:00! Good luck running your ass across the compound and through their labyrinth of tunnels to get their before the door locks! :(  This place is a *part-time* resort. It has nice amenities, but if you're there for business, there's a slim chance you'll be able to use any of them.   The staff is very nice and accommodating (not saying they will open the pool for you after 5:00 pm or anything, but they can give you a spare lip balm if you ask nicely).

We stayed here for a few nights for a conference. Got a Mediterranean Suite to share with 3 others. It was pretty nice.! Two separate king bedroom, living room, dining room and an outdoor patio with a fireplace. It was a great room!  The people there were all very friendly and helpful.  They had a great outdoor pool with a San box for the kids. Actually, this place seemed like a very family-friendly resort and casino.
Thank you Green Valley for making this stay such a great experience. You have definitely made up for our last stay. Kudos to you.

One, relatively huge problem.   One shuttle to get to the strip.  Leaves every 2 hours starting at noon.   You have to get a voucher 30 minutes prior to guarantee your spot or you're out of luck. Its a small shuttle. It's time consuming and not expected In a resort like this.  If this was a no frills cheap hotel like circus circus or the rio, I'd understand. But it's not and its a terrible system that needs overhaul.     If you plan to spend time on the strip, I would not recommend this hotel.

good place to lay your weary head if you do not want the hustle and bustle of  a regular casino hotel. nice huge pool area with zen type decor and bar. pricey...pricey ...pricey... not recommended for people who would like the strip traffic coz this place is far from it and would require a car. nice to experience once .

Stayed here in early May 2016 for a girlfriends getaway.   The resort is expansive with beautiful landscaping. While undergoing several remodeling projects the areas are carefully hidden and there is very little noise or dust.   *Amenities: Several outdoor cabanas offer seating areas and there is a small outdoor fireplace. The fireplaces were on during the evenings but surrounded by smokers. The rooms are equipped with hair dryer, magnifying mirrors and plenty of towels. The bedding is comfortable and soft.   *Spa: The GVR spa and exercise room are excellent! The locker room area has robes and sandals and small keyed lockers. There are several vanities with hair dryers, curling irons and flat irons. Amenities such as tooth brushes, shampoo, lotion, razors and water are also available. Outside of the sauna are iced towels. Everything was clean and beautiful. There is also a co-ed area with an outdoor fireplace and seating area. The spa treatments are overpriced, however the service quality was excellent and the massage was well worth it. Going to the spa is well worth it even if you aren't getting a service. The exercise area has free weights, several treadmills, stationary bikes and elliptical machines. It overlooks the spa pool area. During one workout a couple was making out at the spa pool and the woman took off her bikini bottoms. Another man was laying out and looked like he had just taken Viagra and was rocking back and forth on his lawn chair.   *Food: Starbucks- Expect approximately $1 price hikes. The smokey casino smell did not affect the store area. The service was rude and unfriendly. Dukes- great happy hour with half price cocktails and appetizers. Had the espresso martini and it was awful. The espresso was burnt. The bar was a nice place to stand and we met several interesting people and had great conversation. There is live music and she was excellent!  Borracha is the brand new Mexican restaurant. It is excellent!!! They have an all you can eat taco Tuesday with wonderful margaritas and street tacos. Great service and atmosphere.   *Pool: There are several beautiful pools. The largest is a family friendly area with great seating and service.   *Parking: Uber friendly with 24-hour complimentary valet. I regret not being able to tip the amazing service. Bring cash!

I have been to Vegas many many times, but I always experienced it as a 'tourist.' This was the first time I tried it as a 'local' and I'm not sure I will ever go back to being a tourist again.  Stayed Thurs - Sun at the GVR, which is located approximately 20 minutes from The Strip. For many people, the distance might be a turn-off. Let me assuage your concerns. It is not a big deal at all.  First, the pros: I booked travel vouchers through TravelZoo. Got the Thurs. night stay for $75 and Fri & Sat were $100 each. That included everything except a $25/day resort fee and the hotel tax. Did I mention it also included a $25/day resort credit? The resort fee includes internet and spa use, among other things. This is significant because many of the properties on The Strip charge you a resort fee and then an additional charge for spa or internet usage.  Then, thanks to a snafu which isn't worth mentioning except that the manager Diana took care of it really quickly, I got upgraded to an Executive Suite. That's 4 days/3 nights in a suite for $275. Try and beat that on The Strip.  Blessings to all of the valet guys (I remember Michael and Jayson but there were several others who were all great). A huge shout-out to the concierge who hooked me up with guest list access to Tryst on Thursday night and Marquee on Friday night. Thank you to pretty much everyone on the staff, from the front desk people to the clerks who opened the front door for me every time I left for my car, to the maids who cleaned the room. First rate service.  The property offers at least four separate pools, including an adults-only one called The Pond (which is great for when you don't want to be around kids) and a main pool which has a sandy beach area in it.  The Spa is first-rate, complete with flat-screen tv's in the hot tub area. Perfect for watching football and relaxing. There are a couple of bars on the property as well. Sports Book area offers $1 beers and $1 hot dogs on football game days. Are you effing kidding me?!  And I ate extremely well (they have a $25 all you can eat crab leg feast at one of the restaurants) with no buyer's remorse, because I had the $25/day resort credit, so everything was just cheaper.  Sure, GVR tries to 'sex' things up a bit by having a Brazilian pool party - complete with bikini contest - on Sundays and they have bikini model servers in the Lobby Bar on Wednesday nights. But don't mistake this resort for a 'sexy' hotspot. It is, ultimately, a place to relax (or gamble, if that's your thing).  But again, getting your 'fix' of The Strip is no problem when it's such a short drive away. In fact, really my only gripe with GVR is that they still have the old tube tv's in the rooms. It's 2011. Time to replace them with flatscreens. And preferably with screens that are larger than 20". Oh well, not a huge deal.  I was in town for a convention which was being held at The Palazzo (which I've stayed at before and adore, btw). Suite at The Palazzo - even with the 'convention special' was $260/night. So, in essence, I saved over $500 on lodging costs by staying at GVR. The savings paid for my night at Tryst, my night at Marquee, a fantastic dinner at Otto, my rental car and even my gas money to and from LA.   Like I said before, I'm seriously considering never staying at a property on The Strip again. If you're dead set on staying at a 'hot, happening' property, then this is not the place for you. But if you're traveling with a family or if you're open to trying something different, I would recommend giving GVR a try. I did and I don't regret a moment of my stay.  Trust me; I'm an Elite. ;)

Took the GF here last weekend for her birthday. This is my new favorite place in Vegas. Not the party pool scene like some places in Vegas, but if you are looking to just relax it is great. Thanks to one of the previous Yelp reviewers for mentioning the pool at the fitness club. I don't think most guests realize this pool is even on the property. It is bigger, cleaner, no kids, and very quite with beds for louging. The also have drink and food service from the bar up here. The pool bar food was better than I expected. The steam room is also awesome. The main pool was too full of kids and loud. We went to the Pond one afternoon, and while it is very small, it is a pretty good place to post-up if you want to party.  Our room was very nice with a pool view...we received an upgrade since our room still wasn't ready. I love the casino here because it is never too crowded and not overly smokey. The table limits for Blackjack and Pai Gow is only $5. All the dealers were nice, as were the front desk folks.  Hank's Steak House also has a martini happy hour 7 days a week from 5 -7. Very good martinis. The strip is only a $30 cab ride, but everything you need is on property, or very close. We walked over to the Cheesecake Factory one night for dinner.   Befoer we even left the hotel we were looking for a good weekend to come back.

Be careful renting a cabana here. We called to reserve on on a holiday weekend, but they wouldn't take a payment over the phone, just said that they put us on the list to have a cabana. We called in the morning to let them know we were going to be there after 11am, GVR said ok no problem. We get there and they have no cabana available. They said they always overbook and give it to who's on the list...and suddenly they DON'T have our name down & said we never called to reserve anything. Super pissed.  They finally gave us a cabana after screwing us around, and when we went to pay our drink & food tab, they said we had to meet a $300 food tab. None of that was ever said to us to begin with and now they're trying to make us order $300 worth of food/drinks before we can go. WTH?  One of the guys came up to us and said "that should've been told to you when you called and reserved the cabana"...hi...according to you, we NEVER called...then the topper, when we finally get our bill settled once they realized we were not going to pay the $300 minimum, they run our cards incorrectly and add in that we bought sweatshirts. OMG. We will NEVERRRRRR come back again. Too many issues

Thought for sure that Red Rock was my favorite off strip casino, but this place is equally good.  It's also equally just as far from the strip too.  Casino is large with many cheap tables and slots.  A shopping complex, called the District is just outside it's door.  Restaurants are good but not outstanding here.  Movie theaters and a food court is also in here.  Kind of a perfect spot for a family reunion get together in Vegas.

I'm at a wedding right now doing this review I have to express my utmost disappointment with their catering Imagine being in a reception where half the guests are waiting for food STANDING watching half the guests enjoy their food This is my first negative review Sorry not sorry!

I love staying at GVR. The hotel is absolutely stunning. It is clear that the designers really put the time in to make this place feel like a top notch resort. Every time I stay here I make sure to request a room with a pool view because it makes the experience so much more wonderful.

This place is under some sort of management change.  Used to play here a lot, like everyday. They added more Pai Gow tables, good move in my opinion as that table tends to fill up quick. Then they dropped the Progressive Jackpot from $100k to $12k.  That's a significant drop. I've been playing regularly for over 20 years and have never gotten the progressive pot before but to drop it down to $12k has just drew the line for me.  We will no longer be going there till they reverse their poor management decision.

Super nice property! Awesome pool, great restaurants, excellent workout facility with spa, plus great shopping next door. There's more than enough things to keep you busy here. Alot of amenities for the price and much more affordable than comparable properties on the Strip. I would give it a 5 but a non-smoking room is a bit of a misnomer. We had to change rooms twice before we truly had a non-smoking room (one that didn't reek of smoke). Rooms are super nice and the staff was vey helpful and accomodating. Overall would highly recommend this place.

I stayed at Green Valley for a sales conference that my company was hosting. It was a great venue for meetings. The food was good and the resort offered enough of a variety for us to meet in small groups when the time allowed. Great place!!

Tons of penny slots w max bets of at least $2.   There is also a large No Smoking area - however, like every other casino I've been to, you have to walk thru the smoking area to get there... which makes no sense at all. Overall, every staff member I came across were very helpful cordial and friendly.   The best time to come - to avoid the crowd - is after midnight

Green Valley is definitely a top favorite casino of mine. It's what I consider a locals hidden gem. The interior is beautiful, almost reminds me of the Titanic- a classic elegance feel. The buffet is the bomb, borracha is so good especially for taco Tuesday, and this only casino that I feel actually pays out well.

When my fried promised to take us to a cheap buffet off the strip I was expecting something kind of ghetto, but this place was actually really nice. From the outside it looks like a strip mall, but the inside is pretty.   This review is for the casino and the 13 dollar dinner buffet. The casino feels really new and doesn't reek as much of smoke as other casinos. The buy ins go as low a 5 bucks so I'm a fan. It's not as crowded and caters to an older crowd. Now, the buffet is AWESOME for the price of 13 bucks. (Make sure to sign up for a free players card first at the rewards center) My favorite was the seafood pasta, green beans, and carrot cake. But they have quite a bit of food. Our server was really friendly and I would come back here for the buffet alone.   I also learned how to play pai gow here and got a free lesson my Asian dealer who looked at me like I was nuts for playing when I had no idea how to play. I ended up losing but it's ok. ^.^ If you happen to bring any foreigners here, make SURE to bring passports otherwise, they will have to kick you out.

I've seen this place on a tv show so I was excited to check it out. Went and got a player card which took $5 off the buffet. The buffet wasn't that good. Shrimp had their tails so it created an extra step for me before I shoved them in my mouth, and they weren't tasty. All the employees appeared to hate their job. I waited a bit to get seated and there was no line. Even paying for the buffet I was behind someone but the register behind me was empty and they just kept on talking with other employees until I went over. Behind the food line employees were complaining about someone. But the players card had some fun stuff on it.! I also won $$100 bucks so that was fun. Then my friend dragged me out of the casino. Oh forgot to mention the buffet was 37 for two people which is cheap for Vegas. But you get what you pay for.

We have 2 rooms here with a room key for senior prom! The AZZhole security guard, WE WITH A ROOM KEY which is policy, would not let us in. WHAT KIND OF FKRY is this? AND ITS STORMING? My beautiful daughter in her prom dress. Never ever do I get so feisty that I want to use my vaporising powers to disintegrate a stupid fk face from the face of the earth, this was the case.   The security guard apologized for his actions and was let go for his unkind ways. It's simple. Treat people the way you want to be treated especially when you have a room key to get to your room!  Life is simple.

We stayed this weekend as a stay-cation at GVR.  This review is for the hotel and the pool/cabanas. We had purchased an early check-in (between 8-11 am) so that we could head to the pool right away on Saturday morning.  We arrived at 9:00 am, and were told that our room just needed to be inspected and then we could check in.  We went to the buffet, ate breakfast, and at 11:30, when no one had called to say our room was ready, we returned to the front desk to see why.  We were then told the room needed to be cleaned, and again, we would be called when it was ready.  At 12:30, we were finally called to get into the room.  So much for the early checkin...  We had a room upgrade to a Grand Suite, which was large and comfortable.  The shower was not the greatest - it seemed as though the shower head had been replaced with a basic model, and it sprayed all over the place.  Not a relaxing shower, to say the least.  Also, the televisions were both old tube TVs - surprising for a hotel of this quality and the suite room.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, though.  Our experience at the pool brought our review down a star.  We rented a cabana both days.  The first day, it was overcast, and the cabana attendant comped the price of the cabana as long as we met the food and drink minimum.  The pool was quiet, the food was good, and we had a relaxing, albeit cloudy day.  The next day, Sunday, however, was the complete opposite.  We got to the pool early and ate breakfast burritos to start working on the $150 food and drink minimum.  We did pay $200 for the cabana for the day as well.  For the first hour, it was peaceful and we were looking forward to another relaxing day.  That changed quickly when about 20 people showed up in the next two cabanas.  Over the course of the day, that almost doubled, with tons of kids and even a couple of newborns.  When we asked about the max occupancy, we were told it was eight per cabana, but sorry, they were overbooked for the holiday weekend.  We ended up leaving around three after chasing children out of our cabana, and being constantly peppered with water guns by children and adults alike.  When we brought this up to management, their response was "It was a holiday weekend."  No discount, not even an apology.  We could have just laid by the pool in a lounger and saved the $200.  Next time we will know better.  Wish we had known in advance about the lack of policy enforcement for the cabanas.   Overall, not a great experience, GVR.  Needs a lot of work to bring us back.  Especially when we can stay at other hotels for the same price and actually enjoy our pool experience.  And have flat screen TVs.

Ok, so I'm back. I came back for bingo and Pizza Rock for a family friend's 21st birthday this past Saturday night. This was the best birthday celebration that I've had with someone. He played E-Roulette for the first time and cashed out at around $25. Mind you that I wanted to try E-Roulette out too, but I didn't win as much as he did. We didn't win at bingo either, but my family friend had an awesome 21st birthday.

Driving in, this resort looks very nice and glamorous. Looked like we were going to a paradise. We took the kids down to play in the pool. The pool was very nice with a good size and even has sand on one end for the kiddos. I didn't like the fact that the pool was closed at 7pm though. They started kicking everyone out and the sun was still out. It's summertime! C'MON we wanna swim longer in the Vegas heat.  Furthermore, the life guard who was manning the tower wasn't really paying attention to the occupants of the pool. He was a younger guy, just fumbling around with this sunglasses, looking down and bored. Clearly not really doing his job. The rooms look pretty nice though, although I noticed the tile job in the restroom was a little bit sloppy. We had a nice view of the pool and jacuzzi. Overall, I would have given the place a 4 star if not for the things listed above.

Wonderful place to stay. We added one night here to turn our two-night trip to Vegas into three nights. So glad we did.   Pool is phenomenal with a sandy beach, and cushy lounge chairs. Ample umbrellas and poolside service. Rooms were super comfortable with a sitting area, luxurious bathroom, and comfortable bed. This place was recommended by a family member and we were so pleasantly surprised. This visit to Green Valley Resort changed our idea of going to Vegas...we don't want to stay on The Vegas Strip ever again.   Service in the Coffee Shop was very slow, but the food was delicious. Get their players card (Boarding Pass), you'll save money at the buffet and earn points! Highly recommended, and we can't wait to come back for another stay!

Gorgeous ! Give yourself a treat and enter through the lobby valet it's beautiful ! I love that I'm not rushed into the Casino as soon as I enter and I can take my kiddos right out to the pool to play in the sand !
Yeah, I would go back and play in their Poker room again.  It was smoke free which is a rare treat in Vegas.  Dealers and fellow players are friendly.
Love Green Valley. I come here for the spa.  Better than any strip spa because of the nice and private pool. A Hidden gem.

GVR is a meh'fest. They don't do anything great, but they don't really butcher anything either.   Food - OK. The buffet is standard, but you can count on it. The coffee shop is gone. China Spice has pretty good sushi. The Italian restaurant blows. Food quality at the casino-ran restaurants is average Station quality. If you've eaten at any Station restaurants more than once you know what I'm talking about. Food court is a win.   Gaming - OK. They have full-pay video poker, including Loose Deuces, but the denominations don't go up very high. They usually get the newest games, but they're packed for weeks after they come out. And the slot-club essentially sucks. 1,000 points = $1 cash back. And not even real cash back! And multipliers don't count! And full-pay video pokers is $4 to 1 point! There was a time when Boarding Pass was one of the best slot clubs in town..that's no longer even vaguely the case.  Amenities - OK. They have a movie theater. And a nice pool. Who doesn't these days?  Decor - Faux fancy. And that's faux fancy from 10 years ago. Typical Station.

I was fortunate to be able to visit Green Valley Ranch for the first time in January 2007. I am a myStation member of the Station Casinos and get many comps and offers each month at their various properties, but received an offer for 3 free nights here (quite surprisingly, as this is one of their more upscale properties.)  Arriving in Las Vegas very late on the first night, the layout of the property seemed a little confusing at first, which some users have commented about. It really helped out to stop and get a map of the property upon arrival. One thing to make note of is that the location of the casino in relation to the hotel lobby entrance are complete opposites. The parking garage out front is the first thing you'll see coming in off the highway, but the hotel lobby entrance is actually on the complete other side of the property, far from the casino. This is something to consider if you've got bags and are not using valet parking. I did happen to notice that there is a new parking garage, The Paseo Verde Garage, which is now located on the corner of Paseo Verde Drive and Carnegie (the property's surrounding back and side roads,) right next to the hotel lobby. This is definitely where you want to park, not only for convenience to the hotel, but it's much less crowded.  Check-in was very rapid and led to a couple of surprises. As many of you know, casinos very greatly in the incidental room deposits they charge people. Some don't charge anything, while others can charge a fortune. It was stated that there is a 19.95 per night resort fee, which I was expecting, but it was waived since it was a comp offer. I've never had to pay incidental deposits at any Station Casinos property. However, the front desk required a $150 per night incidental deposit, and this isn't stated anywhere directly. Being a slightly more upscale property, I guess they can get away with it, but it's important to watch out for these charges, at both check-in and check-out, especially if using a debit or credit card...your trip can get ruined as the money's gone as soon as you check in! I opted to pay the deposit in cash, which was no problem for them, and got it all back at check-out. (Probably better on my end, so I didn't spend all my money in the casino.)  The next surprise was when the desk clerk said, "We appear to be sold out of standard rooms." "What does that mean?" I asked. He said, "Well, we'll just have to give you a free upgrade." The upgrade was to one of the Grand Suites in the West Tower which normally run $650-$700 per night! I'd say, that was quite the upgrade, as comped rooms sometimes tend to be the cheaper, standard ones. Along the way, I heard the music pumping from the Whiskey Bar and I can see how the vibrations can affect guests in the East Tower, as others have mentioned here. When I got to Grand Suite 2203, it was like stepping into another world.  I haven't stayed in too many suites, so I had never seen anything like this place. I was almost scared to touch anything at first. A half bathroom was located in the foyer. Through the hallway opened into the living room, complete with a fully stocked martini bar (Grey Goose flavored vodka, bleu cheese stuffed olives, the works,) a mini-bar complete with everything from snacks to condoms, a solid oak table with four chairs, a dual-line cordless phone, a floor-to-ceiling painting of a nude woman, armoire with plasma TV and stereo DVD system, a fur-lined sofa, loveseat and coffee table.  Moving into the bedroom led to some more unique artwork, a recliner chair, a Bose DVD system, another amoire with TV and wet bar, and a large writing desk. Fur-lined pillows and Egyptian cotton sheets on the pillow-topped king size bed, along with huge closets everywhere. Safe, ironing board, laundry bags, completely stocked.  The bathroom was huge, complete with robes, slippers, a scale, a large jetted tub, dual sinks, a glass-enclosed steam shower and a separate toilet room.  Housekeeping and turn-down service were excellent, and came twice daily. The daily paper was delivered each morning at my door, which featured the newer electronic push-button "Do Not Disturb" signs.  The only restaurant I visited was Fatburger, which is always great. I don't patronize high-end casino restaurants and usually opt to save money by eating elsewhere. It was very convenient having several restaurants, supermarkets and pharmacies within a 2-3 block radius of the property.   To sum things up, this property is awesome, and this was one of my best trips to Vegas. I prefer the off-strip casinos and hotels, so this worked out great (especially the upgrade.) The location is close to some of the other properties I visit which was also good. The staff seemed very friendly and organized. I'd recommend Green Valley Ranch to everyone, it's like a whole little world far away from the Strip.

Nice hotel casino resort.  Nice location with shopping and restaurants within walking distance.   Been to the casino and shopping here several times.  First time staying at the hotel.  Comfortable beds, quiet and spacious rooms.  Very happy with my stay here.  I will return.

When it comes to the hotel itself and the entertainment available we were very pleased, however the service could have been better.  We arrived around noon and our room wasn't ready, now it was before checkin time - but we had made a note on our reservation that we would be early.  I was on crutches and had to wait 2 hours for a room.  The room we got was on the pool which wasn't a problem except for when there was a concert that sounded like it was in our room. I wasn't feeling well and couldn't sleep because of the noise.  We called the front desk to ask for another room and they would not accommodate us - they didn't even offer anything to make up for the trouble.  We took advantage of the spa, the pool and the casino floor and were happy with them all. The staff at the spa was awesome and our massages just as awesome.  The pool was just big enough to keep the grown ups from the adults which made it much more relaxing than other public pools.  The casino floor was a casino floor :) I don't know much, but there was enough for us to do.  One of the most important things to me in a hotel is the service and for that reason I can't give Green Valley Ranch 4 out of 5 - so 3 stars it is.

If you're planning a relaxing vacation at the Green Valley Ranch Resort, be prepared to have your room given away before you arrive and to be forced to sleep on a rollaway bed. Our long planned girls weekend away was sadly disrupted when the 4 double queen rooms (count them 1,2,3,4 rooms!) we reserved were given away (probably to the highest corporate convention bidder) despite arriving within an hour of check in time. An unsympathetic front desk scolded us for not reading the fine lines of our online reservation agreement and assured us that all the hotels do the same thing. Is that suppose to make me feel better?  Our much needed break from husbands and screaming kids tumbled into a wasted time trap of packing and unpacking and packing again with a dozen plus phone calls to the front desk, trying to get double queen rooms for at least one night. Our bags were piled high onto bell hop carts minutes before our spa appointments, just in time to pay a lot of money for massages during which our minds are racing with hopes of obtaining  enlightenment on how we became roomless at such a nice hotel.  Don't bother calling ahead to make sure everything is in order. It didn't work for us.

My wife and I just spent Labor Day weekend here and we are so glad we did.  The Green Valley Ranch is off the Strip and to us, especially on Labor Day weekend, that is a major plus.  It is perfect size, not crowded with a good size casino and great restaurants and bars to choose from.    We ate at the buffet a couple of times and it was good, as far as buffets go.  The selections are aplenty.  We went to Sushi + Sake and LOVED IT.  It was just what we needed because we wanted to eat light, but something tasty.  It definitely was that.  We went to Hank's our last night and were blown away.  The martinis in the bar are AWESOME.  (Try the ginger or pear one)  The service in the restaurant was AMAZING.  We really felt special and we are just regular people.  The rooms are nice and comfy, the bed is very nice and the bathroom was big and roomy too.  All in all, it was just an all-around great experience and we will definitely be staying there again at some point in the future.

I don't know wtf is wrong with this location. We go to Red Rock quite a bit and always have great experiences. We grabbed a room last minute on a Saturday at Green Valley Ranch and are trying to enjoy a pool day today.  The room we got was not clean. There was literally a band aid stuck to the bathroom floor from a previous guest.  The service at the pool is sub par.  We literally ordered a second pitcher of mai tia's in a pitcher half the size of the first and they are trying to tell us it is the same size. Come on Station's you are a lot better than this. Highly disappointed with Green Valley Ranch as a whole. The pond location is very nice for 21 plus but you can make the experience so much better.  I'm follow up to this I went to the concierge and gave them my cell number to talk about it with the GM onsite.  We will see if they call. If they make it right I will be the first to post the follow up.  But it's been 45 minutes so we will see.

We enjoy the elegant feel of this resort.  The pool area of the best.  The restaurant options excellent.  We have been here twice, and love being away from the strip while enjoying the climate and golf of the area. The only downside is learning to navigate the hotel from the west tower to the public areas, but after a day or so, you figure out the short cuts.  We love the rooms, the spa and the shopping next door.

We had a wonderful time!! Stayed here on a recommendation from a friend, I will be sending her a big thank you!! One of the nicest resorts we've stayed. Not overcrowded in the casino, dining choices for everyone. The pool area was perfect for families and singles. Didn't have time to take advantage of the spa but definitely will next we're there. We definitely will be coming back!!

Friendly service right when you walk in the door. Gorgoues views of the pool and their Christmas decor. I was nervous to try a new salon, especially after many failed attempts. I highly recommend Kassidy Howard,  professional and talented!

No POOL ACCESS at a 4-star where you PAY A RESORT FEE! unbelievable! Beautiful furnishings but the beach pool is shut down in 78 degree weather. Misery during a great long weekend holiday. ANd they have the nerve to charge a $27 RESORT FEE ON TOP OF YOUR HOTEL ROOM PRICE!!!!!! Although very far from the strip, reserved the place for Valentines weekend because it was 4 star hotel. Even encouraged 3 other friends to join up! Very unfortunate that the hotel management has decided to NOT OPEN THE POOL so it sits there in all its tempting beauty with cabanas and waterfalls all around.  Also, it's not as quiet in the room as you would expect. I can hear people in the two neighboring rooms talking.

Poor Customer service from valet: Drove in to Valet with my new $55,000  2014 RAM Hemi 4X4 and was treated like shit! Sorry I didn't bring my 2013 SA7 Audi maybe I would of been treated differently.  And Valet guys thank you for informing me you make roughly $65,000.00 a year. Perhaps a education on ethic and respect for those who help you to make your $65,000 a year would be warranted.   Poor Customer Service at Check in: Very Rude And Short with answers and response to my question. Perhaps at least a smile when you call the next person in line up rudely. I'm sorry I'm bothering you while your at Work!!!!!!  GO TO RED ROCK!!!!!!  Never staying at this hotel again management wake up!!!!!!! Your hotel and services are dated and lacking.

The staff at this hotel are uniformly pleasant, knowledgable and professional. In that sense it is a step up from the other Station Casinos properties. The pool is also a very nice place to relax - it is probably the best thing about the hotel, after the people.  Otherwise, this is a glorified Fiesta. Scratch that - even the lowliest Fiesta hotel room has a view. If you're lucky, you'll get a view of a parking garage at GVR - some rooms have views of walls. The high rates do go far in keeping some (but not all) of the riff-raff away, though in addition to the rates you will get nickel-and-dimed with resort fees, upgraded internet access fees (it's an extra ten bucks per night if you want a reliable connection for streaming), and insane prices in the gift shop and other outlets (three bucks for a bottle of Corona, three bucks for an iced tea in an eight-ounce cup at the pool).   It's a Courtyard that tries to pass itself off as a bargain-priced Four Seasons, but the design is defective. If you can get in here for 70 bucks a night (including the resort fee) and low expectations then go for it, otherwise you will feel short-changed.

Great, clean, nice place to hang out, bring your visitors, or enjoy a night out for locals. I really like GVR they have everything I could possibly need for a fun day or night. Love the sports book for betting or watching sports, dig the food choices with the buffet, the coffee shop and pizza rock - oh and panda and also capriotti's .. can't go wrong here. I don't gamble (thank god) so not to worry about that, and the smoking, I hate it although it is allowed, it's not to bad. Thanks GVR for providing the locals with a fun, classy, beautiful environment.

The resort was fabulous HOWEVER, we had items stolen out of our room. The resort denied any wrong doing on their part. We have stayed at many resorts and have never had this happen before. We even called the resort once we left and let them know that an item we reported missing was found and not stolen. The resorts attorneys sent our attorney a letter denying our request for video tape footage. We were honest and forth coming about what was stolen and were denied any resolution. The resort was fabulous but the aftermath horrible, we are done with Green Valley, too bad it was a beautiful place.

I love Green Valley Ranch for many reasons.   It's off the strip so not as hectic.  It has lots of great restaurants.  It has a very nice food court  It has excellent shopping.  The parking is easy.  I love the Casino It has a great movie theater It has activities for kids  The buffet is half the price and double as good in quality than any on the strip.   It's also close to Lake Las Vegas which is always fun to visit if you want to explore the surrounding areas around Vegas.

I don't know how anyone could have anything bad to say about this place ! We just got home after spending a long weekend at Green Valley Ranch.   Rooms- large! High ceilings, great decor and super clean!  Pool- the pool is perfect for kids and adults ! There is a sand area leading to the pool that is great for little ones. Plenty of lounge chairs and nice towels are provided ! We were super impressed with the atmosphere here !  Food- we did not have one bad meal! Everything was delicious. We had breakfast at he Grand Cafe (huge portions, well prepared , great service) Borracha (my husband and i shared  the carne -asada burrito, best carne I've had in awhile !!) and we had Pizza at Pizza Rock (we made it to happy hour for dinner. We all loved the personal pizzas for $7) all of the food on site was reasonably priced and we had great service all around.  Movie theater - how convenient to have a movie theater in your hotel!   Anyways, I think this facility deserves 5 stars and we are telling everyone we know to visit Green Valley Ranch !

This is a review of the casino:  My husband was on a winning streak at the craps table, and was accused of "cheating" and kicked out.  The truth is that a group of people saw him winning and started betting with him, so they were all winning.  The "house" lost big and got pissed.  My husband is not a clever gambler, and is still confused as to how you can cheat at craps.  It was pure, dumb luck.  When he went to speak with the head of security the next day, he was told that they couldn't explain HOW he was cheating, but that he just was.  Hmmmm.....So, you are happy to have us there as long as we are losing money, but when someone wins too much, they are no longer welcome???  Not cool, Green Valley.  In the end, you have lost a lot more money because our family and friends (Who used to frequent GV) now avoid coming there because of his treatment.
The buffet was great! Lots of variety of meats, loved the meatloaf in gravy. Prime rib, turkey breast, pork roast, etc. Mexican, Italian and Asian specialties.  Better than on the Strip.

Been our go to hotel since we found the gem 5 years ago. The pool area is amazing!  Staff is extraordinary and gaming is fun.  How this beautiful hotel/casino got  only 3 1/2 stars is beyond me!  Anyone that compares this hotel to the other nearby station hotels will be extremely disappointed if you go to any of them other than G.V.R.

Great place to stay if you wanna be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip but still be just minutes away from it.  I have taken my family to this Casino many times it is family friendly, has an amazing swimming pool area and at one time had the best pool are in Vegas.    Another reason I like this place is that you can still play a craps game for $5 on New Years Eve!   This is the time all the other Casinos on the strip raise the minimum bet to $25

GVR is a really nice establishment and has managed to not turn into "just another Las Vegas hotel and Casino". The rooms here are beautifully decorated and have a fully stocked mini bar (beware of pricing). The staff will make sure that you are taken care of and will not leave you feeling like you just blew a couple of hundred dollars on crap.    Being a local Las Vegan i like to enjoy a stay-cation from time to time and this is definitely one of my first choices. They have excellent dining facilities, and the quick bite spots. The theatre is really nice and they always have plenty of space for you to enjoy the latest flicks. Parking is close to the casino so you don't have to take a death march to check in, dragging your luggage and family for what seems like forever.

Nice casino  awesome  location. But why has all slots have high minimum  bet with very little or no payout. And don't  order a drink anywhere in Vegas while playing because you know that saying what happens in Vegas  stays in Vegas well so do the drinks.. they rarely come and if you get lucky enough for a watress  to ask ..the drink either never comes or takes forever... fyi..VEGAS. . We tip when we win and when drinks come... just sayn' give a little and you will get a lot back.. folks who win and get drinks are what made  Vegas... not rude servers tight slots and cocktails  that never arrive..
Saw Detroit at the Regal theatres.  Great service and place was clean and neat.  Food was good.  Movie depressing, but solid.

Love love love their pool area. The poolside bar is also a plus. Very chill, not too crowded, so it atually feels like a vacation and not some frenzied spring break kinda just turned 21 madness. The beds are bliss. And i've been to some supposedly swank hotels, but this bed beat out everyone. The only way it could get any better would be to accessorize it with some gorgeous virile male specimen according to my specifications.  I don't really gamble and the food establishments here are so so. But this is definitely the perfect place to recover from whatever u were doing on the strip. Ahhh...

The GVR resort and casino is probably one of the top casinos in all of Vegas.  People will call it a "local" resort but with the great shopping and dinning options at the district @ GVR it is without any doubt a place to make a part of your Vegas adventure.

Review for pool only....this place hates locals. Despite Station Casino's slogan that they love locals & other Station Casinos offering "locals" deals,  GVR won't even let you in the door unless you're a hotel guest. Their spa even does local discounts but the pool is a non-option according to their towel girl.  No apologies,  no options....just attitude for locals that used to love coming to eat/drink here. :(

One of the better Station Casino's...  It's in the better side of town.. it' feels more "upscale", although they all seem to smell the same like any other casinos, i'm not too thrilled about .. i wish they had a non-smoking section..   anyway.. i won 80 bucks within a minute of seating at the gold fish game by the sportsbook so that was a plus..  the service at the sports book bar was ridiculous.. we sat there for a good 15 minutes , lost 20 bucks each on the machine before the bartender even looked over our way on the other end of the bar, of which was not far, since it is a sportsbook bar on a friday night.. it wasn't too crowded...  but green valley ranch casino is a more preferred local casino in my opinion since it's not as ghetto as the other locations with the exception of RR..

This review is for the casino only, as I have not stayed in the hotel portion of the resort.  Since moving from North Las Vegas last year, I have been to Green Valley Ranch countless times. I really enjoy coming here for just about everything....but to gamble! lol I have friends and co-workers that say they hit here left and right, but with the exception of one glorious 4 Aces hand, I have yet to really hit squat! So I usually save my gambling for South Point since I've actually won over there. But I digress..  They have a pretty good little food court there with a Capriottis(Yum!), Fatburger, and Panda Express(Love me some Panda!), Villa Pizza(see seperate review), and a few others...  I ate at the Buffet about 1 1/2 years ago, so I don't think it would be fair to do a review at this point. But I remember it being good, but not spectacular. Very much similar to both Aliante and Red Rock Buffets, both Station properties. (Although recently Aliante was sold and is no longer a Station property...but again, I digress..)  They have a Regal movie theater downstairs, which I go to quite frequently. Gotta love those $6 Tuesdays!  One of the best things about GVR though is that it is always very clean (restrooms included) . Even though I noticed others complaining about smoke smell, I am a non smoker and I just dont get that. Than again I work in a casino, so maybe I'm a bit de-sensatized, but I've never felt a strong smoke oder like I do at say, a Terribles Casino or the like...  I did try the cafe once and was underwhelmed, but will give it another chance one day(see seperate review)..  but one of my co-workers swears by Hanks! I swear I will try this sometime in the near future! I have heard too many great things about this steakhouse to not give it a shot!  Their race and sports book is pretty much a standard Stations book, crappy lines but a lot of space, comfortable seating, and multiple screens..so you could do a lot worse there..  all in all, I really like GVR, so long as I don't feel like gambling..lol..go figure  4 stars.

If I could give negative starts, I would. This place HAS THEE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! They discriminate against people of different color and did not even try to hide it! The manager, was not helpful at all. I would put all of the rude people on blast if I knew I wasn't going to get filtered! I will be contacting Hastings Law firm for the horrible horrible weekend I had with my family there. We even booked the mediterranean suite because it looked to fabulous. Later we found out the carpets have not been washed for how many years, mold in the restroom, and just plain horrible.  The worst part? RATS RATS RATS RATS RATS RATS and BABY RATS!!! Ewwwwww!!! I felt bad for people who were having thier wedding held there because as soon as I saw the rats, I didn't even want to leave my room. Maybe I should call the health and food commitee to have them check out the place? Sad part is, Green Valley Ranch was my ALL TIME fav spot to be in Vegas. We started going there when it first opened... When I was about 18! I'm 30 now... Green Valley had a special place in my heart. Up until now, I have never not once felt discriminated on until I went to Green Valley recently. What a horrible mess it has become.  One more thing. The chlorine in the pool is to strong! I didn't even dip my head in the pool and my eyes were watery the WHOLE time while watching my son. Sorry but this place SUCKS. They couldn't even admit they were wrong. Horrible place to not be a great customer service person!

Beautiful hotel and very family friendly. The pool is fun and relaxing! We had an issue with ants in our room and the manager apologized and refunded a nights rate after returning home. Because he was able to recognize that this was an inconvenience, I would go back, but I would ask not to be on the garden floor due to the possibility of ants.
Absolutely beautiful room, beautiful hotel, amazing customer service. Relaxing spa, beautiful pool.  A+++

After my first review, one of the managers finally called me.  We agreed that they would send me a free night's stay because they "Couldn't refund my card..."  Since then, I have not received anything in the mail or any credit on my card, or even a phone call stating something has changed.  I also read other reviews about the HOTEL itself.  NONE of them were good regarding customer service when there were problems.  GVR is going to go under.  The management there is TERRIBLE.  Shame on them...

I love this place.  All the staff is super nice,  the rooms are huge and beautiful. the pool area is sour rounded by palm trees and cabanas, I felt like I was in Hawaii until I saw the desert outside.... What an oasis!  The buffet  is the best deal in town.  I highly recommend the green valley hotel.

The hotel is a maze to walk in, every corner I turn looks just like the previous ones I've taken, but is overall very nice with very friendly staff.  I stayed on the 7th floor of the East wing and had a really good view.    I had breakfast at the pancake place.  The eggs benedict was awesome (or maybe I was just really hungry at the time).    I had lunch at the buffet and it wasn't that great, even though I was dying of starvation at the time.  I didn't finish my plates; I think the salad was the best part (and I normally don't even eat greens).  The fruits didn't have too many selections.  I love pineapples, but the ones I had here was not that fresh nor flavorful.  I walked out still starving.    I had dinner at Hank's Fine Steaks and Martinis.  I made reservation for 7pm for a business dinner, but didn't get seated until 7:20.  Then when we were seated, the waiters took super long to get to us.  We ordered wine for everyone at the table, but only some of us were served.  The martinis are awesome though!  The steak was good and side dishes are yummy.    Perhaps I'm just not used to the indoor smoking, but I think I got sick from it and I only stayed for 2 days.  Overall, it's an OK place, secluded and away from the busy Vegas Strip.

Our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids) stayed at GVR as the final leg of our Spring Break.  After being in cold weather in Flagstaff and Grand Canyon, we were happy to be back to warm weather!  We booked the room from Hotwire for $87 (hotel then charged a resort fee of $25, this becoming annoyingly typical).  The room  was very roomy and comfortable for the 5 of us.  It's elegantly decorated and we had a view of the pool which the kids couldn't wait to get into.  When you check in, they give the kids buckets and shovels so they can play at the pool's 'beach.'  This was a real hit with our children.  We had dinner at the Feast buffet.  As other reviewer mentioned, the crab and the option of having it cooked up with their special seasoning was a great treat.  The dessert spread was typical of any buffet, nothing really special.  However, they served gelato!  There were about 6 flavors.  My espresso gelato was yummy.  I wish we had more time to spend here.  Our family would definitely be back again as another option to staying on the strip.
Nice local casino but the casino floor is too smoky for my liking.  A better filtration system would really be of benefit...or banning smoking, but I know that will never happen in Vegas.

We went to their "seafood buffet" last night since we were happy to see their seafood night had been brought back. What an utter disappointment. Incredibly long line to get your crab legs steamed. The quality is also not there...not from how I remember from a few years ago.   The "sushi" is some kind of rice-looking roll but it doesn't taste like sushi rice...tastes like some mass produced item.   The rest of the non-seafood offerings are just meh. Oversalted and overspiced.  Sad, this used to be one of our fave buffets for us and for entertaining out of towers but we will probably not be back....

**This Review is for the Pool Area Only**  I went to the Green Valley Ranch pool to take in some sun, a few drinks, and relax with the locals...annnnddd I kind of loved it! There's plenty of room to layout and sip an adult beverage, plus the douche factor here seems minimal. I'm sure this varies from day to day or weekend to weekend, but I don't really see a reason for many out-of-towners to come all the way to the GVR Pool.   The pool has a nice beach entrance which is great for kids and for all those parents who need some well deserved R & R. They also offer cabana rentals with covered seating, bottle service, and for the ballers, you can enjoy the VIP area called, "The Pond". This area looked cool from what I could see, but it was literally a small peek as the door was closed. There are also small and shallow wading pools, that halfway surround the main pool for those extra small water lovers.   The pool is free all of the time unless there's a private party. If you plan on being a regular here I would recommend getting the VIP card. You'll get special offers and maybe some extra love at the bar. Bring a towel and no hiding booze, because they may check your bag before you enter the main pool.   This is a great spot if you want to feel like your escaping from the rat race for few hours or the weekend for a staycation!

I loved the roulette table slot machine.  I think more casinos should add them.  Didn't think I'd like GVR Casino but I didn't want to gamble anywhere else.  I will definitely be back (next time to trap the craps slot).

Gorgeous hotel. Gorgeous pool. Gorgeous fitness center. However, paper thin walls and the AC was not working well. In NV, you want your air conditioning to be working like a charm, but mine was on "fan" mode and couldn't be altered, so I slept on top of the covers because I was so hot! Reception couldn't do anything about it because it was on "eco mode" to conserve energy. So I slept with a cold washcloth on my forehead for over $200/night.   I also value my sleep and I stayed here during a work trip only to be woken in the middle of the night with doors slamming, guests coming back drunk and talking loudly, and I could hear an entire conversation next door to me by a guy on the phone. (Thank god it was just talking.) I could hear every single word. The wing I was in was also under construction and they started early in the morning. My room was also near an outside door from another part of the hotel and people would go out there to smoke and take pictures, so I didn't have much privacy and the luxury to have my curtains open because people could look right in at me.   The staff was professional and kind but it seems a very tip-heavy place. I tip when I've had exceptional service, but I was honestly exhausted from not getting sleep due to the AC, other guests, and construction. Don't think I'll be staying here again.

WOW is all that I can say. We are locals and booked a room for our anniversary. Having The District within walking distance was an extra bonus. This hotel is gorgeous. Luscious landscaping and a lovely pool/spa area. Some nice bars, buffets, and restaurants to fit your fancy. The lobby and hallways were beautifully decorated. The entire hotel was neat and clean. The smell of smoke from the casino was barely noticeable.  The room was the icing on the cake. The perfect size for 2 people. A comfortable king size bed and fluffy pillows. The bathroom was so awesome with the garden tub and connecting shower. A very nice place to relax. I can't get over the fact that there was NO outside noises that could be heard while in the room. No traffic, elevators, other guests above or below, the AC, doors closing, the refrigerator humming, water flowing through pipes,etc. Obviously these are all issues I have had while staying in other hotels, but not GVR. I have found my home away from home, my oasis, my sanctuary.

This review is based on the casino and buffet. Machines are tight, not very "local".   Buffet is very "station" like and they serve crap with a long wait. Good thing my buffet was free.   All I see, is a fancier Palace Station.

My overall rating would range somewhere between 3.5 and 4 stars.  I took one star off because the hotel charges additional resort fees each night during your stay there.  My room was in the West Wing so I can't comment on the newer, East Wing rooms.  However my room overlooked the pool area and offered a decent view of the Vegas backdrop at night.  The room itself was lofty, clean, luxurious-feeling and spacious.    I did find that having to walk around the 2nd floor in order to reach the casino area a bit annoying after a while.  I doubt that would be the case if you were staying in the East Tower though, although I could be wrong.  Apparently the hotel is set up so that the casino is the gateway to reach other destinations whether it be the theater, the District or the restaurants with exception of the pool and spa area.  Be forewarned that internet access is a whopping $1 per minute in their business center so I would advise you to bring your own laptop.  And if you happen to move anything around in the minibar as I have just learned, it would automatically be charged to your card.  Apparently there's a sensor in the fridge that sets off if items are taken out or moved around.  I had some leftovers to save for later and I needed to make room in the mini fridge.  I was not aware that it would set off the sensor despite my efforts to put everything back at the end of my stay.  Water is also expensive there (or so I was told) so I would suggest making a visit over to Whole Foods and stock up.  It's also nice and convenient how the District is close by the hotel.  Adds for a bit of distraction and broader options to dine and just walk around the shops/boutiques as the sun is setting.  For my brief stay there, there was something to do at almost any given moment (and I don't gamble).  During my last night there, I managed to catch 500 Days of Summer in their theater below.  Something I did not expect to hear coming from a hotel, it's almost unheard of in the East coast!  Being that I am unemployed and flew out to Vegas for an interview, this was as close to a vacation as I was going to get.  My stay there lasted 3 nights and 2 days.  Overall I am happy with my choice here and don't regret the experience I had either as the staff is very friendly.  Just make sure you keep track of the surcharges they may add to your card is all.

Had a wonderful Mother's Day weekend vacation here. The accommodations are lush and beautiful; the service at the hotel was also on point. Highly recommended especially the pool and the spa. I didn't do any gambling at the casino, but I did visit the bingo room for one game. It was my first time and it was rather crowded, but the fellow guests were so nice and willing to help me figure it out. I ate at one of the cafes and found that also heavenly. The pastry case was lovely.

It's a Station Casino property with an upscale feel. Not sure how to describe the decor other than dark old money.   Buffet for whatever reason is 3 bucks more for not much different options than the other properties, although I did see shrimp on the Monday night dinner buffet, so maybe that's why.  The Regal Cinema offers $6 all day movie tickets on Tuesday.  Parking seems to be ample with both a ground lot and a parking structure.  Nothing great, but nothing horrible at Green Valley Ranch

Great resort if you want to plan a great golf outing with your friends and family. I was really surprised I always stay at the WYNN but this time I was chorused by the group to stay since we would be playing Rio Secco golf track. Well, to my surprised it totally exceeded my expectations.  This resort is really upscale and the people (gamblers & resort staff)  are really nice as well....the resort doesn't attract low life's. The steakhouse HANKS was great too. I stayed in the Tuscany Suite (only $500 a night) that suite would be $4000 a night at the WYNN. The pool was awesome as well.

I stayed at Green Valley Ranch 2/22 - 2/25.    Upon arrival at the airport, I went to level 0 to meet the free shuttle to the hotel.  The shuttle was right on time.   Check in was a little slow, but a full shuttle of us arrived all at once, so that is expected.  Room:  The property is lovely.  I asked for a room close to the casino, but quiet.  I did not care about a view.  I was told the East Tower was closest, but you have to walk outside, around the pool to get to the tower.  OK in February, no one was there, but if I stayed again, I would go West Tower, which, by the way, seemed a lot closer to the casino anyway.  My room was average at best.  It was clean, and it was quiet, but just ok.  For the price, I expected just a little more pizzazz.  Casino:  Huge.  Every new machine.   Almost no one in the casino, and after 3 days of losing, I can see why.  No casino lets you win, I get that, but at least for $500 a day,  you should be able to play a litlle, get a bonus now and then.  I never once saw a jackpot of any kind being paid out.  I was later told in Bingo that no one really plays the machines here, they are so so tight.  My gosh, they just were.  Food:  Ick.  I cannot comment on the buffet, I never got in.  The lines at almost all times of day were so long, it was worse than the airport security check points!   The cafe was ok.  Kind of slow service but it was ok.  The food court is limited.  Panda Express had really OLD food just sitting there and no one making any fresh.  The pizza place was similiar and for $6.00 a slice at that!    Fatburger was actually quite good.  If it had not been raining, I would have ventured out to the District, where many food venues were available.  Amenities:  I did not use any of them, I was there for a tournament, so I did not have to pay the fees.  The pool did look nice, and so did the gym, but I did not use either.  Floors:  This is important.  The floors are a very uneven tile.  For ladies that have anything other than a tennis shoe, BEWARE!   I saw so many ladies, myself included, struggling to get to the carpet near machines, just to keep from falling.  With so many seniors in this place, I found it had to understand the design of these uneven tiled floors.  They look nice, sure, but CAREFUL....  Store:  EVERY Hotel, of any kind, has a store.  You forget something and need to pick it up, and I was stunned this place had nothing at all but soda and cigarettes.  No shampoo.  No soap.  No toothpaste.  Nothing.  OH, they had a nail clipper and eye drops.  Just so understocked I could not believe it !  Shuttle to Airport:  I got lucky my flight lined up with the shuttle schedules.  They run every two hours so if you miss one, it is a long wait.  Also, it is small, about 14 seats and it was full both times.  You must get a ticket 1/2 hour before, so plan ahead.  There were several people upset they had to take a cab as the shuttle was full.  But great service for those of us lucky enough to have read reviews and knew this was an issue!    All in all, I would probably not stay here again.  It depends on WHY you are going.  It seems like a nice place to relax and get spa treatments, but not gamble or have a hip time in a club.

I am very disappointed in the hotel. The first time I went there, they were sold out and even though I had a RESERVATION, there was no room for me. I was sent to the strip and had to drive 15 mins to the hotel everyday for the business meeting that I had to attend there.   They give me a letter of apology and a complimentary 2-night stay. I tried to redeem it years later and then they say the offer 'expired'. WTF? There was no expiration date on the letter. I don't mind losing at the gambling table but this is a total rip off and poor customer service!  Maybe I should speak to an attorney.

This was the first time that we drove all the way out to Green Valley. Knowing that its part of Station Casinos, I didn't really expect much out of it. But unfortunately, Its way more then I expected.   Its bigger then most station casinos out there and one of the nicer ones. Of course, it was kind of confusing at first, but it sort of makes sense. We were trying to find the garage but there very well hidden. Of course, being the first time going there, you basically get lost very easily. But the garage, you'll see an entrance way at one point, then you go up another level and its just a big parking lot. Of course you then realize, the garage is under you, and we're just on the top floor. A bit further down the way is another garage, but we decided to just park at the first parking we saw.   From the looks of it, it was very well detailed on the whole structure. Its like they actually took the time to make this place look appealing. To me, I was really impress on how they made the outside look so elegant. The inside, had this warm feeling to it. But on the other hand, it tend to be crowded by all these slot machines. Which is kind of a downer, but it is a casino/hotel. I just wish they use less slots, but I guess that's how they make their money. A lot of their restaurants are well designed and detailed, that it makes it look interesting on what this restaurant is. I'm sure people just want to know that its just a sushi restaurant, but putting something extra, puts a bit more of a spin to it. I do like their creativity when it came down to these restaurants.   We came to Green Valley to watch Aaron Lewis in concert at the Ovation. The Ovation itself was a nice little venue. I honestly think they can probably make it better. But the design outside and inside was very nice. I gave the Ovation a decent review, but it could of been better.   Overall, Green Valley Ranch is a nice place to look around. Its one of the busier Station casinos. So I'm sure there will be a lot of mix reviews. But I would probably say, that if your there to eat or play, then that would be a great place to check out. If you're there to stay or watch a concert, don't set your too hopes to high.
Stayed only one night. Really nice staff. Rooms are really nice, love the bathroom. Pool area was awesome spent the afternoon getting a tan. Hotels.com during the week is awesome
Not a bad place to hang your hat in Green Valley.  The slots seem to pay OK.  I live closer to Red Rock but find this location to be better.

Unfortunately I have to say even though this is a pretty nice Hotel, the fact that I was placed in a room with a window facing the Parking Structure and the stairs right in my face was a terrible experience, especially since I had to wake up early in the morning to the sound of people going up and down the metal parking stairs. That room should not even exists, and even if it does it shouldn't be assigned to anyone on a Sunday night when obviously 90% of the rooms were empty!!! Also there was weird noise coming out of the toilet pipes.   Everything else was good but the kind of room I was in needs to be the last room given out, along with a warning from the front desk about it having a parking garage view with super loud stairways right in your ears!! I was going to ask to be moved, but had to walk a good 5-7 minutes all the way to the edge of their east tower just to get to that room, too tired to complain, and I shouldn't be the one to tell the receptionist about these things anyways!  This place is pretty far from the Strip by the way, in case that is why you're going to Vegas, make sure to calculate $50 cab rides, each way, to the Strip into your budget. Although apparently there are some shuttle services available.  The best thing about this place is the awesome pool area. Lots of room to hang out and have a fun day out in the sun.  I only had a one night experience, and it was not a good one; disappointing enough to make me write this review! As a business, most of the time you only have one chance with a potential customer, and this one was lost.

My friends and I came here for one reason: The $4.99 breakfast buffet!   Yeah it's ridiculously cheap. HOWEVER, in order to get that price, you must get the bording pass. It's free to sign up so just make sure you do that before lining up to the buffet.  We got in 30 min before they started serving the lunch items so we got to sample both their breakfast and lunch offerings. Highlights of our meal(s) were their omelet bar, scalloped potatoes and the carved meat area.  Also, beverages are included so don't worry about paying additional fees.

It's rare that I give a 3-star review, but my experience was mixed here. Particularly, some staff were great and others lacking. The front desk seemed very unhappy and unhelpful overall. By contrast, the pool, restaurant, and buffet servers were awesome at all hours. The venue delivers on promise, but I personally would love more resort and less casino. Bowling or laser tag or rock climbing? I don't know. Even with the property at full capacity, the gaming floor looks sad and empty -- maybe reallocate 30% of it for other fun things. Most of the younger generation is steering away from typical vegas gambling anyway -- they'd rather buy experiences. Just my input.

Maids are shady and will steal your stuff! Our ac only cooked the tom to 77° and after several attempts to fix it they offered us a different room on OUR LAST NIGHT!! Oh and for our troubles they gave us a food or beverage credit for $50 and 2 free buffet meals. Are you kidding?!?! This place is almost $200 a night!!! It was 111° outside and almost 80° in my room! And we left an item in the room, we know we left it in the room and it isn't in lost and found... You know what that means? A maid has a new painting that belonged to my daughter.
