You would think a nice resort would have maids with higher standards, but no. They are shady theives just like the ones at crappy places. I'm beyond disgusted with this place. Won't ever stay here again, and won't recommend it. Well be posting this on Facebook, travelocity, booking.com and every other travel site I can find.
Fantastic food- completely fresh and affordable! Loved the Mexican flavor in our breakfast. Empanadas and veggies tacos for breakfast were great! Highly recommend

We rented a Cabana today and honestly not sure if we will ever go there again!! . Seems like every year they get cheaper and cheaper with their Cabana rentals. They charge you $150.00 for the cabana and you only get Fiji and Pellegrino. We had to ask for the fruit tray because the waitress never brought it. Honestly the tray is a joke! We were told the limit is 10 people per cabana. The one next to us had a huge party probably 15+. It smelled like weed which came from the Cabana next to us. Classy especially when we had kids (4 and under) with us. Our server was sweet that's the only reason we are giving you 2 stars. Oh also you should really have someone who escorts you to your cabana. We were just told to go up to the bar and ask for someone to help us. I'm sorry that is not good customer service. Ugh what's happened with our customer service Vegas!

Green Valley is perfectly fine as a hotel.  It's a little dated, but the upkeep is pretty good.  The rooms are spacious, as are the bathrooms.  The room service is usually timely, and housekeeping is always friendly.  But there are some problems with GVR: - We were charged $300 for a stolen blanket, which we never took.  We didn't see this charge until well after the required 3 days after checkout.  (We did an express check out and didn't check our credit card statement until later.)  The next time we stayed there, we talked to a manager, who said we needed to talk to the daytime manager.  We did that and never heard back.  $300 gone.  - The check in line can be quite long, sometimes wrapping around the entire lobby with a wait of an hour.  - To get from point A to point B, it almost always requires going through the casino.  I realize that's the point of being in Vegas is to gamble, but there is a lot of wasted time walking through the casino to get to other places on the property.  - The shower doors don't close well and almost always leak water onto the floor.  If you're into gambling and want somewhere nice but off-strip, this is a good place.  If you want something off-strip but classier with similar (and often cheaper) price point, try The M, just off I-15.

Stumbled upon this after a trying out the Westin (almost on the strip) and was very disappointed with the property; staff were great and apologetic...but I need running water (long story...another time) when I vacation and the Westin was having none of that...so I yelped the Green Valley on my mobile....smartest move EVER.  Great place to stay...super friendly staff...with lots of recommendations on where to go...which I find important especially when I go to Vegas.  I don't really get into the whole Vegas 'let's go to a buffet' scene and the buffet here was pretty underwhelming...although my wife loved it and she tends to be pretty picky about the food situation.    Should warn you that I am not the typical person who wants to go to Vegas and get stone hammered every night...so found the off strip location perfect for me.  Drove to the Strip in 10 minutes..shuttle is pretty flaky so wouldn't really count on it...were I you.  Grounds are gorgeous and you do get a whole different (read more pleasant less inebriated) vibe staying here.  The pools are fantastic; they had live music one night when stayed there.  They have an "adult"  pool area that is cordoned off from the rest of the property and it lived up to its rep.  Best part is that they are very pooch friendly...to the point that I was offered 2 extra bottled water/day to make sure HE stayed hydrated.  One weird thing I never figured out...they have a mini vineyard?!?! on site...but nobody knows anything about...not sure how it will taste now that Blizz has 'watered' those vines though...so stay away from any 08 vintage they eventually produce.

August 6, 2016 I reserved a 2-Queen non-smoking room through Expedia. I paid an extra $20 to guarantee that arrangement.  Upon my arrival, I was told that when booking through Expedia there are no guarantees. Guarantees are only honored if booked directly through the hotel.   A King bedroom with a rollaway bed was never an option AND would have totally defeated the purpose of paying extra for the guaranteed arrangement.    My confirmation and the extra money spent on a guarantee meant absolutely nothing to the men at the front desk.  I had clear proof of my booking.  My email confirmation read plainly confirmed 2-Queen beds non-smoking.  Never did I expect to be deceived at booking and then shoved into an accommodation that would have never worked. Please tell me the whole purpose of booking a 2-Queen bed non-smoking in addition to paying an additional guaranteed fee for an arrangement that would never be honored upon arrival?  There was nothing hospitable about this experience.  Front desk lacked the skill required to resolve the issue of accommodating the two-Queen beds as I had expected.  We dove 3  1/2 hours feeling secure that our room request would have been met.  I had spoken so highly of Green Valley Ranch resort and spa from past vacation stay experiences and was so sad to have to eat every word.  We had such high hopes and expectations that our reservation needs would be met as we had paid extra to ensure the proper room needs. I would soon learn that GVR overbooked and never had the specified room to begin with leaving us to waste precious time in search for a hotel replacement that would keep to their end of the deal.  Also, at no point was I made aware that the hotel was undergoing major renovations at the main entrance and not all amenities would be available during my stay.  My experience with the front desk staff was unforgettable in the worst way.  It was so easy and came so natural for them place blame on Expedia and to look past the guaranteed rate and room in my confirmation email.  The apology offered by the front desk was rehearsed as if this happens all the time here.  When going on vacation everyone you encounter and the experience as a whole should be pleasant, hospitable, and accommodating at the very least.  GVR FAILED to go above and beyond to ensure a great guest experience. Tourist should be able to trust that when reservations are made that the arrangements are honored and upheld especially when extra money is paid to guarantee the request made.  Green Valley Ranch resort and spa hugely underperformed in this area. Just know that a confirmation from any other source other than GVR will not be honored!

Part of the "Station" chain, beautiful casino! Definitely adding Pizza Rock to the itinerary for next time... the smells coming from that place were to die for! Convenient parking, short walk to the fun, and security on segway's just in case you need something.

I will say that I have never stayed in the hotel here, but I visit this casino frequently.  It is a great place to stay if you are from out of town and not interested in the Strip.  There is a mall right outside its front door with great restaurants like Lucille's BBQ, The Elephant Bar and the Cheesecake Factory, along with a Coffee Bean and a lot of nice stores.   The casino itself is very nice.  I have been to them all and the Red Rock and Green Valley Ranch are the top two casinos in my opinion off of the strip.  Very clean, and it is kid friendly with a movie theater and I think it has a bowling alley, not sure.  Great place to come and gamble, although I would recommend staying away from the slots, I feel like they are really tight there compared to other places, but it is a great place for table games.

I go to vegas a lot now... Seems like about once or twice a month. Somehow I almost always end up here.  Green Valley isn't one of the most well-known or elaborate resorts out there but it has a quaint (If there is indeed a casino that can have any sort of a 'quaint' quality) that keeps my boyfriend and I coming back. The people who work there are so sweet and are very kind and helpful with everyone they deal with. I witnessed one of their employees dealing with some pretty difficult people. They were very professional and I diplomatic.  They do have a buffet which we frequent most visits. There is a wait but then again there is probably a bit of a wait for all buffets in Vegas. Although they do have a number of yummy dishes, they don't have the largest selection. There are probably better buffets out there but this one is affordable and they stuff they do have their is pretty decent.  The machines are random. The first time we played we won $60 when we played with only $4. Most of the time your wallet will end up lighter when you leave. Such is Vegas!  Big Plus: It also helps that there is a singer that I really adore that seems to play in their awesome lounge/bar every Saturday night. My mom and I are planning to go see him this summer! Hope he is still there ^_^
not vegetarian friendly.  took over an hour to get in the buffet.   they do not like feedback.

Here is another casino that we play at when we're in town.  Casino part is ok.  It's a little bit cheaper sometimes than the strip but not always the stations casions (this is if you're playing tables).  They don't have that many 1 cent slots as the stations casinos.  Food here is good.  I like the shops that they have outside.  Even the movie theater is nice, which is a change of pace if you want to take a break from eating/gambling.

GVR endeavors to be included in the conversation with the finer luxury brands in Las Vegas. Unfortunately, it becomes immediately apparent that the staff is trained and ruled by the same Station Casinos management philosophy that oversees local day casinos at the four corners of the valley. The property staff is transactional in nature, robotic, and mired in bureaucracy. For a more satisfying customer-centric experience I recommend paying a little extra and staying a classier establishment.

The GVR is a nicely appointed hotel, spa and casino. Unfortunately the customer service is only reserved for those who arrive in style or throw money around and overpay for things.  The valets will lie to you and then have a deal going with the front office to put you in a room that is pretty crummy so you would have to upgrade for a cost that can be as high as $200 more.  I can afford to lose $200 on a single hand but I do not like to be insulted by pit bosses or the help.  The food is just food.  Complaints to management is useless. Typical Station Casino attitude.  Why do older people like to meet up in this place is unknown to me. Someone said that GVR attracts those people who would be intimidated by Aria, Bellagio, Wynn, Paris...Cosmo... I can't think of a redeeming quality of actually staying again after 3 tries at this establishment.  My last event that caused me to write is when my wife was conned into paying for $1,500 room service that never occurred.  It turns out that Registration decided that a suite should be charged for a case of cheap champagne that was never delivered.    Since then, I have informed the medical trials group to hold events somewhere else and quit trying to save money in Las Vegas.

Stayed here Dec 26-28 2013 with family--wife and 3 kids under 10 yrs old.  Free valet parking, Starbucks onsite in casino food court, friendliest staff including at the tables, adequate rooms (without coffee pots).  My son left his iPod in the reception area and didn't realize it until we were in our room about 10 mins later.  I called the front desk and they found it...impressive.  Close enough to the strip without being there...quiet and clean for the kids.  You can avoid the smoke of the casino for the most part, altho the buffet is adjacent to the casino so a little smokey.  Agree that the place is a little bit of a maze at first but it's good since it keeps the hotel portion away from the casino.  East portion of hotel is farther away from casino than the west wing if you get the chance to choose.  Pool view is worth it if you care, altho the pool is closed for winter months.  Will come back with the family.

So glad I had prior yoga classes because this event was intense. The pool side venue is such a beautiful spot to set up our mats either by the pool, on the grass or in the courtyard. Checking in queue did not take long due to having iPads provided & a link for self check in through your own phone before retrieving headphones. Around 6pm was a good crowd ready for savasana. It was my first time ever using headphones for yoga. The DJ had this cool beat called blue dream I suppose which totally matched my breathing at one point. If you have never done yoga this will probably be a deal breaker just because instructions were fast and I didn't feel connected to my instructors until the very end with the positive affirmations once my breathing took a life of its own. The music threw me off with clubbing beats when in reality it shouldve matched the flow of the practice.

Incredibly gorgeous hotel. I love the architecture of this true gem. It is greatly appreciated. Enjoyed the free concert with "Steel Panther" on Saturday nights. What a treat. These guys are hilarious and good! : )
I didn't spend a bunch of time in this casino, but I liked my time here.  It was new, clean, well organized, and not too smokey... and I won $40.

Hey, those GVR people must have read my review, because it looks like the rooms have been remodeled since the last time I was here. The hotel hallways look a lot chicer with dark walls and abstract patterned carpets. The rooms also got a makeover and the armoire with the tv has been replaced by a set of drawers with a big flat screen. The place is looking better than ever!
Love this hotel casino and their buffet is one of the best is Las Vegas and Henderson. Must try!

Reservation was incorrect.  Locking me out of my suite, door stuck, had too be disassembled by engineers, nothing available due to wedding party taking over hotel. Front Desk RUDE.   Casino smells like ashtray, toilets clogged unserviced. At 21 & over pool no seats available due to wedding not enough loungers for hotel guest. Bartenders RUDE . One Star is being kind. Don't waste your time with this inhospitable establishment. Unsupervised Children Fist fighting in hallway... here at Hotel currently and my bed has bed bugs. I have bites w/my blood on the sheets!  BEWARE

I spoke with Slot casino host and I was asking for food comp. He says I don't qualify because I have to loose $1000. He says I was only $150 away. I told him I'm not going there anymore. He told me HAVE A NICE DAY!
This is a great place to go if you're in Henderson and too lazy to drive down to the strip. There's great shopping, some good restaurants, and even Whole Foods across the street!
The staff at the Green Valley Ranch Hotel are very helpful and provided amazing assistance to deal with a missing letter to a guest! They are the best!

On our way home from GVR now.  I give 3 stars to the hotel over-all, but give the pool staff at the towel cabana 1 star.  My husband and I stayed one night.  The check in was good and they had our room available upon arrival.  The A/C did not work and we waited 1 hour for someone to come confirm the motor was out.  They called for us to be moved which was a pain since it was on another floor, but it was a better pool view room.  Rooms are nice and bathrooms are spacious.  The dealers were all nice in the casino.  My BIG complaint is that the roulette number postings were not working properly at 2 of the table and not at all at 2 of the tables.  I think it is misleading and deceptive to show numbers posting only 50% of the time.  REGARDLESS of the odds, players look at those numbers and often players walk up and play black or red based on what they see hitting.  I complained to the pit boss and several dealers and nobody really addressed it.  It was annoying, but I still had fun and the waitresses were pretty regular with the drinks.The hotel, pool area and casino are very clean.  The pool area has a LOT of wasted space and the pool is too small.  The biggest joke was that we got coffees inside at Coffee Bean and walked outside to lay by the pool today and were stopped in our tracks and told we could not bring our "outside" coffees into the pool area! So ridiculous!  In addition to the bad rule, the girl had a bad attitude and pointed to the sign to explain the rule.  I tried to lighten the air telling her it was my birthday and the 1st coffee I had had in 40 days (since I gave it up for LENT) but she had no words for me.  So we had to sit on the wall and gulp our coffee before entering.  An older couple walked up with their GVR coffees and they were abruptly told they could not enter, either.  Very ridiculous.  We will not be returning. If you are looking for a non strip hotel, Red Rock is MUCH better!

Called the GVR spa to make an appointment for my 30th birthday for a massage service and facial, about $300 in services. When making the appointment I was informed that I couldn't use my locals discount because the massage I picked wasn't covered. I then went back to the main website and noticed that the verbiage clearly stated 20% off services on Friday and that this discount can help with doing a second service or even upgrading to a better service. Which was exactly what I was doing! I was bummed as I had based my decision after a few hours of research on that locals discount. I explained to the girl I was speaking with that online it never mentioned anywhere that this was only on certain services under their "we love locals" section of the website. She said that it was not on that portion of the website but unfortunately she couldn't honor it. She then spoke with her manager Caitlyn Applegate who said that she would not honor the locals discount regardless of what was stated online and that she completely agreed with the verbiage stated online. Even though it completely contradicts with what was being advertised! But she would give me a different massage that was the exact same price as the massage I wanted for a discounted price, which I thought was really strange. Why give a discount on a massage that's the exact same price but not on the one I wanted?I was then transferred to the manager Caitlyn Applegate and she was immediately on the defensive. Her comments were rude and definitely not the type of customer service I would expect from someone who is working at a spa that charges 200 a treatment. She also ended the conversation laughing saying "hope you have a wonderful Valentine's Day" in the most contradicting tone. She had the opportunity to really create a wow customer service experience and impress a local client that frequently uses spa services. As well as make someone extremely happy on their birthday. Instead she had a sour attitude and has created what could have been a loyal guest into someone who will never think to use their services again. It's a shame!

My local station casino! I love this place because of how easy it is to get in and out of the sports book when I want to run in and place a fast bet. Also I usually can find a seat here when watching the NBA finals or playoff football in the Fall. Also this casino foes have allot of promotions including free bets, buffet deals and tons more. Hands down my fav station casino in the vegas valley.

Love the property. A good place to go to just relax away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We were checked in by Kammie who was very sweet. When we needed to retrieve something from our car, Mike at the valet save us the trip and brought it to us. The only reason this place gets four stars is our encounter with the wait staff at the feast buffet. She was not very friendly or attentive. However she was very nice to the other people around us. Seems to me that she did not like folks if my nationality. The food there was okay. Due to the cold treatment from Ileana, we will not eat there again. We had breakfast before checking out at the Grand Cafe. The food was tasty and our server Shanna and hostess Mai Mai were a delightful pair.  We will definitely be back to GVR for another getaway. All other employees we encountered along the way made us feel welcomed-a class act! Mahalo GVR for a wonderful stay.

I have mixed feelings about the Green Valley Ranch.  On one hand, I love that they lent me a wheelchair (at no cost) since I was injured and on crutches.  I am thankful for that assistance on my recent stay.  I was impressed that when I called housekeeping to let them know we spilled Jamba Juice in the hallway, they cleaned it up quickly.  Cleaning of our room each day was not so impressive.  I could tell we didn't get vacuumed.  The poor construction of the shower door resulted in a puddle of water each time it was used, and most of all, I was unimpressed with the selection of food available throughout the day.  While they had a 24/7 cafe open at all times, there were only a handful of casual spots in the food court, and the Chinese & Japanese restaurants were only open for dinner.  I'd highly recommend adding a Starbucks.  The poker room was a nice size, but I never saw it full.  I played in one of the morning tournaments, and was surprised the blinds and running time weren't posted on any screens for the players.  My friend thought there weren't enough chairs for people down at the pool, as many people had to lay on the grass.  I'd much rather stay at their sister location, Red Rock.

Green Valley Ranch has significantly decreased their level of customer service of recent.  We often frequented GVR, being local to the area, but we will take our business elsewhere going forward.    The service today was utterly horrible. We scheduled a cabana at their pool and only found out when we arrived that the water misters were complexly broken. According to the GVR staff, the misters had been broken for the season and they were working to fix them.  This would have been good to know when I reconfirmed the reservation a few days ago as given the hot temperatures today, the misters would have made the hot temperature quite bearable.  To that point, we had a villa at the Paris a few days ago (on a hotter day) and stayed at the pool all day largely to the misters and jumping in the pool as needed.  Without the misters, however, we had to leave the GVR pool early to get out out of the heat.    On top of needing to leave the pool early, the staff of the casino and pool were rude and surly. I complained to the Pool Manager, who eventually told me he'd "throw us a 10%".  It felt like we were dogs being treated with a bone.  I told the Pool Manager that his discount was completely inadequate given that I would have gone somewhere else or used the regular pool.  The Pool Manager indicated that his supervisor, Danny Perrera (not sure of his name spelling), would only authorize a 10% discount and that he would not speak to me since he was in a meeting.  I will still come to The District to visit Lucille's BBQ, but Green Valley Ranch - not so much...

I've been living in Henderson for two years now and have stayed at GVR twice since relocating here. I love this resort and the hotel staff is always so welcoming. I can't say enough about how great the front desk is with helping to make our stays comfortable and relaxing. Being located not far from where I live now is a definite plus since I am not a fan of staying on the strip anymore. The District is right across the street and the movie theater at the resort is one of the cleanest in the area. Love love love this place.

Until the Red Rock (http://www.yelp.com/biz/red-rock-casino-resort-and-spa-las-vegas-2) came along, the Green Valley Ranch was option numero uno among the growing property list of the Station Casino empire. It was and still is a very complete resort, a property with a little bit of everything. GVR recently celebrated its 10th anniversary, which in Vegas years means the novelty has worn off slightly. Despite that, it remains a great destination for all and is a great value for any stay.  Similarly to Red Rock, GVR is off the strip. So off as a matter of fact, it's in Henderson (i.e. not Las Vegas). Relax I-only-stay-on-the-strip fans, it's a 10-15 minute shuttle ride at best from McCarran airport and is probably faster to get to than the Sahara, which is technically still on the strip. But like any good off strip property and especially those in Henderson, it means this joint is likely a locals casino (#1).  As a hotel, GVR is definitely delivers. There are a multitude of room types, all of which are modern, contemporary, and feature some of the most comfy beds I've slept in. Everything from the regular sized rooms to the mega suites that could sleep 30, are available and for far more reasonable prices than most of the ones along Las Vegas Blvd. And at nearly 500 of them, there is plenty to choose from. I say, try to score a room near their pools - the view of the strip is nice, as is the amenities poolside.  Casino enthusiasts should be able to appreciate the large casino space, which offers over 70 table games and over 2,000 gaming machines. Blackjack fans should be able to get their fill of over 30 tables dedicated to the game and poker fans will have a  decent variety of games to chose from as well. Their player rewards program is competitive, comp points from play is definitely transferrable to other Station properties. Dealers are usually quite friendly and the cigarette smoke is controlled rather well for a large space. The cocktail staff could definitely use an upgrade, but I digress.  In terms of eats, there is a decent selection but the outstanding venues are a bit limited. Hank's Steaks & Martinis (http://www.yelp.com/biz/hanks-fine-steaks-and-martinis-henderson) is the obvious winner of the bunch and then there is the pitiful TIdes Oyster Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tides-oyster-bar-henderson). I echo the pains of eating at Grand Cafe (http://www.yelp.com/biz/grand-cafe-henderson) though the Feast (Around The World) Buffet (http://www.yelp.com/biz/feast-buffet-henderson-3) has been fantastic and mediocre at varying times. It's no In-N-Out, but Fatburger (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fatburger-henderson-2) is gut bustingly good. Sushi + Sake (http://www.yelp.com/biz/sushi-sake-las-vegas) is a fun time, especially for their AYCE deal. Italian joint Terra Verde (http://www.yelp.com/biz/terra-verde-henderson) is decent during lunch, though I much preferred it when Hell's Kitchen winner Rock was still running the show.  GVR has a lot of random amenities, which really distinguish it from it's nearby (or far away depending on how you look at it) properties. Like the Red Rock, there is a movie theater. The Pond (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-pond-henderson), is a real cool and relaxing alternative to their sick pools. A great place to catch an outdoor concert is at The Backyard (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-backyard-henderson) and Ovation (http://www.yelp.com/biz/ovation-henderson) is a real concert venue. Every casino has a center floor bar and in GVR's case, it's the Drop Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/drop-bar-henderson). I'd also recommend visiting the Lobby Bar (http://www.yelp.com/biz/lobby-bar-henderson) as it's probably the closest thing to a club GVR has. The property may not boast a lot of shopping, but it sits right next to The District (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-district-at-green-valley-ranch-henderson), a village of boutique and luxury stores, just perfect for those looking for an escape from the casino. It's rarely ever crowded, but then again, neither is the casino.  Though GVR could probably use an upgrade on a few things, the property itself is good enough to warrant a 4.5 star rating. It's versatile, stylish, and spacious enough for all visitors. Folks who are teetering the idea of staying off the strip with almost everything at their disposal, should consider GVR as their next destination. ___________ (#1) This is a very, very good thing.

So the pillows are wonderful and the bed is comfy.  The attached casino will make you reak of smoke if you walk in there. You will be nickled and dimed for EVERYTHING!  No freebies or extras here.  Would I stay again? Maybe,

This place is great! My parents come here often and I join them once in a while. The host that helps us is Tony Constantino. He's a great guy! The rooms here are beautiful and the restaurants are amazing. My favorite is the spa. There spa is huge! It's very clean and very modern! Definitely get a massage when you stay here.

We were invited for the New Years' Eve party.  The check-in went smoothly, the gentleman was very professional at the front desk. The room was fine except for the central air unit.  We had a similar problem in the summer when the a/c wouldn't cool the room properly.  This time I developed a cold and we had to crank up the heat to attain a decent temperature.    We had room service for breakfast and it was impeccable.  I still wasn't feeling well by lunch and we ordered in again.  I was craving a nice big bowl of chicken soup and my wife ordered a vegan soup and a salad with lemon vinaigrette.  My soup was fine but the bowl was so tiny.  My wife ordered a cup of soup and it was the same size as mine.  Her soup was some weird semi-solid gazpacho-appearing soup that was bloody awful. The salad was ok but the dressing was not a vinaigrette--it was too creamy.  It almost tasted as if there were cinnamon in it.  We were also disappointed by the food in the Grand Café.  She ordered chips and dips and all 3 were terribly bland.  We had chips and dip out at the pool during the summer and she loved it.    The rest of the stay was fine with the exception of the very tight video poker machines.  The party was well-done except for the fact that they didn't plan for vegans eating there, which is the case with my wife.  We tried to explain to the lady who waited on my table, but English was not her first language.  Such is the case more and more in this country unfortunately.   Overall I can't rate the stay higher than a 2.

I love this hotel and recently visited the spa !  NIKKI for facial!!!!!! She is the best ever.  She is such a cool people person , I came in with lots on my mind and stanoffish , minutes later we got to talk and I feel like she lifted a weight off my shoulders . My skin is glowing too !  I had half on my face flaky dry after perioral dermatitis I battled for 1 year , now it looks even complicity.  Thank you thank you thank you !  Go treat yourselves ladies .  Ps locals 30% OFF on weekdays !!!!!!

Unbelievable!!! they charged me $27.99 each for my 2 and 3 year old grandchildren on  Friday night Seafood Buffett.  I was so disappointed that I will never go back again.  I complained to the management and they could care less.  I would never go back to gamble or eat.  I would have paid 1/2 the price for the kids that only ate turkey and fruit.   GREEN VALLEY SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF THEMSELVES!!!

GVR is the business, cousin (I am a white person)  Anyway, I am a huge fan of GVR. It's my local place, where I see 90 percent of all the movies I go to, and where I go for oysters (Tides, bro).  Anyway, GVR is a nice casino and not as...something...as Sunset Station. It's hard for me to review an entire Casino Resort (and Spa!) but I can say the rooms are immaculate, spacious, and very comfortable. The food options are awesome (Hanks!) and the atmosphere is friendly (as casinos go).  I really like seeing movies at the Regal Cinemas located downstairs in GVR, so I will strongly suggest you patronize them. Terra Verde is pretty good, as is the buffet. The Grand Cafe is a more expensive but equally crappy version of Denny's.  I have zero knowledge of the hotel staff's personality, skills, competence, etc. I won't bother speculating.

Cant beat the value for this spot. I recently stayed here for one night with my husband and loved it. The rooms are beautiful and spacious and very clean. The service was great. We ordered room service a couple times and the food was decent. Nothing spectacular and of course, over priced but what else can you expect from hotel room service? The buffet and cafe were also pretty good and more reasonably priced. The only thing I hate is all the smoke in the casino but I suppose that's really unavoidable. We saw a movie and went to the spa. The spa was lovely. Overall, a great time! Will definitely go back again!

Very disappointed in the Green Valley Resort & Casino and the Station Casino organization. Upon check in we were asked If we wanted to upgrade. We would ONLY be paying $225 per night. We thought Wow what a deal. What wasn't made clear was the fees were over and above what we already paid. The front desk gave us the impression that we would ONLY be paying the $225 per night. Then we got the bill. Yikes!!! Spoke to the front desk supervisor. Because we signed the agreement  nothing could be done. Asked to split the difference. Too bad so sad.. We stay at the Station Casinos when ever we are in Vegas. Need to rethink that for future visits.

This place is amazing. Beautiful spa with hot and dry saunas, indoor hot tubs, outdoor private pool and hot tub, spa treatments, poolside food & drink service... THE WORKS! But the staff here is even better! I just ended a business trip and came to relax at the spa after lunch before heading to the airport. I ate lunch at King's Fish House across the street from the resort, and ended up with food poisoning. It hit me when I was at the spa pool, so I went into the locker room to use the bathroom. Silvia, who works at the spa, noticed I wasn't well and spent the next two and a half hours taking care of me while still doing her job at the spa... She went above, beyond and out of her way to make sure I was okay and had anything and everything I needed! She even called security to bring me a wheel chair so I didn't have to walk from the spa to the front desk to check back in. (Its a pretty short walk.)  Silvia, thank you so much for all your help and care today. You are one amazing woman and the GVR Spa is lucky to have you!  Also, want to give a shout out to Rick on the security team for wheeling me around and helping me to get checked back in and settled.
Needs a remodel. Plain and simple. No 24hr coffee shop. You can stop with the "we luv locals" crap. The M shows a lot more "luv" in every way.

this is a great place, being in  vegas and have peace, quiet getaway.  The layout is perfect...for casino is far from the other ameneties which make it  such a nice feature for an old feel modern mansion!!!.enjoyed their buffet and the other restaurants especially the spa nad the swimming pool..everything is marvelous!!!.
Green valley is not a good place to visit the workers have attitudes I could go in detail but wound't right know

This place doesn't get enough attention.  It's so beautifully designed and appointed. Super clean, comfortable and top notch staff. The pools are super. So many food choices! Room service was reasonably priced. Valet staff is fun and professional. Had a wonderful experience. Better than staying right on the strip.

Green Valley Ranch "The Buffet" ..... Why?  I have a really mixed review for this. I am a food and beverage manager by trade so I am very patient when it comes to the in's and out's of the restaurant business. We have eaten at the Green Valley Ranch Buffet on three different occasions. The first two occasions were on holidays and the buffet was amazing and although the lines were long the end result was good food good service and just a great time had by all.  This past week was an entirely different story...  I took the family to the buffet, looking forward to a great meal as usual, it was a Wednesday night during Easter Week, and after the debacle at The Golden Nugget this should be an easy pleaser..... Wrong! We were sat in the section facing the dessert case, the dessert case was smothered in filth, and the place was swarming with people. Maybe they were caught off guard with the amount of people that went there but the food line was a war zone. The Asian station was filled with food that not only looked dry and unappetizing but no one was doing anything about it.  When I first started out I did a drive by the dessert station to see if the case was dirty on the inside or the exterior and it was definitely on the exterior of the case, also noted that the bread pudding was emptied and the apple streusel was bordering gross looking. The vanilla sauce was broke and there was separation on top. The line was normally filled with fresh items usually very few fried products but tonight it was filled with everything fried, I'm not sure if Wednesday is Fried food Night but we were certainly in it. As I finished my plate of palatable food I turned to the dessert section once more, although there were plenty of cakes and pies on the inside the single person working was smothered deep in the ice cream section leaving the rest of the place to fin for themselves. The bread pudding was still empty, the apple streusel was even worse now and most of the pies and cakes were gone. I went along and asked for the Chef and a nice lady asked if she could help and I explained that the dessert lady needed a lot of help and she said she would help her. Still no chef to check things out and the front of the dessert station was getting worse, my wife pointed out that the food actually spelled out CRAP and as I looked at it sure enough written in food on the front of the case was "crap" I was laughing because at the time it was indeed crap. It got to the point where I just couldn't take it anymore and I went to look for the Chef again.... The same young lady cook asked if I needed help and let me know the Chef was here somewhere but how could she help me, I asked her to please find the chef to look at the front of the dessert case as it needed to be fixed, it was embarrassing me and I don't even work there. She once again came over to the dessert station and took the time to wipe down the entire front of the dessert glass showing off the 30 or so pies and cakes behind the filth and making the place look a lot better.  Sometimes when we work in a business or industry for too long we become jaded or even cynical to the every day operations, but sometimes things get so bad that even outside people feel the need to correct the lack of action from peers within similar operations.
Beautiful hotel, the room was spacious and elegantly decorated. Quaint. Good service and bonus, I was pretty lucky in the casino!

So we have been staying here for years but this year was surely different....it all began with the reception....the person there was kinda rude.  Sent us to timbuk two to our room...when I called him to see if we could change rooms he immediately asked what was wrong with our room.  I told him it was way too far and the view of the parking lot was not attractive.  He explained thats what we got for the rate we paid.  Which didnt not make sense because we always got a view of the pool.  When he finally decided to switch us we had to wait 3 more hours for our room to be ready.  So we paid for the room rate plus tax plus the resort fee plus tax and then drinks at the pool have an automatic 18% gratuity....what made it worse is that we brought another family along for their first time....will probably not be staying here again.....so please do not send me any more offers...thank you!

Loved it here! Beautiful and fun with excellent customer service. Cabanas are the best and you can walk to the outdoor mall. Much better than staying on the strip for sure. Would love to come here again!

We travel through Las Vegas twice a year so that's a total of four stays at GVR and we've been staying here for years so I consider myself a veteran guest of this hotel/resort.  The hotel itself is lovely, everything is clean, the rooms are great (hint: east tower is a little more Mediterranean in decor, the west tower is slightly more modern) but recently our casino host that rocks, Pete Scarpa Jr., has been putting us into some of the suites which we have really enjoyed. Pete never fails to personally greet us whenever we arrive and we're not that big of gamblers but it's always nice to receive such personal attention.  We started staying at GVR because we tow a boat along with us on vacation, and they have ample parking for vehicles with trailers, RV's and just about any sized vehicle. Their Security is top notch and we have never felt worried about leaving our packed boat in the parking lot.  This past month a cousin and myself stayed at GVR. It was her first visit and I was reminded through her fresh eyes as to why this property is so special. She really enjoyed the feeling of Las Vegas with all the lights and action, but at the same time there is a feeling of being so much more cared-for. The floor staff is incredible, we had some very interesting conversations with personable slot attendants that made us feel so welcome.  We love the new T-Shirt $1 slot area just outside Sushi/Saki and the mini jackpots every few minutes were great too. I won over $500 in casino quick cash drawing during my stay just for having my player's card in a machine. She also appreciated not having to walk three miles to get from one end of the complex to another and she has decided her days of staying on the strip are officially over! SO many places to eat both in the hotel, on the casino food fair and outside in The District Shopping Mall!   It was really hot when we were there so I didn't spend too much time at the pool but my cousin really enjoyed her time there.  The only negative (and this may change, given enough feedback) is that the management has made the decision to remove coffee machines from the rooms and have also done away with the coffee station in the lobby.  This is happening more and more, I see it in other hotels too but IMO if the hotel cannot afford to offer complimentary coffee then at least put in a keurig machine I can use a pod in, and offer pods in the in-room snack bar for purchase. I dislike having to get dressed in order to have a cup of coffee in the morning and I would much rather have the option to buy a cup in my room than have to traipse around the hotel with no makeup and my hair not done.

Nice looking place but too many smokers in the casino made it impossible for me to visit.  Maid service knocked at 9:30a, 10:30a and 11:15a the day I was to check out at noon. I finally expressed my frustration to the third maid and was told something about a red light indicator outside my room... No idea what she meant by that.  You really have to watch for signs leading to the East or West Tower guest rooms.   A "Resort Fee" of $25 plus tax for each day you stay is charged and includes a short list of amenities such as Internet service, but if you look at directions in the room, for logging in, it appears there is a daily fee for EACH device that connects.   Not my idea for a place to spend Mother's Day weekend.  I don't think I'd stay for any other reason due to smokers.

This Hotel Casino Resort is located off the strip a good 15 minutes or more away in Henderson.  Green Valley Ranch (GVR) was a 5 Star AAA 5 Diamond Hotel, I believe it has lost one of the AAA Diamonds over the years.  GVR is aging and it is starting to show throughout the hotel/resort.    GVR is a very nice quiet hotel with the Casino separate from the hotel by different wings.  The Pool(s) are located between the Hotel and the Casino with Adult themed, family, and children pools with a spectacular bridge that connects the outdoor bar and the main pool.   The rooms are showing age but the beds are still incredible in offering comfort and room size is decent (standard).  Not advertised but they charge a "hotel resort fee" for the "amenities" aka wireless internet (T1 speed) even if you do not use it.    There is a good mix of people here with locals and young people to families and serious gamblers.  This is the same resort/casino featured in "American Casino" reality show (canceled) on cable/network.  There is an Arcade and movie theater downstairs, the buffet is quite under-rated, a food court with a Fat Burger, and an outdoor mall located directly across the street with good retailers.  All in all I enjoy staying here when I want to get away from the busy Vegas Strip and am looking for some R&R especially for a conference.  The Staff here works hard to please but can be hard to find at times.  It is definitely in need of some updating and work but a nice quiet 4 star hotel none-the-less.

What a wonderful place to retreat! The grounds and rooms are in great condition. All staffs were helpful and accommodating. Everything you need is all in one place, you never need to leave the resort! The breakfast buffet was delicious and had so many breakfast, lunch and dinner options to chose from.  The only thing we had a problem with was loud neighbors, but after calling the front desk they were quick to address the issue with the other guests and all was remedied to our satisfaction.  I'll definitely be booking another vacation visit here, especially when it's hot enough to use of of the many pools and cabanas available!

Grrr.... What happened to customer service?  I asked security for directions:  "cant you just read the signs lady?" -- very helpful thank you. I asked the rewards center a question about points:  " if you ever bothered to read the small print you wouldn't be standing here asking me questions"... Very nice... I have an autistic son who is nicer than you.  The cocktail waitress:  " Drinks? Drinks? Hey you???  (Approaches man to my right) You want a drink or what?" Followed by some gum smacking and long sigh. Wow ... Speechless!!!  Housekeeping spotted in the bathroom, back stall sharing food!!! Gross and saddened to know the employees have to hide to eat.  Go back to back customer service Stations Casino.   As an executive I am appalled at  how your organization  is running.  Treat your employees  with respect, no one deserves to cower in the corner eating food in a bathroom...and for goodness sake ...try some old fashioned manners 101 with your employees.

I recently attended a work conference here and I must say I was thoroughly impressed with this resort.    Work conferences can be both helpful and informative, but also draining and long.  Having it at GVR was a perfect place.  They had many different conference rooms available with a very spacious and easy to navigate floor plan.  The rooms were very nice offering a great view of the pool area and a very nice spacious bathroom.    The food that our company ordered was outstanding.  Every meal they had many options to choose from, for all types of eaters (gluten free, traditional, vegetarian, etc.) When I first got in, I ate at one of the cafes they had onsite, and it was good.    I am not a gambler, but the casino seemed to be spacious and offer a wide variety of guilty pleasures to increase or decrease your wallet.  THe only thing I dont care for is all the smoke in the Casino's, but I know that is just how it goes.    THe location was a bit outside of the Vegas center, but not a bad cab/Uber drive to get to the Strip or Fremont street.    I really enjoyed my stay at GVR.  Thank you fir the great hospitality, delicious food, beautiful views and over all lovely experience.
This is a good place to relax, being in Vegas, but quite far away from the crazy crowd by the strip. We like going back to this place, for service, rooms and amenities. Can't go wrong with this one.

Resort looks very nice and great appearance but rooms have very poor plumbing.  Heard water being ran through pipes all night and hardly got any sleep.  Got groupon deal but look to pay 29 dollars per night for resort fee even though groupon states 24.99 and another 18 dollars in tax per night ( 47 dollars per day).  Spa and workout facilities are kept up very nicely and pool is also very nice.

I decided I'd go all out to show my thanks to my realtor who has helped me with just about everything as I am I new resident to Nevada.  She said she liked steak so I heard this was the best --Absolutely delicious! We both had lobster tails with our petite filets cooked perfectly. The lobster was so tasty I didn't even use the butter. My side was mushrooms--so good and my gin martini with stuffed blue cheese olives was unlike any martini I've ever had. I'll be back for more of them for sure! The service was excellent and the everyone was so attentive.

Never booking here again. God forbid you have to make any changes!! Booked here last night and realized in the morning that the location is too far from events that we will be attending. Called to cancel just to be told I will be charged for the first night, which is 3 days away! No type of effort to assist in the matter, never booking with this place again!!! So frustrating.

This is one of my fave casino off the strip. You don't have to deal with all of the tourists and traffic. Those planning to stay here, it's about 10 miles/20 mins or so to The Strip.  Although I've not stayed here, but heard from friends, the rooms and spa are very nice. The rooms are from $80-$320 during summer the last time I checked.   The gaming area/casino floor is clean and huge and well setup and you can find all your favorite games and have a wonderfull time. Make sure to get your club card for points and nice discount on Feast Buffet.  I love the pool area esp the sand bottom pool named 'The Backyard. ' If you're a local they won't let you into the resort pool unless you have a pass or pay a small fee but call them since the rules are always changing. You can go to the 21+ pool called 'The Pond', it's free and the DJ plays good music.  There are many restaurants to choose from when you get hungry. They have Hank's Fine Steaks, Borracha, Pizza Rock, Feast Buffet, and a few more places. There is also a Food Court.  In addition, there is also a Cinema in the building and free parking.

Second visit to GVR.  Last year we stayed in the basic room, which was clean and a bit larger than expected.  This Trip, we enjoyed the 1,000 square foot suite in the east tower.  East tower is awesome if you want to be close to the Valet and avoid much of the smoke from the casino.  Suite was clean, had the wanted stuffs such as two TVs, a mini bar that can hold a few of your own items.  -not the annoying pressure sensitive kind of mini bar.  No complaints on the hotel at all.  Book direct, sign up for the rewards card, book the low cost room.  You'll likely be offered a low cost upgrade 24 hours after you book.

WORST SPA DAY EVER!!!!!!   I booked what was going to be a valentine romantic massage for 2 from a special that was email advertised. It was a bait and switch as it clearly stated 175.00 for a couples massage, foot scrub, and champagne toast.  1. Got there to discover things were not working in the mens locker room. Steam room was broken and there were workers coming in to check it out....Far from relaxing when you just want to sit quietly and take a steam. The first person I asked said just leave the door open and it will come on. After 5 min of nothing I went to the front desk to ask and sure enough it is fully broken...Would have been nice to know when we checked in.....Attendants did not care at all!!!!!  2. No cold drinking water that the attendants would get me so I walked back to the front desk up the stairs and found a could water for myself...You would think that a spa would have drinking water right?  3. They had some snacks out pretzels, granola, and apples. All of which were stale and the apples were boarder line rotting.  4. The massage was a body massage, foot scrub, champagne special, No one seemed to know about the champagne toast. They came and found us later on with plastic cups of nasty bubbly....would have been nice to enjoy it in the room we has a massage in.  5. Time to go and cant wait to leave. Needles to say checkout was a nightmare. Britney and Rachael were so rude and totally stressed us out after our massage.......The email I got from them and brought with me clearly said 175 for the couples massage. They tried to double charge me and said it was per person......Thankfully I have the email with me and no where did it state per person. Once we got things straight Rachael decided she wanted to be more rude to us by saying we will never offer you a discount again.....How service people like this have jobs is beyond me....I hope this helps others that go there and accept their bait and switch tactics. Always say something and stand up for yourself at these type of places that look to rip you off. This all stemmed from their advertisement for a Valentines day special (bait and switch).  I brought all of my concerns to the managers that clearly did not care about me and my wife. My interaction with them was horrible and when I left I was more stressed than when I came in.  This is the last time I will go to this spa as there are so many really good choices in town. I did give a full tip to the massage therapists as the rudeness came from the front desk. I told Rachael that her rudeness would affect the other workers tips and that would not be right. She apologized with a crapppppy condescending smile  Rachael is the winner of the rudest person I have met this year.....you work at a spa and should send people home relaxed....Epic fail Green Valley Ranch Spa....  I learned my lesson!!!! Never will go there again!!!
It's a good place just to hang out.  It's a casino, when you live here, it's really no big deal.  I'm not a gambler, so we just hung out and had a couple of drinks.

By far the best resort me and my husband has stayed at from the time we walked up to check in with (Michael)to checking out! Came here to celebrate my 25th birthday. When checking in Michael asked what brought us to the resort we told him for my Birthday. We where getting settled into our room when someone came with dipped strawberries with a card saying "Happy Birthday" by far the best costumer service. We also ate at the restaurant Hanks amazing costumer service and amazing food. Thanks Green Valley Ranch

Beautiful property, convenient - close to airport and right next to an outdoor mall. Not great if you're going to party, but perfect if you're coming for a conference or to lay by the pool. Pool is clean and beautiful!! The bathroom in the room was questionable (mildew in the shower EW!) and the lighting was horrific! Skimpy on the electrical outlets.  NO coffee pot in the room! The room that overlooked a PARKING LOT! Stay away from East Tower 8534. Customer service was not tops - i called about my safe (it was locked) and the woman on the phone was so rude and condescending. I give this place an "eh." But seriously, that pool... And the cool lobby bar!

I'm not a Vegas fan.  I don't gamble & I'm not crazy about casinos. My husband had a meeting so I decided to tag along for some sun. I LOVED this place!  1. If you don't have kids with you enjoy the relaxing spa pool. Great attentive friendly service & peaceful.  2. Massage- spa! Amazing!!! Steam room. Dry sauna, whirlpool etc... Spa was beautiful & clean & relaxing. Randy gave an amazing massage. I had a great mani pedi from a very sweet girl named Rhianna. She was a pro!! The salon was pretty & clean. Impressive. Wag I had my hair done. 3. Our room was really pretty & clean & bright with lots of light. Our room service lady was SO sweet! She poured my coffee and handed it to me in bed.  4. Drinks we're great. 3 glasses of Pinot & four mimosa . Yum!  5. Staff is SO friendly and professional.  I really enjoyed my stay & will for sure come back.  My one complaint is front desk staff could be friendlier & smile. Also they need to change the brown polyester uniforms worn by some of the staff- Poor things look hot & they are ugly.

I love the pool setting at Gvr because its child friendly. I have two complaints though. I truly believe there should be a designated smoking area so that children and non smokers are not affected by chain smokers.  Complaint number 2:   I absolutely cannot believe that at two separate occasions I have felt harassed for an additional tip by the waitresses. If you are not aware Gvr pool automatically adds an 18% gratuity to your bill for your servers.  Which is fine in my opinion. What I found completely appalling was that on two separate days I was told by my waitress at our cabana " although a tip was already added, " you can leave me a better tip if  you feel I did a good job. I totally took care of you, and you know, this is Vegas.. You know how it goes."  Ok, so my bill at the cabana was 500+90 for tip So basically 90.00 is not enough, she felt I needed to give her more $. She stood there and gave me a funny look. Either way I felt like an ass if I didn't tip out more so I gave her 50.00 extra.  It didn't stop there. She also kept joking that she wanted our champagne bottle. So, I gave her my comped bottle of cheap Moët. She wanted the yellow label but I didn't give it to her. I feel like an idiot now.  Memorial weekend I returned to the general pool not a cabana.  Upon closing my 188.00 check, the waitress tells me " I know the tip was already added but feel free to add more of a tip if you want to, if you were happy with my service. You know, if you think I did a good job". So, I felt pressured again and left an additional tip again! Idiot me!!  This is completely unprofessional. I've never been pressured for extra money. I am a generous tipper being as I am in the tipping industry myself. I would never request a tip from anyone. I hope this review creates awareness so others don't get suckered for more $.

We have gone to the buffer for years back when they had crab nightly and for us it was the best buffet ever. We always ate here one while visiting from SoCal The crab buffet  ended a few years ago but we happened to be in town and noticed the buffet had crab on Friday night so we went We waited for 1.5 hours in line started shortly after 7 pm. They had several VIP lines and sat everyone in those lines before general public - very unfair. The crab legs were tiny baby crab no meat like before and poor tasting This buffet went from the top of our choice to where we will never go back  They are out of town in Henderson and used to worth the drive but  not anymore most other casinos have a better buffet and better service

I love GVR!  It's always super clean and most of the workers are friendly.  The rooms are beautiful as well.    There are a lot of places to eat inside from a nice food court all the way to high end steaks and sushi.  Hanks Steakhouse is probably the best meal I've ever had.  Try the creamed corn.. seriously!  It will change your life.  Always lots of gaming tables and a couple really cool bars to hang out at.  Drop Bar is especially awesome after 9 or so at night.  The majority of the night shift casino dealers are very nice..  much nicer than most of the annoyed, angry dealers on the strip!!  Love the dealers here.  Don't forget to throw em a tip!  :)  They now have $5 double deck Blackjack 24/7.  There's 2 parking garages and also a large street level lot on one side.  There's also 2 different valets I think.  There's a nice movie theater too!  2 minute walk from the casino there's a shopping area called The District which has lots of places to eat, bars, coffee, ice cream, frozen yogurt, and also some nice shops to buy clothing and other things.  The casino's gift shop has some really nice things in it as well as the prices aren't terrible marked up surprisingly.  The pool is GORGEOUS and has an area with beach sand that goes into the pool.  There's usually more children around than I like but that's why they have a separate 21+ pool.  There's a beautiful private pool for the spa but I've never been able to use it.  :'(  I really can't say enough good things about this casino.  I purposely chose the house  I live in because it's one mile away.. that's either pretty cool or pretty sad.  haha  I am super excited that they fired their casino manager a couple months ago.  She was terrible and was completely ruining the casino!  GOOD JOB, GVR!!

This is one of my favorite local casinos since moving to LV years ago. A little bit of a drive for me but worth it in the long run. I like how the slot machines are spread out and it's not crammed like some places. I hate being around smoke but I don't feel overwhelmed from second hand smoke here. They food court has some nice options for a quick bite and they have some decent restaurants. I noticed they will be opening a few new places and Pizza Rock will be one of them. I don't gamble often but when I do I try and get to GVR.

Stayed here for 3 nights for a small conference and absolutely loved it. Loved how the hotel was a little separated from the casino. It was nice to step off the elevator and not be right in the casino. Room was very nice and good size. Pool was great and so were the cocktails. Not cheap, but pool cocktails usually aren't cheap. We had great food there as well. I don't like buffets but really enjoyed the buffet there. Overall, we had a great experience and a lot of fun. A great place to stay off the strip.

Love the ambience of this casino unlike the Strip. At least the machines give you a payout at times unlike Downtown.  They also have a wide selection of Video Poker machines whereas on the Strip, they don't offer very many of them.

Friday afternoon at 4:00pm, only 1 person working the Cashier Cage and 40+ people in line. Very poor Management. They do not care about Local's as I've overheard numerous times, 'We dont care about the little amount Local's spend here anyway'. This is the type of classless attitudes and lack of Management from the top that give this Shit-Hole the reputation that they have with Local's!
Was a bit disappointed in our recent stay. Shower leaked and didn't get fixed. Little things that add up to a less than impressive stay. Pool closed early on Saturday.  Resulted in an "ok" stay.
Shout out to Tony And Dave at the sports bar! These guys are the friendliest bar tenders in town hands down!  If you are in a bad mood go see these guys at the sports book in GVR!

Beautiful.  This was a great place to spend the weekend. We relaxed in the warm pool, ate at the tasty buffet, lost twenty bucks gambling and never once left to visit the strip.   There was no real reason to visit the strip. This resort had it all. The staff were very polite and courteous. We had a parking mix up and ended up on the complete opposite side of the resort lost and trying to find the lobby to check in. We found a nice casino worker who escorted us over to the check in desk and also offered to carry a cooler I kept dropping.  The rooms were beautiful as well. The bathroom was gigantic with a huge soaking tub. The bed was comfy and filled with plenty of pillows. Also we had a perfect view of the strip, so we never missed the Vegas lights.

Father's Day Weekend 2014  Hubby had some COMP nights and free tickets to the "Oh What a Night!" Tribute to Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons for Father's Day weekend. Since we've never stayed here before we decided to try it out...  5-stars: FREE show tickets H (12-years-old) and I went to the show and we were probably one of the youngest attendees there!  LOL!  We enjoyed it!  3-stars: Pool A very family-friendly pool!  Little O loves the sand area and shallow end. She had fun making new friends.  CON=smoking allowed anywhere. :( Horrible when it's windy and you're down wind (one of the days we were out there)  3-stars: Food Court Typical variety of food court choices--Fatburger, Capriotti's, Frozen Yogurt, Smoothies, Starbucks and Panda Express.  Panda Express had free soda refills if you bought a large soda.   2-stars: Arcade 80 tokens for $20--great deal, comparable to Chuck E. Cheese, right?  Nope!   CON: Games were "2 tokens" per game! :( Decent variety of games.   4-stars: Walk to Shopping We liked walking out to The District shopping area, but not our typical stores. The Splash Pad was a great stop for free water play for O! REI was at the end of the shops and we always love window shopping in there. We bought food at Rachel's Kitchen and took it back to our room for dinner.   5-stars: Fitness Room I LOVED this spa because it incorporated the fitness room. I was able to get a locker while I worked out but didn't get a chance to use the sauna or facilities. :( But I enjoyed the drinks and snacks in the Quiet Room for a few minutes after working out. I switched with the hubby and he went to work out while I watched the kids at the pool. Great variety of equipment and clean.   1-star: Casino It sucked up our money fast!  Not a very giving casino. :( Hubby even had $100 free table play...didn't help! :(  Overall, a good experience but I don't think it makes our list of places to come back to.

Green Valley Resort and Casino really isn't that old. It is one of the newer Station Casinos. But it does feel a bit run down inside though. I have never seen any part of this place except the casino, so this is just about that. Each time I have been there there isn't that vibrance and energy that is nice in a casino.   The dealers and staff here are no nonsense. They know what they are doing and have been around the block. There are always $5 tables if you like to gamble small. My drink order did get messed up here twice though and I kind of prefer when dealers are a bit more sociable and actually talk to players and engage in the game instead of making it seem like a boring job. A smile makes losing money so much better.  This is a good locals place and is good if you want low limits for table play, but don't expect fancy. Green Valley is pretty low frills.

I love coming here! The 30% local discount is amazing.  Sue is an amazing massage therapist!( I think that's how you spell her name) and Tina was my esthetician!! She did an amazing job with my facial! I will definitely always book with her every time I come in.  Just a few things I didn't like unfortunately but I'm referring to the receptionists who were not on the same page with their "new systems" I LOVE the fact I can have a mimosa while I wait for my services but hate waiting... But they started a new system being able to sell mimosas at the desk which was awesome! (So I didn't have to wait 30 minutes for room service) Brittany the receptionist was great and gave me my mimosa right away. Which was $10. Expensive! but I was willing to pay since it was right away. After my service I was wanting to use the rest of the amenities at the spa which was included....  Before using the pool I wanted another mimosa; I went to the front desk to order one. I noticed Brittany wasn't at the desk it was someone new and she said we don't allow to give mimosas and that I would have to order through the room service or outside bar... I then told her I was served one just an hour ago. She said she was confused because they only do that under certain circumstances( either complimentary or for birthdays) ... I was then confused and let her know I payed for my first one and got one right away. She then said. Let me talk to my manager. She said I'm so sorry we just started doing that today and I will give you a complimentary one for making me wait ( how could I be mad then) but as I was leaving she then told me; so the drinks were just a promotion and we will not be serving drinks anymore. I then told her I would appreciate a little more consistency next time I come in...  other than that... Brittany, Sue & Tina will be the highlight of my experiences here at GVR. I will come back but expect more consistency considering I'm in the same exact business. :)
At the sports book ready to watch the World Series. Crowded, finger food, lots of excitement, great staff, very very organized, and making some bets!

The pool wasn't what I expected. Extremely crowded with kids , very messy. Which may have been a result of all the kids running around but either way it was the least bit relaxing and "upscale" like they try to pretend to be. The drinks are over priced and watered down. The food is average, nothing to brag about. The girls are not very attractive and have pretty crummy attitudes. I've been there several times and have never gotten a pretty or nice server.  I had a brunette every time which is great but the attitudes on these girls just suck ! Natalie? I think her name was or Natasha something like that. She was the worst !! I think she is just a server assistant but she's terribly snooty. Then we had Sara who was quite stuck up . And a couple times we've had an Asian girl who's name I can't remember but she had the dryest personality and permanent bitch face!  This company needs to upgrade not only their food and beverages but they need to be pickier with whom they choose to serve them! I've given gvr several chances because it's close and the shopping and restaurants have never disappointed but this pool is every meaning of the word disappointment..

I recently spent 5 days in this resort for a wedding. While this resort is beautiful and very clean we ended up with multiple issues that would prevent us from staying here again.   Pro's ------- - Large Clean rooms (large room and bathroom with deep soaking tub and separate shower) - Clean, comfortable, and quiet pool area (padded lounge chairs and excellent serving staff) - Friendly Staff ( main desk and cleaning staff was very friendly)  Con's -------- - Air Conditioning (even set at 60 degrees the room was very warm at all times probably sitting at around 75-80, many of the parties we traveled with reported the same issue. Many of us tried calling the desk for assistance but sadly the issue was never resolved) - Service (whether at the buffet or at some of the bars throughout the resort service tends to be slow and at times forgetful, waiting 25 minutes for creamer for coffee or a drink refill is crazy. The bar in the lobby need some serious help with speed also) - Casino (while beautiful most things seem to shut down early and table players will find there aren't many options from 12 am -12 pm)

Why is it so difficult to cook bacon correctly? Today at the buffet, we are there three times a week, with a group, and the bacon was raw. Doesn't any one check? It is more raw than cooked!  Will be there again in a couple of days, will see if there is any improvement.

If you are looking to take the family on a little vacation to Las Vegas, Green Valley Ranch is definitely the place to go.  The resort is about a 15 minute cab ride from the strip.  The facility looks as if it has been recently remodeled, the rooms are spacious, clean and in great condition.  The bathrooms have a stand alone shower and a fabulous full size tub.  The staff is friendly and extremely helpful.  There is a ton of stuff to do without ever leaving the resort.  Compared to the prices of hotels on the strip this place is a steal for what you get.  They have a casino, restaurants, clubs, bars, pools and a spa and the prices are reasonable.  The resort is also just a quick 10 minute walk to the neighborhood restaurants and grocery store.  If you are looking for a place to stay in Vegas close enough to the strip but far away from the chaos....this is definitely the place to go.

This is the worst station casino I've seen a concert at in Vegas. Bathrooms are outside the venue so you have to go through a line again every time. Also, beer line takes an hour to go though. It was pathetic

This casino has its advantages being 15 minutes away from the strip.  The traffic getting in and out of here is not bad at all nor is their an overcrowding issue inside the casino.  My family and I like to come here for the shopping, movies, and buffet.  The buffet is really a review in itself but to keep it short and sweet, it's pretty good and great variety of dishes to include s Mongolian BBQ station.  The cigarette smoke is my only complaint as some casinos have better ventilation than others.  Overall I always have a great experience at the green valley ranch casino and would recommend it to friends.

Terrible local customer service. Beautiful resort and restaurants but they fail to take good care of locals. They used to cater for local ambition but lately they have been drawn in to becoming a resort i.e. MGm. It's sad to see it transition this way because I've been a fan since 2007 but with all the event bookings and over flow, gvr has now become a senseless strip hotel. Please bring back the station casinos that locals have gathered behind and we ll be there

7-18-2015  I don't normally  write reviews for places that have been reviewed many times by others as I think it's redundant, but I recently ate lunch at Green Valley Ranch Buffet and was pleasantly surprised that the quality of the food was so much better than the other Station Casinos that I thought it deserved to be reviewed.  I visited on a Saturday and the Casino was very busy.  There was a line for the Buffet and it took about 20 minutes to get in.  I was seated and noticed that the chair was comfortable, something I hadn't noticed before.  I tried samples of various food.  The Chicken was cooked properly and had a good flavor.  The Mexican Rice was really good as was the taco meat, seasoned well and was tasty.  The BBQ sausage was good, and so were the BBQ Chicken Wings.  The BBQ Ribs were tender and tasty.  I had Apple Cobbler and Carrot Cake with frozen Vanilla Yogurt (Ice Cream?) on top.  The quality of everything I ate was better than what is served at other Station Casinos.  The service was good and my drink was filled as needed and dirty plates were removed in a timely manner.  The wait staff was busy but were friendly and asked me if I needed anything several times.  Sometimes it's the little things that make the difference or add to a pleasant dinning experience and I think GVR got it right this time.

I stay here often, the staff is very friendly. Nice, clean  rooms and big restrooms. Place to shop within walking distance. Several wonderful restaurants nearby if you get tired of the restaurants inside the property. Also, a whole foods across the street.  If you want all the party scene then you should stay on the strip but if you want peace and quiet, this is your place.  Restaurants: The buffet is very good with moderate pricing. If you gamble, you can use your points to pay for the meal.   Con's: This trip (9/3) they are doing a remodel, there was some noise but that to be expected. Air conditioning was turned down to 60 and eventually got to a comfortable temperature of about 75.  Gambling: Well it's the reason it's called gambling. However, 3 times I played max bet $3.75-$4.00, machine hit the bonus but only paid less than $50. Machines were very tight and payouts are better at other casino's. I prefer the M casino on slots.  Be careful with the resort fee anywhere that you stay in Vegas! Even if the room is a comp there might be a $14.50 resort fee. Just ask.  Internet was included in my stay this time but ended up charging me $12.99, I called the desk to reverse the charge.   Over all, this is where I like to stay, it's off the strip and close to everything I enjoy doing.

Nearing our check in date I received a personal email from the concierge which I thought was a very nice touch. It added to the excitement because this resort was talked up by my boyfriend who is from Henderson. Unfortunately, upon check in I was very disappointed at the lack of customer service. The person that checked us in was near the point of rude. I expect a high level of customer service at any hotel or restaurant and have an even higher one in a place like this. The front desk employee was robotic, not at all personable, did not explain any of the amenities, etc. The room was nice but our hallway smelled of sewage. Great bathtub!! Some of the waitstaff within the casino restaurants were snarky. The room service staff were great to interact with and the food was enjoyable (minus the Bloody Mary). I thought about mentioning something upon check out but we interacted with same front desk employee as when we checked in. Again, rude (if not ruder then before). She did not ask us how our stay was, explain any of the charges, and robotic. Overall it was an ok stay.

5 stars hands down. Stayed in the suite by the pool and it was awesome. Huge! Step down spa tubs, walk in showers, personal pool on the patio, pool table and digital hand held control of the entire room. Room service was impeccable, house keeping does a fantastic job on the rooms and make them look brand new everyday. Beds were perfectly comfortable and the couch was better than mine at home. Huge tv's and completely spacious thru the entire suite. Only issue I had was the fridge was a bit off but it was handled only moments after I let the front desk know of it. So I keep my 5 star review. This place is off the strip and perfect for those who value space and privacy and don't want to deal with the hustle and bustle of down town. Well worth the moderate price
A very underrated casino and hotel.  A little off the beaten path, but great bars, spacious sportsbook, and a laid back pace.  Also super easy free parking!
Love GVR. Good food, good pool, good sports book and have Kona Longboard on Tap!!

This resort is absolutely incredible. As a local, I enjoy coming here for their restaurants which are excellent. They also have a movie theater (as do most resorts in Vegas), which is accessible without having to walk through the smoky casino floor (which is unlike most resorts in Vegas).  Staff is always friendly and willing to help and can provide great recommendations for lunch or dinner or any other need you may have.  I highly recommend this resort during the Christmas holiday since they setup an ice skating rink by their pool and sell Hot Cocoa, Apple Cider, and other holiday eats while you're getting your skate on!

I don't like casinos and/or casino hotels, but I must admit, this hotel is one of the BEST hotels to stay at in Vegas. The rooms are extremely clean and neat, and if you're a hotel guest the spa area is free to use their basic services (sauna room, steam room, and a large jet spa - workout room too). They also offer massages and other fee based services as well. They have two pools to relax in, but I prefer their secluded rooftop pool in the spa area over the main pool downstairs. On the rooftop you can order drinks and food while you swim and/or relax in the sun.

Gotta be the best Stations Casino in Las Vegas!  Upscale, Inviting, & a very accommodating Hotel/Casino in Green Valley Ranch - Henderson, NV.  (10-15 minutes from the Las Vegas Airport)  The Hotel is excellent. Beds are super comfortable. Rooms are large and comfortable.  Mini-fridge is stocked and ready for a party.   The pool is very nice! And the spa is incredible. Gotta be the best Spa in Vegas.   The Casino is awesome! Large casino floor with tons of modern games and table games. Poker room is always packed. Sports Book is great - large with a VIP lounge as well. And you can't beat the $0.99 Margaritas at the sports bar.   Shopping and dining around the area is great too!
