They could have handed out some water, brought luggage tags over so we could store our belongings, etc.  they could have had us fill out the paperwork for our rooms so once we got to the front of the line it could be expedited but instead they did everything on paper with ineffectiveness. Again, that would be expected since systems were down. They truly need to work on effectiveness.  They could have had us filling out what they needed to streamline their process.  We needed to attend a conference so I dropped off my things at the bellhop (which was another line I needed to wait in after waiting in line for 30 minutes to NOT get checked in).  The rooms were typical, no complaints here.  Except for the fact that many of my peers were given rooms with guests already in them, one person found cockroaches in her room and we were spread across all over the grounds of this establishment.  Again anticipating 150 people were coming in (which the conference has been planned and booked months in advance). They could have kept us all in one area so it would make out trek to the conference rooms easier.  The food during my 3 day conference was terrible.  I barely ate and even when we were eating, I felt rushed.  The staff would clear up as soon as they gave us our food.  Dinner was completed and the man came and took all the salt and pepper shakers off the table even before dessert came out.  Some people were still finishing up their dinners when they did this.  He couldn't wait for after we were done to clear the table?   Literally, there were so pmany things that went wrong I can't even possibly write this all in.  There is one last thing I do want to mention.  The last day of the conference, they again did not anticipate 150 people needing to leave to catch flights.  They only had 10 cabs available.  10x4 to a cab = 40 people!!! 150 was what they should have anticipated!!!! After waiting  a hour and 10 minutes, I finally got on a cab.    Not to mention, I don't think one person from their staff was cordial or welcoming to us.  We all work in customer service and this establishment needs to go back to training or hire some effective team members.  I will say it always start from the top.  The management should have been on point here to ensure a seamless experience for us but they failed terribly.  Needless to say, I will NEVER come back here on my own dime which is a terrible loss for Green Valley because if they know anything about customer experience,  each person with a negative experience tells 5-8 people.  With social media (and all systems are up here) ... You get the point. Tsk. Tsk.

Great casino, excellent Vibe, wonderful, beautiful environment and classy atmosphere, nice overall feel. Very clean, friendly engaging helpful workers. Good assortment of slots and a "GREAT RACE & SPORTS BOOK" Big clean, great screens. Nice assortments of restaurants, Don't know how good, never smell any aroma spilling out, Uhm. Don't like that. Otherwise casino over all, Clean, elegant, classy and big. Great place, Excellent Race Book. Plenty of easy parking. Valet for the lazy. Never use it. But it's here. Don't like strangers rummaging thru my car, and driving it Reckless, rather get in some exercise and park myself. Average person could use some exercise with all the junk food they eat, lol Casino is Stupendous! TREAT YOURSELF - ITS CLASSY ! It's FUN, It's Clean, pretty surroundings! NO RIFF RAFF! Good Class of People !

We have stayed here a few times but the most recent stay was for 10 days and this place takes care of you!    This place is wonderful as you don't feel like you are in Vegas let along at a casino! The pools and fitness/spa area is the best! With shopping and theater's right outside and great eateries all around; what a perfect place to stay! I am a Crap's player and enjoy playing here!   You will not be disappointed when you stay here...check it out get away from the strip and enjoy Vegas!

We are staying for the first time at this magnificent property!!   First, when you arrive you are greeted by courteous valets and bellmen. The finishes are superb and it feels like a classy place. One of the first things I noticed was that there was no smoke odor in the air. The hotel portion of the property is smoke free!!   When we checked in, the staff was courteous and got us checked in right away. I did not particularly like being upsold on our room not once. It twice during the check in process.   Our room is a "deluxe king" room...also know as the basic non view room . The room is well finished with tall ceilings and a beautiful spacious bathroom. The bed is super comfortable.   The negatives of the room were the A/C struggles to cool the room. I often found myself on top of the covers sweating despite setting the thermostat on 63! Also...this is a place for a romantic getaway...there has been some spectacular events occurring in the bed!! However, this bed squeaks louder than the bed in your parents guest room!!!!   The pool is amazing! The buffet is delicious!   I took one star off for the A/C, however we will be back again.

This property is amazing and clean however the only annoyance I have is that because the property is so large that It takes me 20 mins once I park valet to walk to my room. I do a lot of in and out while in the area so its not very convenient for me but I would come back and ask for a closer room next time. The sand pool is amazing esp for children and the room service food is very impressive especially the chicken pot pie and they have 24 hour breakfast which is amazing because I love to eat pancakes at night .

We are locals, and we love the GVR...everything about it except for one thing.  My wife and I frequently get comp drinks for this or that, and the only place you can cash in the comp is at the bar in the sports book.  My wife and I are both scotch drinkers, and the only Scotch we can get, on our level anyway,  is from the gun.  Oh my god... is it horrible!!!!!  We can handle bad scotch from the bottle, but man ... this is a rubber tasting horrible drink.  Please GVR, either clean your lines or just get a couple cheap bottles of scotch and pour from the bottle. The Green Valley Ranch is a level above other local casinos. Please correct this oversight. Thank you. Two loyal local customers.

Absolutely love that this casino is right down the street from us.  Payouts are great and most of the staff is amazing.  My favorite card dealers are Tristan and Gail.  They'll stop us when we're just walking around to say hello and check in on us.  We've only had one bad experience with one of the high limit bartenders which was taken care of promptly by the assistant bar manager.   Bingo is super fun to play here and usually pays out well especially if you hit the earlier game times.   Overall a fun place to play if you have a few extra bucks.

This review is for the Spa at GVR...  It was amazing.  They now offer 20% off 7 days a week for vegas residents.  The massage was amazing.  I had Jodi, and she was awesome!  It was relaxing, and perfect.  The only thing i would have hoped of more for was more co-ed stuff.  They only had 1 jacuzzi where i could hang out with my boyfriend before/after our massages.

Pretty close to the house so we have been there a few times. Very nice property, usually quiet. Have noticed kind of an older crowd. This is one of the "upscale" Station casinos. Got a bunch of $50 gift cards for $25ea. Easy to find parking in the garage (out of the sun.)   Their buffet is smaller and the line can be quite long and slow moving. If you get a players club card the buffet is a good deal. The origional pancake house has a great apple pancake. The have a theater and are close to shopping and restaurants.  Have had mixed success at blackjack but the dealers are always friendly. Think i am about even or perhaps a little behind. Have found it nearly impossable to get a cocktail. oh well saves on tips. Not sure about slots but have not heard of any friends retiring on their winnings from GVR.

Absolute gorgeous hotel in a prime location. The bartenders at the sports bar are the best/friendliest staff I've encountered. The restaurants are really good with something for everyone, it's also next to the district where you can shop and eat as well.

Went to the Green Valley Ranch Spa yesterday it was probably one of the best massages I've had in a long time my girl was Named Sue and it's both like the Sioux Indians Squad she is really really good they treat you like gold they're the only thing I didn't like is they make you tip I think that if I wasn't made to tip I probably would have tipped more but otherwise overall it was a really great treatment that is the only thing that I find wrong about the place is I understand tipping and I understand what to add to but please don't make me do it

Bottom line, the cashiers in the cage and their management (Marnie and Janet) do not value locals and regardless of how much money one might spend at the restaurants and theaters, it doesn't matter if you don't gamble. There is no benefit to being a Station Casino card holder. I wasn't allowed to cash a check because they had no record of me ever having cashed a check. When I told Marnie and Janet that I had in fact cashed a check in December, they implied I was either lying or mistaken because they had the nerve to suggest it was probably a different Casino I went to. Yes, because I am that much of an idiot to get big hotels with distinctive lights and general thematic aesthetics all mixed up. The funny part? I went in the next day and asked about check cashing policies and a different manager and cashier (Leila and Jackie) told me they would have, more than likely, just cashed it because the check wasn't over the limit and that it was from a well known blank. Janet and Marnie simply did not want to help me for whatever reason. I worked in hospitality (front desk) for two years and I can assure you that Marnie and Janet were so far removed from guest service standards that it was genuinely jarring. I've reached out to corporate and I will post any updates. Judging by the lack of response from GVR on this website, I doubt it will yield anything.

Absolutely beautiful resort if you don't mind being 10 minutes off the strip.   You get the high end resort feel without the Vegas hustle and bustle.  I usually stay on the strip and did for New Year's Eve but took a chance in priceline with this hotel and it was awesome.  Beautiful rooms and a 24 hot tub.  There is a Casino attached but you would never know as its on the back side.  You don't have to walk through the smoke to get to your room.  There was no wait each time for valet which is a huge plus.  Not sure I'd take a cab here is a little far   I found this place on priceline and the funny thing it said it's by the airport 4.5 stars but it's definitely not.  Not sure who to blame for that.  My only compliant would be the $30 resort fee but it seems they are all doing it now in VEGAS

Came here for my fiancee's Christmas Party and booked a room for the night.  The room was beautiful, but our window was facing the parking lot.  Not my favorite part of it.  The bathroom was gorgeous and spacious.  The grounds were well kept.  The pool was breathtaking.  Will come back in the summer.  The catering was decent for the Christmas Party, pretty standard fare (prime rib, chicken, salmon, veggies and various salads).  Great time overall!!!

I need to write a positive review of GVR because it appears the poor place has gotten a bad rap.  OK, first:  I wasn't staying at the hotel so I can't comment on that.  My wife and I went there to gamble for a few hours and the four stars is for the loose slots -- much better than the Vegas strip -- we both walked away up, which on slots is rare. Also I had such a wonderful time playing Craps with the local old men that it will now be a funny and great memory (the lone out of town chic hanging out on a Sunday morning getting betting tips from these dudes - prepare to be schooled - but in a good way - I walked up ahead on this game too).  The comps aren't all that exciting - $3 to join - but the "food court" experience is convenient, as you can just hop over to get a piece of pizza or some Panda Express without paying an arm and a leg and committing yourself to a buffet.  I liked that, as we were short on time and wanted to maximize our gaming experience.  Yes, it's far from downtown Vegas, but we were staying with family in Henderson for this part of the trip.  I would actually come back now that I know about it, but only if I were renting a car -- a cab fare would be too much from downtown Vegas.

This place has wifi for those of you who like get online and brag about how beautiful this place is.  I am not a gambler so therefore i am not going to talk about  it but what I am going to talk about is its design and architecture, simply beautiful.  It is family friendly with a pool area, food court and rodeo style shopping area with more restaurants again.  The buffet is awesome, staff that work in this place is great always willing to assist anyone.
Nice big casino. My wife had a massage at the spa, she was very happy with it. Plenty of food options, and plenty of good shopping at the district.

Nice place in Henderson near a friends house. Much nicer than most of Station's other places including Red Rock. Probably since it's partialy owned by the Greenspuns'. The movie theater is nice and the buffet is better than other Stations as well make this my favorite Station brand casino.

For an establishment that is marketed for local clients and community choice  - On April 30th, I went with my son to meet with a group of local teens/parents that chose GVR as a gathering point for their high school junior prom.  Unfortunately the weather was pouring rain (very rare in this area) so our group had to migrate into the hallways - away from players area, lobby areas, or any other guest area (we made sure not to be in the way of other hotel guests) - the kids wanted to get pictures together.  However, the casino staff quickly told us that NO photography was allowed inside the casino (even in the hallways!) and that we all had to leave - to wait outside in the rain for til the group bus came.  We, as parents that do shop, eat and play (spend money) at this casino could not understand the lack of staff to try to accommodate us at all for these kids (to perhaps open an empty room, conference room etc that was not in use, the hallway??  no slot machines, doorways in photos) the lack of support and understanding and quickness to move local community citizens outside to the rain in spite of our requests.  It will have to be a pretty desparate situation for me to find myself paying to visit this casino for any reason anytime soon..there are MANY MANY other options that provide better community appreciation with amazing customer service.

Beyond breathtaking with the beautiful architecture, design, overwhelming amount of friendly staff greeting you at every door. Can't wait until we can return and stay longer and take advantage of the many amenities!

Here for 4 nights 5 days for a soccer tournament.  Needless to say we were in and out with the car several times per day.   We had no other choice since there is no self parking.   We tipped the valet here and there but not every time.  They got downright rude and aggressive about it.   They continually spelled our last name wrong on the claim check tag which I spelled out for them (easy name 5 letters which they made 8)  It was irritating so another reason we didn't tip (5 times a day) just to get our car.  Shower in room has 2 temperatures scalding hot and hot.  Water flow from shower was slightly more than a dribble.  Pool was fantastic except many people laying out in 90 degree weather on couches with no towels and then you were "allowed" to lay in their body filth once chair was empty.  Kind of gross.  Only open until 4pm (lame) it was 80 degrees out today and a holiday weekend. No coffee makers in room but free coffee on lobby level (barely edible)  and Starbucks on 2nd floor.  On positive note hotel was pretty smoke free except for casino floor which was refreshing.  It was very beautiful.  Rooms were fine but nothing spectacular.  Servers by pool were great  (sorry forgot your name tattooed back) but bimbo lifeguard was awful and was there just to get a tan for her night job.  Of the Sunset properties we've visited, we still like Red Rocks the best.   2 stars due to poor service (mostly valet and housekeeping) and room quality   Day 3:  Valet has gotten so nasty that they now just hand us our keys and let us walk to the car.  Wish I had back the 25-30$ I've given them so far in tips.  They deserve nothing.  I've also realized instead of our last name they've started putting a code on our claim check indicating we don't tip.  Worst service I've ever experienced.    We were gone today from 5 am to 3pm for a soccer tournament.  Housekeeping never came.  They knocked on our door @ 330 and couldn't understand why I was a bit irritated.   I just gave her our trash and asked for a few clean towels.   Really? and yes my do not disturb light was NOT on.

Planning on going to the pool?  BEWARE!!  The pool manager, Rolondo has the worst customer service!!  I'm sure under stress and pressure to hit numbers.....I took the brunt of this one.  I was hustled and tricked into paying for a day bed.  From the moment I got there, I told them that I was unwilling to pay for a $200 daybed, but if they wanted to waive the charge or if the casino was willing to waive the charge, that I would gladly spend at least $200 worth of food and alcohol.  They said that they would call the casino and find out.  Every 30 minutes I received the same message...."still waiting to hear from the casino...would you like more drinks or food?"  3 1/2 hours later...time to settle up...."Oh the casino won't comp it and neither will we...so you will have to pay the $200!"   Long story short...Rolondo refused to listen to me or believe anything that I had to say, called security (security didn't even know why they were there because I wasn't causing a scene), then told me that I would have to take it up with the casino.  So, I went to settle up.....NO waitress came to help me.  So I went to the bar....they called Rolondo again.....he refused to even come talk with me and sent a waitress to deliver his message....."you are all settled up and everything has been charged to your room"   REALLY???   Who authorized that???  Because I certainly didn't!!!   Struggling to hit "Holiday numbers" on Easter Sunday...they only had maybe 2 out of the 9 daybeds rented and from what I could see....ZERO cabanas rented.....I was the victim of a hustle!  I find out later that Rolondo didn't even call the casino till it was time for me to settle up the bill"   WHY WAS I TOLD EVERY 30 MINUTES THAT THEY WERE STILL WAITING ON A CALL BACK FROM THE CASINO?   Rolondo tried to brush this one off on the casino and make them deal with it!  Refussing to even speak with the "customer" and sending a waitress to deliver his message.  WONDERFUL PROFESSIONALISM ROLONDO!!!     Bottom line after hours of problems and going back and forth between the pool and the casino.....the pool dropped the fee to $100 and the casino picked up the $100 charge.   Moral here.....BUYER BEWARE OF ROLONDO AND THE GVR POOL!!!       And props to Eric in the casino for helping to turn a horrible experience into a happier one.  Eric was outstanding, professional and a man of his word!   Eric is an asset to GVR......ROLONDO, MANAGER OF GVR POOL, WILL MOST LIKELY NOT BEING WORKING THERE LONG.   (WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND LACK OF PROFESSIONALISM THAT I HAVE HAD IN MY 12 YEARS LIVING IN LAS VEGAS.)

Overall pretty good experience. We came for a conference being held and the room was at a discounted rate but you miss out on some of the fun of Vegas by staying out here. The room was okay, but we had two rooms and one was nicer than the other even though we were paying the same and the same layout. The food selection was pretty standard, the only really great place was the steakhouse. The pool was beautiful and the grounds were gorgeous outside but the poolside drink service was really slow. Our room for three only had 2 towels. The staff was friendly and they had some great dealers. They do have a shuttle to the strip but the last one comes back at 8:30. Overall good, probably a better option for families. Or people looking for a reprieve from the craziness of the traditional Vegas experience.

This is a pretty hotel. The pool area is monitored by security that prevent you from bringing in food or drink. The service though is horrible so in 105 degree temps 100 or more people rely on a single jug of complimentary water that is often empty ... Waitresses are few and after renting a cabana I received no service and after requesting a soda one of these gals invented a story to explain why she failed to serve us even cold water .. she said I was yelling ... so I guess that's the reason there was no service ... friends told management no yelling so we were given Cabana for free and still very little service and next day same in other areas of pool. Restaurants have lines so I ate pizza from a food court the majority of time I was here. Casino looks aged ...not sure if I'd return.

Stayed here this past weekend 2/27 - 3/1 with my family while down for a football tournament and my family absolutely loved it!! Nice atmosphere, modern rooms, excellent customer service, plus I won a few coins on the crap table..NO Complaints whatsoever!! Looking forward to visiting again

So we were so excited to stay at this resort for its amazing reviews and were pretty disappointed, especially for what we paid. The room and amnesties were outstanding however we check in and my spouse, I and  kids enjoy the private spa. Afterward I'm ready to shower and the water in the master was freezing cold. My husband even tried to 20 minutes to get it to warm up while I stood there in my bikini freezing. Second issue our neighbors decide to blast their amazing surround sound which is loudest above our master bed from 1:45am to little after 3am. Even though I called to complain around 2 am a whole hour went by (mind you we had just driven from the Grand Canyon and this was our vacation. Also found it a little strange that the main pool closes at 6pm...my kids were rudely told to get out after a couple minutes and there were no signs about this so we could have been told in a nicer manner. Lastly my kids of course leave their floaties and get off the phone with lost and found and WE have to pay for the items robbed shipped. I've stayed and Cesar's hotels several times and forgot bathing suits etc and they always ship my items free of charge. Yeah we pay over 1K a night here for a villa and I have to pay for my items to be returned...seriously next time we will find another luxury resort that has better customer service and probably for a lot less too.

This is a great resort with endless possibilities but the front desk and management have  no training in customer service.  They are rude, abusive, not able to help and simply recite rules and regulation.

I came here with my friend because her mom had some MyVegas coupons. She got two cabanas and $175 total in food/drink credit.  When we got to GVR we ate some breakfast at the buffet, but mostly were in it for the endless mimosas because they were strong and free flowing (aka best combo).  We headed out to the cabanas around noon and they were nice! Ceiling fans, couches, mini fridge and auxiliary cord to bump Sublime with. We didn't stay in it for long though. We soon headed to the pool, which, for the cabanas, there's a little mini pool thing that's 3.5 ft deep and more like a long thin river than a pool, but it's ideal for sitting in, cooling off, having a smoke/drink in. And that was where we stayed for almost the entire day! The waitresses were super nice and really good to us. They were quick and kept our pitchers full. The Purple Haze pitcher was some crazy good cocktail that hit quickly while the Orange Rum Beach drink (forgot the name!) was super tasty and slightly less potent. I think we tried all the drinks, either in singles or pitchers. The sangria had really pretty garnishes; the mai tai was a werid blue green color that looked beautiful, until the colors mixed and it looked sewage-y. The sex on the beach was good, nothing too remarkable.  So yeah. The nachos were lame; just a couple of chips on a long platter with toppings; however, the chicken was really good as was the fruit platter and chips and dip. The watermelon and guac were super fresh!  As for the pool pool. My friend and I ventured down to the big pool in the afternoon and it was nice. The water was quite a bit warmer (kind of gross but still, always a relief from 104 degree weather) and the sand was weird. The grain texture felt unlike an ocean but it was cool nonetheless. I even found some in my bikini bottom when I went to the bathroom later! The regular pool was deeper also, 4 ft, but had lots of splashy kids and no one was really drinking so we went back to our cold, shallow, alcohol pool and stayed there till we left around 7.  Last thing- the lawn chairs here are amazing. They are so fucking comfy! My friend passed out in one and I almost fell asleep too. There were multiple people sleeping in these incredibly comfortable chairs, so lay in them, but be warned.  Definitely stop by the GVR pool if you're looking for a get away from the Strip and the heat! It's much quieter but still top tier, excellency! Awesome day-cation in summary.

One of my favorite places to go to that are away from the strip. It's not close to Downtown Las Vegas, but I really enjoy the Resort, my favorite being the buffet over there - quality for a good price. It's pretty popular and gets busy, especially during lunch time and later in the evening for seafood and prime rib dinner. I really like the neighborhood, with stores like William Sonoma and Trader Joe's close by.

So we used to live in Henderson right nearby this casino so it became our go to spot. But it was more than just the convenience of  proximity that sold us on it. It was the bartender at the sports book bar, Tyler, who kept us coming back. He is such an incredibly nice person. Yes he is warm and welcoming, but it is more than that. You can tell he is genuinely kind and caring and he is always so helpful and remembers us every time we come in. He talks sports with us, got us turned on to the Round Robin, and makes my Bloody Mary perfectly every time (he understands what "extra spicy" means and doesn't underestimate my ability to handle spice just because I am a white girl lol). Point is, casino management, if you do an employee of the month (or an employee of the year) program, this guy deserves it. Even though we live all the way across town now, we still make the 45 minute drive to come to GVR to place our bets and it is 100% because of him. He is the best bartender in town and, like I said, a really awesome person.   I will say too, I was sad today when we came in because he wasn't here, but we had the pleasure of being served by a guy named Tony who is also great! He was friendly and charming and prompt. Also, it didn't hurt that my Bloody Mary turned out nice and spicy :)   Thanks Tyler and Tony and GVR. Keep up the good work!!

We are in the aviation industry and travel frequently to Las Vegas.  We now finally found our place to stay for now on.  Top notch service with checking in, maid service, valet, but pool service needs more attention to the inexperienced staff (Biannca was pretty, nice, but way too inexperienced on service to detail).  Will stay here again.  Easy check in and check out.  Love how it's close to everything.

My girlfriends aunt lives in Henderson and this place is about 5min from her house.   When she told us, "im going to take you guys to this great breakfast buffet," I automatically lit up.. I love breakfast and I love buffets.    We go this pretty large casino/resort (small compared to the ones on the strip) and head into the buffet area.      $4.99 for breakfast... that's cheaper than Denny's or IHOP.    I could not believe the variety of foods they had to choose from.  Usually Im used to seeing maybe 5 or 6 different items like pancakes, eggs, omelets, waffles and hash browns.  not here.  Basically if you can think of a breakfast item, they had it.    I filled my plate up with sausage/scrambled eggs, a cheese blintz, chicken fried streak, sausage, English muffin and a few other items.  After just one plate of food (and I didn't pig out, so don't freak out), I was stuffed, but so pleasantly stuffed.  The food was delicious!!  I guess not all good food is on the strip (that was sarcasm).  I loved this place and I cant wait to go back next time.  Heck for $4.99? Who could beat that?

We stayed here last weekend for a cake camp.  The hotel is nice and clean.  It is not as crowded as the hotels in the strip.    The bad part is the rooms are a little bit dark. The fan in our bathroom is not working. I don't see any book in the room for the services that they offer in the hotel. The walls in the bedroom are thin, that you can hear people from the hallway. The front-desk are kinda rude. They don't give you a map of the area, it's kinda confusing to find your room. The buffet is almost/always the same. For a casino that accomodates kids, they don't have a drop in daycare. The pool can get really crowded that you won't be able to find a lounge chair to sunbathe.  They charge $150 minimum for those round sofas near the pool when you are already paying a $25 resort fee everyday. It took 30 minutes for those waitresses in the pool area to serve our drink.  We literally have to find our waitress so we can order a drink.  And they don't care because the gratuity is already added in every bill.  Overall the customer service in this hotel sucks!  Would I recommend this hotel to my fellow yelpers and friends?  Definitely, NO!   Would we go back there again? Nope, unless if they are going to use them again for cake camp.

This review is now based on the service I received today from the managers and front desk employees at Green Valley Ranch's Hotel. I have called 3 times today to finally receive my call back I was promised about the issue I had with unauthorized charges that were added to my account.   I was promised I would have copies of the documents I signed and never received a copy of at check in. Cyle, the manager promised I would have the documents yesterday emailed. Today he told me they would be sent, then in the same call told me that he needed to go to a different department to send the email since his email was down.   After waiting another hour I called for the third time today. He told me that he has sent the email. I have yet to receive an email. On the final call I was told that the charges would stand because security found ashes on the counter. I gave Cyle my fax number and still have not received any documents.   I can understand a charge for smoking in the room. I can honestly say that I requested a smoking room and had no idea I was in a non smoking room. I can not understand the games that are being played with getting me these documents.   I can not understand a $150 (deep cleaning) charge when I was already charged $100 for any incidentals. I really can't understand it because the front desk person who checked me in explained to me about the $100 deposit and had me sign.   I didn't get notified I was booked into a non smoking room. I wasn't notified about any charges that could happen beside the $100 deposit.  I may have signed for them but I didn't read the documents, they were read to me by the front desk person and she chose to leave some important details out.    If I would have never booked into this hotel I wouldn't have been put out an extra $250. Not to mention the money my friends and I spent in the Casino.   I've been coming here for over 10 years and I am sad to say I won't ever return to this property or any other station property. If I would have been called or emailed a receipt of these charges after they charged them I would have a different review.   Finding out that there has been $250 charged to your account without your knowledge is quite the shocker. Communication is lacking in their establishment.  I receive much better customer service at Motel 6. It tastes horrible saying that.

Unless I'm taking someone to Vegas who has never been, I refuse to stay on the strip. I just stayed at GVR for the first time last week and will probably be doing so again because it was pretty awesome. I'm still a huge fan of the M, but it seems like there's always an event happening at the M when I want to go which makes the rooms way too expensive. The room here was affordable, big, clean and nice enough (though just a bit stuffy decor wise).  The resort fee is pretty high (I think about $25night), but just keep it in mind when you look at the room rate - they clearly list it on their website when you're booking so it shouldn't be a surprise. It's handy that there is a mall type thing attached to give you more choices for dining that just what's inside the resort.  I could see the pool getting crazy busy on the weekends because it is a bit on the small side, but during the week it never filled up and is a really nice space. Use of the fitness center is also included in the resort fee, which was a big plus because really, with all the eating and drinking that happens in Vegas, a workout helps a lot.  The casino here wasn't super lucky for me, but that's fine, it just gave me more incentive to go relax by the pool and save myself the cash.

Just spent almost a full week at  GVR - Not a bad facility if you like to gamble.   Not much else going on in the winter.  You have to go through the lobby to get to the pool area if you are in the west wing of the hotel.   It seems that the west wing and east wing are isolated.  You can't get into the east wing with your west wing key card.  I had friends in the east wing and had to call them to be admited by them to the wing.  Be prepared to do a lot of walking., everything leads you through the casino area.  Hank's is an overpriced  steak joint.   The best place to eat was the Cafe.  Second place was the Tides Sushi bar.  DIdn't try the buffet... Nothing to do within walking distance.  The shuttle only runs every two hours to the LV strip and airport.   Customer service is so so.

I was recently invited to drink some whiskey with some friends and acquaintances. I know pretty much nothing about whiskey. One of my former UNLV computer science classmates was in town, staying at the Green Valley Ranch, so his suite became our venue.  I had never been inside any of the rooms before, but I was pretty impressed. Granted, this was a suite, but I'm sure each of the rooms is equally well-decorated. It's not the same style, but I'd say it was every bit as nice as the Bellagio suite I once had the pleasure of staying in. Getting to the rooms is a bit of a maze. OK maybe not that bad, but it reminded me of the Venetian. This is good because it separates the rooms from the casino portion of the property.  As for the GVR property as a whole, it's been overshadowed by newer places, but it's still a good local casino. It still has a nice beach area, a decent buffet, and the standard amenities like a movie theater and food court.

Very gorgeous hotel but restaurants are a little too expensive for a locals place. The shows are good there yellow brick road and steel panther. The pool is great but last Saturday they kicked us out at 4 to host a wedding and rushed us out and I had a tab running.

GVR overall is a pretty amazing casino! The movie theatre is very elegant and the arcade is fun! The restaurant selection is vast, however, the buffet is not the best. The staff is really friendly here and they're always greeting folks with a smile! I'd recommend this place as a whole, just don't eat at the buffet!

I can comment only on casino because that's all I visited....went to place sports book bets and bet $100 and immediately after I made last bet showed Station players club....clerk said she wouldn't take it...I said I just forgot it for a second....she said no because system won't accept....I said I wanted to cancel bets and try again....immediately...she said it couldn't be done.....LAME. I don't see how it can't be done....simple void the tickets immediately which I tried to do.   I went someplace else for a while....returned later in the evening to cash bets....and did not spend another dime there.  Probably should not have bothered with players club because with 5,000 points you only get $5 off Fatburger or whatever

This is a very nice locals casino. I love to visit the movie theater and they usually put on fireworks shows for special holidays. The facility is very clean. It doesn't have a local casino vibe to it at all, it feels a lot more upscale.

This casino is about 20 minutes off the strip in Henderson, NV. A lot of the young casino workers and locals work here and play here. Its a nice casino which feels more like a resort than a Strip casino. I like it because the club here is always good and the gambling here is more.. i dunno. homey. Ne ways, this is a good place to watch a show or something, too. Come here when you think you've done everything there is to do in Las Vegas. You won't be disapointed.

I have been back about 4 times since my last review. It seems like they stepped it up a notch. The food has been good and fresh. I always have 2 for one coupons and this is the place my daughter wants to go. Good job,

If you are a player and typically have a status with reward programs at the upper tiers this is not the place that you want to gamble. They have the absolute worse reward program. I have president status and have never been assigned a host. I have been comped for a meal exactly once in ten months. Anything you get in this place you earn and pay for with your points. Hosts are invisible I have tried to contact one at the awards center and none respond to calls from their own reward center, of course this probably the plan if you can't contact them they don't have to decline or use their canned phrase I can't do anything for you. Email contact with the director of the rewards program produced no results. The player development program and its manager are not responsive. I have spoken with several friends President and chairman tier status and they confirm that GVR is the worst. I am a diamond with Ceasars and I am constantly receiving offers for rooms, shows and special events. When I do stay at one of the properties I rarely pay for a meal or a show it's always comped. Stations likes to say we love locals and haven't seen the love. My advise spend your money elsewhere. You will find it will  be much appreciated somewhere else.

Just a few minutes away from the Vegas Strip is this relaxing getaway. We stayed for the night after an exciting weekend on the "strip". We enjoyed an overnight stay and spent the next morning roaming the exquisite grounds: spas, pools, vineyards waterfalls, sand beach pool, hair salon... Casino and restaurants. We will absolutely return for a weekend retreat. The casino did not even smell of smoke! The restaurants are top notch and the resort has all the amenities of a fine place to stay.. 4 Diamond Resort. Beyond Stars rating. Truly a place to remember.

Staid in 2 rooms and spent time in a third (1 Tuscan Suite, 1 executive suite, 1 standard double Queen).  The resort is sprawling. It's nicely landscaped and nicely appointed.   First we had difficulty just finding the entrance using our GPS. Don't park in any parking lots just keep driving around the miles long perimeter until you find the front hotel entry on Carnegie St.  The entry is beautiful (though don't look close at the details as everything is cheap fakes made to look nice -- but that suffices for me).   In my case we were bumped up (at a cost of $200 additional per night) to the Tuscan Suite from a double queen room. However, in order to do that they had to move those guests (our children) to a different tower. That didn't work for us so we downgraded our second room from an Executive Suite (which we briefly checked into and I can say is definitely not worth any more than a standard room) to a double Queen.  The double Queen room was nice and in the East Tower overlooking the pool. But we were charged for an Executive Suite. On check out I was told that although the invoice was "confusing, we were not charged for the suite". However, when I arrived home and checked with the credit card charges I could see that we were indeed charged for the Executive Suite. 3 phone calls over the past 3 weeks each had the same result. "A manager will call back, here is a confirmation number. No manager or anyone ever calls back. :(  The Tuscan Suite is dramatic to walk into and very nice. But really, with just 1 king bed I can't imagine the value of an 8 person dining room table and giant living room -- other than just gaudy fun, which we did appreciate!   The 'Feast Buffet' was somewhere between OK and not OK. The food was not kept fresh or neat at the self serve stations. The food itself was more like poor quality cafeteria food. Each of us found something we could eat but it was not a pleasant meal. The smoke from the casino was too much for my kids in the buffet. Since we had free dinner and breakfast vouchers, we did eat there for both those meals.  Getting to anything other than the pool area (the food, movies, arcade, outdoor mall) requires going through the smokey casino. If you smoke it's no problem. If you don't and don't enjoy the smokey stench this isn't a great casino.  The pool area is just OK. The sand area is nice, I think, for young children (mine are teens and steered clear of all the little kids there). Definitely do NOT rent a cabana there -- I was quoted $350 for the day (no partial day rentals). They are hotter than just laying out under an umbrella, have poor service, and are inconvenient to the main pool.  Main problem with the pool is that the pool closes at 7 pm!!!  At 6:45pm I saw a family with 3 kids in swim suits carrying pool toys arrive in the lobby only to be told that while it was 100 degrees and sunny outside the pool was closing -- not for some unavoidable technical reason but as standard hotel policy. :/ The kids were all whining and the father looked miserable. The pool security guard said that it was so the guests would spend money in the hotel and casino. If you plan on gambling while your spouse and/or children enjoy the pool forget it. You will be having to find other entertainment for everyone. The outdoor mall shops are closed so it's the strip, downtown or to bed.  Getting around in the hotel is a hassle because it is so sprawling. Getting to our room took 2 separate elevator rides in two buildings. It limits what can be accomplished in a day when getting to and from the room is so cumbersome.  On our way back home we did stop at the M to get breakfast. That casino seemed worlds nicer and had no cigarette smell. That would be my next go to place if staying off strip.  At the Green Valley Ranch, the rooms were comfortable, the service friendly, the beds very comfortable, the pool and restaurants fair to poor.  As for being charged for an Executive Suite while receiving a standard double Queen room, well 3 unreturned calls is enough for me. If they are not interested in charging the correct amount, I just won't return. It's a matter of about $300. Something I'll remember before booking at a Station Casino again.

Taking advantage of the recent Travelzoo Spa and Pool package, was both good and bad. The spa was wonderful, the staff fantastic. The pool is a completely different story. For years, we have been to the pool area for celebratory events like Mother's Day, Father's Day, and Birthdays taking advantage of the locals appreciation that Station Casino offered for using their pool (with a fee), bar and food service. NEVER had it been properly staffed, whether it was busy or empty. On Sunday, September 23, there was no staff at the towel kiosk. We grabbed our own towels and seated ourselves. There was no attendant around to kindly ask to move the only available umbrella to a spot that had more chairs to accomodate our group.  We waited for service. Finally a cocktail server arrived, and we asked her  for assistance moving the umbrella. (One of us could not be in direct sun.) She said we had to find one that was available (we already had) and then said no one was there to help us move it. "That we would have to do it ourselves."  I said, "you have to be kidding. I would injure myself trying to move it, and then struggle while trying to figure out how to open the umbrella shade!"  I asked her to please try and find someone. She handed us one menu (we were four people) and said she would try. Ten minutes later, a guy comes to move the umbrella, struggling himself to open it and get the latch hooked! What liability the hotel was under should I have gotten injured trying to move such a heavy thing and then attempt to open it! Obviously the staff isn't aware of that issue!   I can tell you that each visit to the pool area has shown less and less that the casino appreciates locals. Originally a fee was charged per person to use the pool area with the cost going towards bar and food service. Then they instituted a fee to use the pool area with no credit for using the bar and food service. Then they eliminated locals from using the pool area on a holiday weekend, (That must have come about following the terribly understaffed and extremely poor service on Mother's Day 2012, even running out of water bottles and giving our order to someone else.)   On another note, Hanks welcomed customers for half priced martinis from 5 - 7pm everyday. That has since been changed to 4 - 6pm, with no advertising the change. So when in August 2012 I arrived at 6pm, I got the half price but my girlfriend who arrived at 6:10pm did not. They refused to honor the half price saying that the change was on their website. How many locals go to their website, come on!! Where is the appreciation for regular locals?    Good thing they no longer promote, "We Love Locals."  They have really dropped the ball on that one.

Hotel is a scam! They get you at a low rate and keep tying to sell you an upgrade to get what you paid for. Ding you again with a $25 plus tax "resort" fee a day. Took 20 Minute's from hotel lobby to our outdated room overlooking busy parking lot. Front desk does not know what customer service is. Rude untrained staff. Do yourself a favor and book another hotel.
Was a great time there  Staff was great Can't wait to go back Food was good  Rooms were the best so far in Vegas  Could use a coffee pot in the room I'll be back

As a Las Vegas local I frequently have family and friends in from out of town. Station Casinos properties are where I direct my family and friends to stay as they typically provide a great Vegas experience without paying strip prices. In the case of this review my wife and I rented a room at GVR on Fri Jun 12th, 2015 for our niece who just graduated from high school with honors to stay in as a night away for herself. She also completed her Civil Air Patrol duties and is about to join the Air Force as an Officer so this was another way of saying thank you to her for all that she has accomplished. Little did we know that hotel staff and security was about to violate their own policies and ruin her experience through utter stupidity. Approximately an hour after arriving and getting settled in, hotel security knocked on the door and demanded that they vacate the room. Then since our name was on the reservation along with hers and she is of legal age to be there the hotel front desk called and asked us to come over to the property but no explanation was given as to why.   On our way there we called the hotel and asked to speak with the manager on duty. We kept being put on hold. When we got there my wife finally got to speak to the manager on duty, Ross, who honestly does not have a clue about Station Casinos Corporate Policies, and that in fact the reservation that was made was valid and fully complied with the hotel policy to the very last detail. When confronted with the fact that he violated corporate policy and subjected our niece and her friend to public embarrassment and humiliation, instead of an apology we got stammering and expressions of ignorance. My niece was allowed to return to the room, but the special night away that she earned was ruined by hotel staff that does not even know their own policies and procedures. Those same policies and procedures are even posted on the Station Casinos website so there is no excuse whatsoever for the staff to not know their policy when it should be available to them internally and it's always available externally on their public facing website.   I take my online reviews seriously, so when I post a 1 Star review and put them on my negative lists, you can bet it was earned and that I'm following up with corporate. What happened tonight with our reservation....and yes it's my name on the credit card that paid for it...is totally unacceptable and redress in the form of an apology is demanded. This nightmarish public spectacle of pathetic hotel management comes less than 3 weeks after I had another stay at GVR that was absolutely incredible. I know what the staff at GVR is capable of, and that's what makes this even more appalling. This is one of Station Casinos flagship properties. The on duty manager needs to run it like a flagship, and if he can't do it perhaps he can find a job running an extended stay property on Boulder Highway instead.   1 Star...and the review will stay up until this is made right.

Wonderful. Beautiful and that is just the outside of this resort. Wonderful staff from the moment you arrive. The Valet service is first class. The check in was a easy process. The rooms are beautiful. Wander outside and check out the palm trees and the pool and the pond. This place is an escape. The décor is super chic and hip. And go up to the 2nd floor and hit the casinos.  Enjoy being away from home.
Came here this morning for my VETERAN'S Day buffet.  After standing in one line, i was sent to another line, after waiting there i was told to go to a Kiosk, which wouldn't issue the coupon

This place is everything at the same time --- hip, cool, comfy and casual.  We used to watch the show that featured the Green Valley Ranch, I think it was called, "American Casino."  In fact, we recognized quite a few employees from the show. Anyhow, when my husband had to travel here for a conference the rest of the family tagged along.  The rooms were spacious and beautiful. The kids enjoyed the huge pool, the comfy soft beds and the chocolate chip pancakes at the Original Pancake House.   This was a very easy place to stay with kids.  The staff was very nice and accomodating. We felt spoiled! There were also lots of things to do with the kids--many within walking distance too!  The nearby shopping plaza had outdoor music,  there was a chocolate factory tour a short distance away and the most fun of all, the hotel beach/pool.  A great time was had by all!  Check 'em out at: http://www.greenvalleyranchresort.com/

We have stayed here a few times and had the same complaints and same likes each time. The lack of signage is awful...you can't tell where to turn in for valet, trying to find how to get to the correct elevator for your room is impossible, etc. The pluses include the friendly staff, nice rooms and EXCELLENT steakhouse , Hank's. Overall we enjoy staying here, we just know we're gonna be lost the majority of the time.

I just attended a conference there for the first time and this is a very nice off-strip resort-style hotel. The grounds are kept up very well and the interior of the lobby and rooms are nice. I didn't gamble here, but ate at Hanks Steakhouse, which was excellent, both in service and food.   My one complaint is their "bait and switch" tactic for room rates. When I called for room under my conference rate, they said rooms at that rate weren't available so I had to pay $40 more. OK fine. Then when I arrived on Sunday night, they asked if I still wanted a king bed room, which is what I signed up for in my reservation. When I said yes, they said there were none available, so I could have a room with two beds or they could "give" me an upgrade to a larger room with a king. Well, the upgrades they could "give" me were either $50 or $75 more on top of my already higher rate. The room was bigger, but it overlooked the roof of one of the parts of the hotel, and they are really subtle on how they ask if I still want that kind of room. The point is I eventually paid over $100 more than what I originally should have because of how they managed this at check-in. Maybe since they know this is a business trip, they figure you are not so conscious of rates going up that much. Plus, it was a Sunday night, so I doubt they could have been that full.   Another compliment though is during checkout, the line had about 12 guests in it and only two people working at the desk. It took a while to get another person to work the desk, but they gave bottles of water to everyone in line. Not a really big deal, but most hotels don't even do that.

This was my first time staying off strip, and needless to say, I was very impressed. Unfortunately the trip got off on a bad start here, but the manager was nice enough to accomodate and try to remedy the situation. We checked in around 5:30 and was told that our rooms were not ready yet. Hm.... interesting. Considering that check in was between 3pm and 6pm, and it was half an hour from 6... someone in logistics was probably going to lose his job. We weren't happy at all with their suggestion that it was going to be an hour+ wait at least for them to clean our room. Not too happy with that, but in the end, with the food/drink credit and tuxedo chocolate covered strawberries that were sent to our room, I was in a happy place.   The resort is fairly new, but has the decor of the old school "western-ish" style.   The best part of this place, was by far the pool area. I really really enjoyed the huge HUGE beds that were placed around the lounge and pool area for you to lay out on. Came with a ton of fluffy pillows too!!  Great place to play, bet minimums were low and the food was good and cheap. It was a great combination - the luxury of new Vegas, but with old school prices!

Never again....I have tried this place twice now.  First time was a NYE party and now just to hang out and gamble.  Each time sucked!  I got suckered into bottle service for 500 bones and now just dropped 100 bucks at keno.  What a complete waste of time.  Also, why didn't anyone tell me there was a freakin loer yuppie convention in town???

I grew up in Green Valley and used to frequent the movie theater but the first time I stayed here was right after college graduation in 2003 and now I won't stay anywhere else. The rooms are elegant and comfortable. I love the fact that they have plush bathrobes, slippers, a nice vanity, a full wet bar, a Bose alarm clock radio with custom loungey CD mix... everything I could want, really. The bathtub is nice & comfortable and I love hotels with toilets separate from showers but the best thing about the bathroom is the television speakers so you don't miss what's going on in the suite. Love, love, love it. Front desk, door service, and valet have always been fantastically polite and accommodating. Aside from the time the concierge almost sent me to the Fashion Show Mall for an Apple Store when there was one 10 minutes away.   One of the better ventilated casinos in Vegas and I never come home without visiting the District-- a great addition to the Ranch.

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...  Review #44: this is a nice well-kept property, but could really use a little burst of fun & modernization; this appears to be coming soon with the planned opening of Pizza Rock in March, and potential longer term opening of Mercadito & its sister bar Tipple; miles of slot machines here for the locals; meeting rooms on 2 floors; also has a 10-screen theater; I like how the hotel area & check-in is segregated on a lower floor, and is quite serene & classy, including the cool bar off of the lobby; the real shining star at Green Valley is the outdoor/pool area, which looks fab; you can also walk across the street to shopping & some eateries like Elephant Bar; the sports book is impressive & regal; probabaly a 3.5 stars property, but I'll kick them up to 4 in anticipation of Pizza Rock opening soon; best craft beer bet = it's pretty bad right now, but Pizza Rock should change that if it's anything like the downtown LV location.  BTW, did I mention that Pizza Rock is opening here soon??  It's kind of like the promised land...

So many times I have been to GVR..why is it I never reviewed it? Well last night we were there and found out that they love locals. Thats what the sign said and below that it said they had 99 cent margaritas at the sports book bar. So off we went to find these cheap drinks. We were very surprised at how tasty they were. Our bartender Doug was such a great guy. He hooked us up! They were lime flavored but you could get strawberry ones for 1.50. Such a great deal. Locals love GVR! At least this local does..

WOW.  If you have ever read a positive review on the Green Valley 'Ghetto' it is false.  My family spent 5 days there last week based upon reviews and it was a dump in all aspects.  Our hotel room had stained carpet (everywhere) along with stained curtains and a moldy bathroom. The Casino has a serious ventilation problem and all you can smell is smoke and a weird body odor stench.   My entire family came home with a serious skin rash that either came from the pool or the beds. Speaking of the pool area, its a dump and boring. They have a small sand areas for kids but that is it. No activities, no slides, nothing. The outdoor sound system is literally one speaker on the south end of the pool.  When it comes to food, the entire casino sells Denny's type low end food but at high prices. Its a total joke. The buffet is awful and overcrowded.  The best part is the theatre but that as well is run down.  If you are planning a trip to Vegas, avoid this dump!

Overall a nice place. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. The Italian restaurant is very good but only open for dinner.  The pool closes at 6PM which I can not comprehend. The pool is wonderful and would be great to be enjoyed after the brutal desert sun has set.

Green Valley is great escape from the madness of the strip. It's located about 15-20 min away but it has a good atmosphere. It has a beach pool hybrid so you can enjoys both....my daughters loved it. There is a strip mall just outside the hotel(literally across the street) so can enjoy a stroll to kill some time. There are also a few sit down food joints that is good around the hotel.

Traveling to Vegas for a work trip and was excited to stay in Henderson where our store is located. After doing some research I was excited to find this resort. I have not even stepped foot in the Resort and will not have the opportunity too because their website is not accurate nor is their online booking. I tried to book about 10 times because it said they had rooms available but after calling twice and taking to a reservation specialist, they have no rooms available. Update your site!! I only gave two stars because the ladies who I spoke with were very nice but of course they are off site and not affiliated directly with the Resort.

Checked In late on a Friday 5/10/13.  I was given a room on the first floor.  I kindly asked if there were any other rooms and without checking I was told no.  I was given room 6110 and the lady that checked me in looked like work was the last place she wanted to be at the time.  She had a bad attitude. I did not feel welcome at all. Boooooo.  Once we got to the room we realized that it was a smoking room but I had reserved a non smoking room.  It was already late so we just dealt with it.  The next morning I went to the lobby to ask for a different room because of the smell of smoke in our room.  The lady at the front desk immediately checked and switched our rooms.  Her customer service was outstanding I believe her name was Olivia.  I almost gave GVR 2 stars but the customer service on Saturday convinced me to up it to a 3.  Overall the hotel and casino were nice.  A bit smoky.  There were a lot of clearly intoxicated/rowdy patrons on Friday night but on Saturday evening it was a whole different crowd.  Much more relaxed.

Beautiful place! Really enjoyed staying here. Room was comfortable and had everything I needed during my stay. Wish the pool was bigger though. It was jam packed for memorial day weekend. Enjoyed eating at the Grand Cafe and Pizza Rock. They have a great bingo place inside. Would definitely recommend this place and would stay here again. A+
Absolutely the Best! Been here numerous times. With this last week being one of the best times yet. Thank you for a very memorable getaway.

CONFUSING!! this hotel really has no idea what's going on. I understand that the casinos are supposed to be confusing to keep people gambling but the general layout of the hotel is like a maze with no help from the unfriendly staff as to directions. Room service food is horrible. All the cocktail waitresses are old and beat up.  On top of everything they screwed up my bill, mis charged me and the guests who were beside me in line. Total chaos.   I'll never go back.

Complete customer care. Vinny Denovellis in security is a true asset to your company. Went over and beyond to help locate an item I left at dinner. He followed up, and made sure I got my item back. I'm beyond grateful. Thank you!!

Ok so am I bitter because this place is really not the closest to be. Ok so there's NEVER any parking that's close - everyone and their mothers go here. I've been here a few times where I'd have to drive circles for parking. Buffet is good. Movie theatre - decent. Everything else....eh....I can see it get old fast. I mean they did a whole reality show on this property called American Casino. I'm just not impressed with this place. The pool is nice! It smells clean....this place is just not my thing. Plus I've never really won playing there. Am I just bitter? Nahhhh Red Rock is way better. GVR comes at an easy 2nd!

Love having a few cocktails and playing video poker in the main bar. Easy parking on level 3 of garage.  Doors lead right from 3rd floor parking into the casino. *** WARNING *** The coffee drinks are extremely hot!

******CASINO REVIEW ONLY******  I've never stayed at the hotel so I'm writing this review strictly on the casino. It is by far my favorite casino in the Las Vegas area. Now, I should admit that I never play slots, and no, not because I think they're for "suckers" I just don't enjoy them. (Let's be honest, if you gamble at all... you're a bit of a sucker... these places aren't made of solid gold for no reason :-) Back to business; right when I walked in, I knew that it was going to be my kind of place. It's never ridiculously crowded. The drink servers greeted me right away and took my order. The table limits allow you to play at the level YOU decide you are comfortable with. Also, if you're a dice player, this is the only casino in Nevada that I've noticed has a Fire Bet. There is a great, reasonably priced food court if you want to grab a bite to eat and don't feel like taking out a 2nd on your house. It really is the ONLY place I feel comfortable gambling at in Nevada. 5 stars for the Jolly Green Giant.   Regards, CFC

We went to the GVR Buffett and Christine Franklin was our server and she was absolutely amazing and efficient. She made sure we were taken care of and made us feel comfortable. I'll always ask for her now!

I called the spa at the GVR yesterday to make an appt. for a massage for my lady for Mothers Day. , the receptionist was very nice , I booked a spot for 1 pm . My plan was to hang at the pool with her until her appt. and then be at the pool with lunch ready when she was finished. It occurred to me I better see what the policy was as far as admission for locals to the pool because if we couldn't get in the pool then I wasn't doing the spa treatment . I called GVR and I asked the woman on the phone about entry to the pool , she asked " are you a registered guest , I explained that I wasn't, I was a local and I told her about my plan for the day . She told me it was 20 dollars for admission to the pool Monday thru Friday . I reminded her that Mothers day was on Sunday and she instantly replied " oh , then you cant come to the pool" I tried to reason with her and better understand their policy but she was rude and just didn't have time for me. It left me no choice but to cancel my spa appt. It is disappointing that a " locals Casino" doesn't welcome " locals business. Between the Spa, Lunch, and cocktails and gambling afterwards , I know I would of been dropping at least 1000. bucks that day. I called the 'M" resort and they were more than happy to welcome us to the spa and the pool. Looks like GVR will not be getting any of my money in the future. So much for a " Locals spot " Shame on you GVR  ..
I love gambling here more than the strip! This place pays out more imo. And they have a pretty decent Buffet. :)

Green Valley Ranch is a great place to stay and is a very nice upscale resort away from the strip! It is very different staying there than any other Casino or resort on the strip. It is quiet and they have a beautiful pool! There is a real sand beach that leads into the swimming pool that kids just love. The pool is also very warm and nice. I have stayed at Green Valley Ranch several times and the other thing I love is the Spa. The use of the Spa is typically included with your room. They have a nice Sauna, and Steam Room, and Hot Tubs. But the other nice thing the Spa has is a Spa pool separate from the main pool. There is also a great Arcade and a Movie Theater as well, which makes staying at Green Valley great for families. I'm not a huge fan of their Buffet. But Pizza Rock makes the best Pizza in the world, i'm not kidding!!! I was also not overly impressed with Hanks. Hanks is a very high end Steakhouse. But for the price it wasn't that great compared to other places you can go to in Las Vegas. My Steak was pretty tough and chewy and overcooked. For a $250 meal you would expect better.  There are also a lot of nice restaurant options at the shopping district right next door. The rooms are nice, especially the bathroom with a nice Tub and separate shower. Overall it is a great, classy place to stay away from the busy strip. Sometimes we like to stay on the strip and have fun for three days, and then go stay a couple nights at Green Valley to relax!!

I really like the design of this place. tastefully decorated with earthy tones and scrolled metal work. I didnt try any of the food so i cant say anything on that point. There is a movie theatre downstairs...which is nice its separate from the casino upstairs. This location is also surrounded by what appears to be a nice selection of shopping and eating. Will have to check that out next time.
Buffet, YUM!! Take your steamed crabs cold shrimp raw oysters corn potatoes whatever suits your fancy to the grill and spice it up!!

Stayed here in March of 2011 with my parents.  Rooms and hotel are top notch, service was great, lobby was beautiful.  Pool and landscaping were very nice it reminded me of a southern plantation, not sure exactly how else to describe it, but I liked it a lot so two thumbs up to the designer.  I will most definitely return to this hotel when I'm in Vegas again.  It's amazing what a different vibe you get when you are off the strip.

The hotel ground is really pretty.  My son and I loved the pool and he loved the Kids Quest.  The casino is nice (although I wish it was non smoking).  We loved that there were so many food options like Starbucks and other quick service places to grab a bite.   The grounds are beautiful and our room was in the East Wing.  The only thing I noticed was that the floors did not seem to have been vacuumed when we checked into our room.  There was a candy wrapper on the floor.  Also, the pillow cover smelled like perfume.  Not sure if the maid wore perfume while we was making the bed and so the smell transferred or they did not change the pillow cover from the last occupants (which I'm going to not think about because that would FREAK me out).  I ended up throwing those on the floor and using one that didn't smell like perfume.  The pillows were also too fluffy/thick for my liking.  And it seemed all the pillows were that way.   The pool is really great for kids, the chaise have a comfy fleece type cover and plenty of fresh towels and even cold water by the pool.   The staff is really nice and check in/out easy.  The bell hops, valets were all fast and easy. There are some cons I would recommend to the hotel.  This morning, the Starbucks in the main hotel lobby only had one person working.  Line was so long and a few people just left because the wait was too long.  Considering it was prime morning/breakfast time, totally unreasonable to have 1 person being the cashier, barista.   The other thing I noticed was that someone's room service food left out of the hallway sat outside in the hall for HOURS (probably 6-8 hours) before it was taken away.  Staff should come by after people order food to check and take it away. Also, the other people staying at the hotel walk and talk loudly while walking past your room.  I heard them as the loudly walked by talking/screaming.  Either the soundproofing isn't great or there were just inconsiderate people when we were there.   Finally, wish the shuttle that takes us to the strip went further than just Mandalay.  There should be 1 more stop further up the strip for those going to Bellagio or further up.  We took the shuttle then had to walk so much to get to Bellagio and then the cab back (because we didn't want to wait for the next  shuttle that runs only in 2 hour increments) was pricey.  $40 at like 9:30pm on a weekday. The rooms in the East Tower can use some updating but the hotel itself is really nice.

This place is great, the food at the buffet was diverse and amazing. The seafood buffet was exceptional as was the service everywhere.  The rooms are very well kept and the staff is eager to help with events,  directions or suggestions.   Entering and exiting the resort is simple and efficient, we took Uber everywhere and never waited more than 4-6 minutes.   I went to play craps the last night and hadnt played in a long while. The staff was eager to help with how to bet and in explaining the game. Started with $100, left with $635.  My biggest shout out is to the main lobby bartender Kelly, she was super friendly rembered our names and drinks and displayed amazing professionalism.   All in all way better than the strip and very cost effective. We will definately be back.

I came here for the first time with my girlfriend.  She was talking me out for my belated birthday.  We parked at the spa parking lot.  I didn't get to see inside the resort, only the spa and pool area.  I'm impressed it was so clean and pretty.  I loved the spa pool area, it's super quiet.    The reason for the minus two stars is because we were told when we checked into the ladies room that they will come grab us for the facials.  We said ok, we'll be at the pool.  There was no waitress to order drinks for the hour we were there....well the waitress came about 30 minutes in and asked if we're good.  We asked her for a menu, it took her 15 minutes to give us a menu, then she never returned.  That was when we realized our facial is about to start and no one came to grab us.  They didn't tell us we have to be in a certain area.  They said they'll have the esthetician grab us.  There wasn't anyone else there with us at the pool until 35-40 minutes into us laying out there.  The communication was off.  I'll have to try it again another time.  Hoping to update this to a 5 stars! =)

Very nice place to stay. Buffet line was very long, about 30 min wait in the VIP line and was just OK. The rooms are large. very nice decor. The people were very nice. The kids loved the pool with the sandy beach walk-in. my only neg was that the sink had a huge crack in it and the drain was very slow. Oh and I was a little sticker shocked by the $7, 12 oz. lemonade at the pool. No wonder there are no prices on the drink menu.

This place is an oasis just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. But this place provides plenty of hustle and bustle of its own.  The hotel: My friend and I were lucky enough to get a comped suite overlooking the pool. This room was absolutely incredible. The beds were superb. Luxurious bathrooms. Great room service.   The casino: Ohmygod we had so much fun with everyone we met at the 3-card poker table. My friend's the gambler, I just sat by her side talking to everyone at the table and drinking. We were at this table for hours. In fact, we were so wired - we didn't go to bed until after 5am. Good times. And good people.  The rest: Exccellent dining. Beyond the food court offerings, of course.  Sushi + Sake: excellent!  Il Fornaio: gnocchi and salads were delish! Whiskey Bar: we were there early but the layout was pretty cool. Fun bartenders.  I'll never forget the 24 hours we spent here.

As a couple with two small children, its often difficult for my husband and I to find a place that makes everyone happy. Green Valley Ranch, however, is the perfect location as it provides adult entertainment and activities/entertainment for children as well. The hotel location is perfect in that it is close enough to the Strip to allow you to party at your will, while far enough away for you to truly be able to relax and enjoy without the hustle and bustle.   The really cool part is that the resort itself is sufficient for a fantastic vacation even without the Strip. The pool has a sandbeach for kids of all ages. The service is exemplary. The foods and drinks are " To Die For."  Long story short...If you are looking for a 5 star vacation for you and your family, this is the place to be!!!

This place is a total crock! BEYOND disappointed!!Their slogan is "we love locals"... they love locals so much they tried to charge me and my boyfriend $25 per person to go to the pool (acting like they were doing us a favor to let the 2 kids in for free) when last season it was free. Needless to say we took our business to South Point, which is a TRUE locals casino!

This is a fairly upscale locals casino / high value tourist casino with quality restaurants. Have not tried the buffet here. The staff are generally friendly, and the decor is above average.  Decor 3/5 Staff 3.5/5 Value 2.5/5

MY NEW HAPPY PLACE! In Vegas at least. i can't believe it's only now that I discover this hidden gem. Went on a staycation over the weekend and had a great time!  My favorite spots are the pool and the day beds. I love that the pool has sand, you feel like you're on the beach. Something we lack here in Vegas. I also love the area under the bridge where the seats are submerged in water. Perfect way to cool down in this summers heat. Our suite was also SWEEET! It was one of the nicer suites I have seen in the Valley. It was spacious, and super clean I felt so at home. It had a mini bar, a dining table huge enough to hold a meeting, a huge couch, huge bathroom and a nice tub.   The only thing I could think of that I didn't like was that the casino smells like cigarette but it's fine cause I didn't really go to that area that much.   Overall I would still give this place a 5 stars. It now is one of my favorite spots in town, and it has all the ingredients to a perfect STAYCATION. If you're a local, do yourself a favor and go experience GVR. :)

Just finished our company meetings here and since I live in the area and stayed here before, figured it was time to write about it.....  1.  Hotel - Modern, clean, luxurious and far enough away from the casino that you are safely ensconced in a smoke free area.  Rates are a bit high, however, the luxury is worth it.  2  Meeting Rooms - All adjustable and very accommodating. Easy access from either the casino side or the hotel side.  Staff is great, food is great, they are real professionals.  3.  Entertainment - Besides the gambling, they have a small theater with smaller size screens.  Kids Area for video gaming.  Plenty of things to do for a family.  4  Food - Great food choices in the food court. Fatburger, Caproitti, U Swirl, Panda Express are all favorites. You have fine dining for sushi, chinese, steak, irish pub (liquid diet), and more. This place has a great selection.  5.  Ambiance - Upscale and classy.  Easy access and parking.

Came poolside yesterday and the crowd was here but we were able to get a couch at NO COST... return today and they're renting everything couches daybeds and cabanas totally understand the cabanas and daybeds but couches really

Had a facial at the spa, and while it felt amazing at the time I woke up in the middle of the night with little blisters all over my face and now 3 days later have chapped, uncomfortable and irritated skin. The woman was very nice and asked me about allergies -- I have to admit I knew of none (that seemed to be part of the treatment provided). She noticed my skin was sensitive and recommended some skin care options that seem like good ones. I think in the end it must be very difficult to provide this service to people you have never seen and will never see again -- I enjoyed the experience, but wish I was not suffering so after.  PS the hotel is nice, but I'm not a casino person and did not like that I had to be apart of the casino experience to enjoy any of the restaurants. I was there for a conference -- not to gamble. I would have loved it if the bar and restaurant by the pool area had been open as it would have offered opportunity to not deal with the casino atmosphere (and smoke). We were however there 'off season' so outdoor venues were closed.

Speaking from a mom's point of view traveling with small children, I think this resort is very kid friendly. The pool is awesome with a small sandy beach area which is great for little kids. The location being right next to The District allows you more dining options should you not want to stay on the property. The rooms were nice and modern. Concierge has crayons, coloring books, cards and games for the kids...just ask.  The cons: The refrigerator is stocked with mini bar items which are sensored so if you move items, you will get charged. I should have asked to have the items removed so that it could be used to store milk for the kids.
