Stayed here for a 2 day local stay-cations and we have to say ut was pretty amazing. At the moment they are redoing the front lobby so if visting soon besure to park on in the parking garage on Village View Drive. The lobby is now to the left of the pool entrance or the right of the Cafe.  We had a very nice stay the room was very clean but the casino is pretty smokey which is to be expected. We didnt gamble much so I wont review that. This resort has a wide verity of food options. And the pool is amazing!! & very kid friendly!! The pool is full service and there is always a waitress quickly available to take your order.  We will definitely be back!!
We found this place 10 years ago when it was on TV  The rooms are nice the casino is great and it's very very good for conventions!    Stay here!!

resort was pretty, room was fine, food that we had at the pool was great - but other than that i was underwhelmed. particularly the main pool. service was terrible. ended up going to the bar for our drinks before finally just going to the adult only pool to get away from the chaos and lack of attention from the waitstaff. i get it, they have to hire cute girls that are willing to wear a bikini to work everyday and look amazing. but a tip - try finding some servers that do more than work on thier dance moves at the bar instead of even trying to do thier jobs.

I had such an incredible, relaxing weekend at the Green Valley Ranch.  The large, sprawling complex was beautiful. The room was spacious, with a great view of the Strip and of the gardens.  The complex contained several fantastic restaurants (loved the huevos rancheros at the Grand Cafe and the Swedish Pancakes at the Original Pancake House) and the staff was so nice and accommodating.  And the pool area...wow!  Big lounge "beds" are scattered all over the grounds and a sandy beach right there at the edge of the main pool.  Plus they have this secluded, walled-in area called The Pond.   It was such an oasis. A shallow wading pool with a waterfall, several lounge beds that were actually in the pool, a ring of beds around the pool...and misters everywhere.  The misters cool everything down and make it absolutely impossible to want to leave your poolside bed.  I could have lounged for hours!    On the downside, the Green Valley Ranch is a pretty good distance away from the Vegas Strip.  I overheard mutterings of $30 cab rides.  Luckily we were there to visit family friends who happily shuttled us around.

Extremely disappointing.   Came here with a group of 35. Had a reservation so got to skip the HUGE line of people waiting. Dinner buffet opened at 4 PM but they really started serving around 4:10. I was pretty excited because our group had just gotten back from a hike at Red Rock Canyon so we were starving.   Here's what I expected: Fresh, piping-hot, steaming, delicious entrees considering we got there BEFORE dinner even started.   Here's what we got:   -Luke-warm entrees that seemed like they had just been microwaved -Sushi/seafood that looked like it had been laying out for 3 days -Floppy, soggy salads etc.  The most satisfactory dishes for me were the pulled pork and the soft serve frozen yogurt. I don't know how much it cost but I'd really suggest going somewhere else. I won't be here again.

GVR is GORGEOUS - clearly the king of the Station Casinos. I love coming here just to get design ideas.   Their rooms are WAY nicer than many on the Strip - and includes places like the Bellagio and the Venetian. They can be had for as low as $54 depending on the time of year  - it's a steal. (My aunt got that rate with a military discount.)   I used to come here ALL the time with my friend Jerry J. after work to sit on the pool beds and eat sandwiches by the pool. The pool is awesome because it has sand in it. Snazzy.   The buffet isn't my favorite, but it's better than Sunset Station's buffet. I'm pretty sure the first dollar I ever gambled (only to put some points on my card for the buffet) was at this casino where I walked a way with a couple bucks in winnings.   The cool thing is this place has $5 movies at their theater!  I loooove this place.
Great Hotel, we stayed there last year and had an amazing time. Friendly staff, nice and clean rooms, super pool area. Its about 20 min off the strip but worse it.

It was a fine Wednesday afternoon where I decided to take a half day from work to take my best friends daughter to the pool at green valley. Which is one of my favorite locals casino. I usually have no problem going to the pool but today on July 26, 2017 we ran into a hiccup. A hiccup by the name of Jesus, and let me tell you he was no holy man. He asked if we were locals as I grabbed a towel I said of course. Then he said it would cost $25 a person for entrance. I have a friend that works at the spa there and I gave him a call and he said they normally don't charge to get in and he didn't see why there was a problem. Now $25 can get me into a day club on the strip. This is not the reason I came here. I came here to relax and enjoy my half day off. My friend works at the spa who will remain unnamed told me that it's normally free to get in for locals. This guy was trying to hustle for cash in a shady way that Vegas is notorious for . People like him really reflect the establishment they work for.

Am in LOVE!!!! First time staying here for a Mother's Day escape & so far it's been heavenly! I will say that my pool view room did have a loud party last night til late that was annoying. But the room service is amazing & the pool & cabanas are amazing!!!! Perfect & better than I expected!!! I'm on the top west tower floor so no smoke here too. My 800 sq foot room is so relaxing & beautiful too.

Had to take a star due to the Cons.  PROS:  The rooms are big and somewhat comfortable.  I felt that the pillows were too soft.  The casino was a good size.  I would compare this hotel/resort to the Venetian.  Casino was not overly packed and seemed to draw a lot of locals.  I think this was probably the only place that my family and I actually won.  The food court was nice.  In the morning, there was no waiting in lines at the Coffee Bean and after midnight, Fatburger, served up fresh burgers again without a crowd.  The pool was really nice and seemed really clean.  They have a 21 and over pool that is somewhat private, has its own bar and about 20 lounge pool chairs, about 10 cabana's and probably 4 to 6 pool beds.  The main pool has a sand entry beach and nice view of the strip.    CONS:  The DOWNSIDE of this hotel/resort is the carpets although looking clean are really dirty!!  Stay as far away from China Spice Restaurant as possible!!! The first night we tried this place because we were offered "$25" off when you spend $50 but only applies to food not drinks with alcohol.  The wait was 20 minutes with about 5 tables open and only 1 whole server working.  If you want to eat within an hour I highly recommend staying as far away from this restaurant as possible.  After being seated it took 20 minutes to place an order not because they were busy but because the waitress had the flap her gums syndrome (aka talked and socialized way too much).  Then it took another 15 minutes to get our drinks that literately sat on the side bar for 10 minutes and were served at room temperature.  After placing our order it took another 20 minutes to get COLD food!! Not even warm, like it was placed straight on a plate from the refrigerator!! When my mother told the waitress that the food was cold, the waitress turned to me and asked if she was telling the truth.  Shame way to start our trip and shame that this restaurant is even open to serve the public with all the unprofessional and rude service it provides.  I guess the up side was the our drinks got comp.
I had a wonderful experience during a conference! Every event had Jenn helping to keep things happy and running smoothly. Love her!!!!

I have never felt as conflicted in writing a review as I do for this one.  I want to rate high because the resort is gorgeous and well-kept and we truly enjoyed our stay there. But there were some issues that I can't let go and need to be factored in. Those are not things you want to have to deal with when you're on a mini break (or coming home from mini-break).  Some things I did not appreciate: *Sarcastic tones when calling in reservations...."You know you COULD have reserved your rooms online" (I'm sorry I'm making you do your job) *I told them I knew I can reserve online, but I have to reserve a crib with my room..."You still could have reserved online and then called concierge for the crib" (WTH? are you not happy that you have a job?) *The attitude they gave me when they messed up the room reservations. They ended up upgrading my mom's room but the attitude we had to deal with was uncalled for. The only thing that was needed was an apology.  Anyone in our party would have been happy with a standard room.  But please, I work with the public and I know an apology goes a long way. Nix the attitude sweetheart. *Coming home and finding an extra $500 charge from the hotel on our charge card.  The accounting office had no idea what that charge was but they immediately refunded the amount and apologized profusely.  At least there is some professionalism in the front desk somewhere.    The things I loved about this resort: Comfy rooms and beautiful public spaces.  Dark wood, marble, leather--well decorated, warm and inviting.   A great place to stay if you want to stay off the Strip.  Only a quick drive if you want to get to the Strip and they offer shuttles as well.  Housekeeping, Valet, Concierge, Pool Staff--so friendly, professional and helpful. The pool area is gorgeous and also clean and well-kept.  It's a "sand" walk in, but it's pebbly sand, not soft Caribbean sand.  Separate pool/lounge area for 21+over crowd. Lots of options for dining--buffet, cafe's, restaurants, food court. Something for everyone.

I went here for a birthday present from my husband. I have never been to a day spa like this and it was very nice. After they checked me in you walk downstairs and get a pair of sandals and then they show you to your locker. There are spas in the female and male locker rooms as well as in the main co-ed area. I had three services and was helped by Michelle, Randy and Kristen. I had the Nirvana Stress Relief Massage (80 minutes), Papaya Pineapple (50 minutes) and Green Valley Ranch Signature Massage (80 minutes). I enjoyed everything and everyone was very nice. The papaya scrub was different and once you were scrubbed you rinsed off and then had a light massage. My skin feels great. While you are waiting you can have drink: water, juice or tea or a snack: granola, apples or pretzel's. They said you could also order food but I didn't do that. You are also able to use the amenities the remainder of the day. Only two things stuck out, for each appointment they didn't come and get me for a few minutes after my appointment time and I wish the robe would have been a little larger. Note- the spa has its own parking lot so you don't have to park in the main parking structure.

This place was absolutely beautiful. I loved the rooms and pool area was amazing, very clean, and super fancy. But I'm really big on service. And their service was horrible which is why I'm giving them 1 star. Such a beautiful place with such horrible service. The valet guy's never greeted us, gave us attitude and looked bothered to help. The cleaning staff complained about cleaning our room. The lady at the casino looked bothered we asked questions, about their rewards program, and gave us attitude; talked to us as if we were asking a stupid question. The bartender at the pool didn't bother asking if we needed help, when we arrived. Overall, I felt discriminated. I'm Mexican and this resort was mostly Caucasian families. I felt like they didn't respect me at all. So, if your Caucasian, and looking for a family oriented place, this is for you. Although, it was a beautiful place, I wouldn't come back.

Love this place, have eaten at a few of the restaurants, The buffet is better than most I like the sportsbook and casino it doesn't have the smoke smell that some do!! I can't wait to stay there... if your looking for a good buffet with better prices FEAST at Green Valley is the place to go!!

For the committed gambler this sure looked like it had plenty of options.  Sizable casino floor with plenty of options.  Air circulation was good unless a guy from Dallas with a cigar sits next to you.  Was pretty busy and had more of a downtown Strip feel to it Saturday night.
Great staff, awesome room, great pool & spa.... great coffee / snack bar and cute clean casino. I will definitely be back!

So yeah. This place only gets five stars because there isn't a place for 6 stars. No it is not on the strip, and that is a bonus. You sit out on the pool and enjoy the serene view in serenity. I thought Shangri-la was suppose to be fictional, but they achieved it here.   I don't usually associate romance with Vegas, but this place was a dream personified. The bed was amazingly comfortable and big. The balcony looked out over a sleepy residential neighborhood filled with palm trees. The tub was massive, and there was a glass shower with a steam option.   Black Jack and poker tables downstairs, there was even a poker tournament. Lots of tasty food options right on the premises. Vegas baby!

This is a cool casino , especially for locals.  I usually go to the movie theater here. They have a really cute food court, Coffee Bean, frozen yogurt, pizza, etc.  The casino opens up to The District, I think that attracts more people.  Its very local friendly but still keeps a good semi upscale look.  I know for sure they have a beautiful pool. I love the little cabana beads they have outside, they are really unique looking. I have laid on they outside when I was a guest at one of the night clubs.

We come to GVR because we live nearby.   I've actually always lived in this area and have been frequenting this property for almost 10 years.  I've seen a lot of change over the years but Station casinos are going through an upswing and you can certainly tell it here.   There are quite a few good restaurants to choose from (I personally love Pizza Rock and Bottiglia) most of them being pretty good.   The slot machines and promotions held by the casino (all of stations actually) are pretty good and even if you're like me and haven't really played in a while you still get access to many promotions.  The casino itself and pretty and clean and doesn't smell overly terrible like some other places.   Definitely a good place for a date night or even to hang out with friends!

Went here to spend some time at the pool. The pool was pretty busy this day. Waitress service was definitely lacking and few and far between. Most of my group just went up to the bar for orders. Drinks lacked alcohol, I had two vodka lemonades and didn't even have a slight buzz.   We had excellent service in the center bar later that night. Bartender was fast and friendly with our group of 9. Fireball shots were plenty healthy, usually requiring a couple swallows.   The rooms were pretty decent and comfortable. No issues here its a good place to stay. Just not much wow factor anywhere, and the layout for check in is still a bit goofy.

This is amazing....35 people booked 9 month ahead....1/2 of them are teenage girls doing a soccer tournament.  The hotel oversold the rooms and is moving us to MGM 48 hours before our arrival.  All our planning with restaurants around hotel, transportations to fields near by is now thrown in the air.    I do 200K miles per year & have never experience something this bad in terms of customer satisfaction.  Many parents have concerns about having their teenage daughters on the strip & we are now far away from soccer field.  Again we planned & booked the rooms 9 month ahead....UNBELIEVABLE

My boyfriend and I stayed here a few weeks ago and I was completely impressed!  My boyfriend talked me into staying off the strip...I was worried..  No worries anymore!  I cannot wait to return!  Pool is gorgeous and we felt like we had the place to ourselves in the middle of March!  Fun and beautiful and great escape off the strip...Vegas' hidden treasure.  My only recommendation - I wish the free shuttle to the strip had later evening drop off and pick up times.

My favorite casino and place to eat! I've had the buffet several times and it's always amazing probably the best I've been too. Out of all the other casino buffets I've been too, I definitely recommend coming here. The other restaurants they have in the casino are also really good if you don't feel like having the buffet! Love playing slots here also, always win something! I haven't gotten to the spa yet but I can't wait until I do I've heard nothing but good things about it so far so that's something I'm looking forward too. Hands down the best place to go!

This was one of my favorite places at the resort. Very clean and they provide complimentary water and towels for the gym. All the equipment works great, and they have enough of everything to make sure you get a great workout. The treadmills each have their own TV and they provide you complimentary headphones (new in a bag). The view from the gym is of the pool, so you can have motivation to work out harder. There was only one other person in there everytime I went in. Perfect.

This place is for "locals" and it's ridiculous.  The machines really never win if you talk to people who live here and they charge too much for drinks.  If you want to have FUN then go to South Point Casino on Friday nights where drinks are $2 for well drinks and the people there are nice unlike the staff at GVR.  It is just a pretty casino out to get money from you to be prettier period.  OH and NEVER use their pay phone there (I had to because I didn't have my phone with me and the desk wouldn't let me use theirs, lovely).  Anyway, used the pay phone and received a bill for $70.00 for 2 minutes because they go through some group that's a scam, fyi.

From the moment I entered the Casino floor I was greeted by a staff member with a big smile. That goes a long way with me. I then was helped with a question I had regarding the Sportsbook and the representative that helped me was very patient with me because I'm not very familiar with how sports betting works. After doing my thing at the Sportsbook I went to a restaurant in the casino called Pizza Rock. The food was tremendously tasty and the staff were very friendly and outgoing. My experience at Green Valley Ranch has been nothing short of spectacular. I will come back again for sure!!

This is a great place to stay.  Unfortunately, after you make your reservation, you are on your own.  The customer service if you need to make a change to your reservation is probably the worst in the industry.  Currently, I have been on hold for 13 minutes, after my 4th attempt to get, and pay for, an early check in for my elderly parents.  No one seems to be able to make a decision, and you will be transferred multiple times to no avail.  There just too much competition in this area for gaming and resorts to hassle with this hotel.  It is absolutely the WORST!

I've stayed there many times. I love this place, not only is the atmosphere amazing but the employees are great, so friendly and willing to do whatever they can to make your stay even better. The room service and restaurants serve terrific meals, even in a timely manner. The valet attendants are incredible. They also offer a car washing service while having your vehicle with them. The pool is so relaxing after a long day of events. The pool attendants are so helpful, allowing you to sit out in the sun for hours with no problems. The rooms are fully equipped with the finest things, the most comfortable beds, amazing walk-in showers, and flat screen TVs to name a few. The suites include TVs in the main bathroom. Green Valley Ranch is perfect for all types of vacations, whether it is to just get away for a night or coming from out of town there is always something to do and comfort to be found.

This place used to be ok, not too smoky, lively and had good food.  I stopped by Saturday evening because my husband and I wanted to try our hands at Megabucks, but didn't want to deal with the crowds on the strip.  It was pretty dead and it was smokier than imagined.  The smoke level seemed to be almost on par with casinos back in the 80's and early 90's, it was pretty bad.  The non-smoking section offers a 1-2 second respite from the smoke and then you're back to wheezing and bloodshot eyes.  I don't know what happened to this place.  I'm thinking it all went downhill when the Pancake House left, but I don't come in here on a regular basis.  Maybe GVR just got hit really hard when the economy started tanking.  We didn't play any of the tables, but the slots and other gaming machines were not giving anything up.  Maybe a quarter or dollar here and there, but I didn't see or hear anyone winning while we were there.

It is possible to have a chill relaxing weekend in Vegas.   GVR was solid for off the strip lounging and free of the "I just turned 21 so I'm about to get blasted out of my mind strip crowd!"   First time at GVR was like 10 years ago at their Lobby Bar with all the locals when I was freshly 21. I've matured and so has GVR. What's new is the "upscale" and family friendly shopping mall around it; Whole Foods, REI, Cheesecake factory, etc.   The room are classic and clean. Nice bathrooms. The toilets flush.   However, easily the best thing about GVR is definitely their sand bottomed pool and lounge area. The pool is family friendly with lifeguards on duty. It's open from 8 to 8 and looks Vegas-y without all the t&a. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/6kkxRV8H9SQLybj0xnEbMw?select=GUfzVjhVais7NgxIMc6EHw)  There isn't a fridge in the room, but I recommend their room service burger. Very good and high quality. Yes, there's a Fatburger downstairs which is almost the same price but it's crap. Save yourself the $24 and don't go for the lobster blt, the bacon overpowered the drenched in mayo lobster.  About a $140 night including all taxes/fees.

What Red Rock is to the Summerlin crowd, GVR is to the Henderson folk. Recent updates such as Pizza Rock and Sip have upgraded GVRs cool factor. Mercadito was going to open here too but after talking to employees at the Red Rock location, that isn't to be. Sob! This is my 'hood resort which is convenient but I like Red Rock better. Maybe cause I'm not quite within the GVR demographic of happily retired. That being said, there is plenty to do here from gaming to eating to movies. Hank's is a fine establishment and Drop Bar & Sip offer gaming while enjoying a swanky beverage or 2. I recently spent time at the pool and it was pretty enjoyable though a tad on the small side. It's unique because of the "beach" portion of the pool. The Pond is the adults only small pool and we didn't hang there this time. GVR is looking good for being almost 20, and it's good that they are adding/remodeling its offerings.

Love, love, love this place.  Everyone who worked here worked very hard to make our stay enjoyable.  The valets were always able to give us directions.  We rented a cabana by the pool and the service was awesome.  Whatever we needed they were there.  The rooms were big, clean, and a great place to relax.  This might just be my new hotel for Vegas.

Absolutely lovely resort!  Sadly, the worst customer service I've experienced in a looonnnnng time.  Slow, systems issues galore (with NO sense of urgency what so fricken ever).  At EVERY point of contact the service sucked.  There was also a lack of employees, in general.  Example:  Took over an hour to get my lunch - a bowl of soup.  Should have known as it took 15 mins to get seated and there was lots of empty tables... Overall, a shame.  Such a lovely place.

The first time I visited Green Valley Ranch, I was like, this place is nice. The casino is not very big, but there were a ton of slots for us to play. We only like playing slots and drinking while we're in Vegas. That and lay out by the pool, and swim  and drink some more. Anyway, their Feast Buffet is nice. They've got Mongolian BBQ, a tasty salad bar with fancy greens, crab legs, etc etc. The usual LV buffet fare but with more quality. They've got a small food court for those not interested in standing in a super long line or eating until your pants bust open. Also, shops are close by. Hello Anthropologie!

I would have rated this resort 5 stars had there been better ventilation in the casino. The cigarette smoke was overwhelming and very poorly ventilated. I would expect similar air-quality at a 2 or 3 star hotel but I feel it is unacceptable at a 4 1/2 star resort! The management staff were only able to offer me an apology. If you intend to use the casino for entertainment or dining, I would not recommend this resort.

Management still has not called me back to discuss this issue. Paid over $300.00 to be our in this dump of a room. It's suppose to be Deluxe king.. deluxe flop room maybe. Ick  How can they say that's too bad it's all we had? Ha nope found out they were in fact not booked up. We could have upgraded for a fee! That wasn't even brought up. They should have upgraded us period!! Also if you use their own booking it's considered third party and no refunds by the booking site. Can you say rip off?!
Nice hotel. Far from strip but nice get away. Valet staff (Dennis) at front entrance was very rude. We found scratches on my brand new car and they were the opposite of friendly about anything.

Superb customer service from every department! From the valet and bellmen upon arrival, to the front desk upon check-in we felt a sincere welcome. We had to switch room only due to the error of a double beds instead of a king and all we had to do was sit tight. Someone came up immediately, switched us and even offered to fill our ice bucket.  We were there for a wedding so previously were not familiar with the resort. However, I'd love to return to experience all of amenities. It's great patronizing businesses where guests feel welcomed. You can genuinely tell the employees love their job too!
Room's hot. They moved us to another room in the same tower (East). Not sure if I just had too much carbs, but it's still hot.

We checked in, and they gave us a room that had not been serviced yet. The room had been thrashed from the previous guests. When I called the concierge, she directed me to the manager. The manager stated that this was a mistake, and it happens. She had sent someone to bring us new cards for a new room instead of bringing them up herself. Once we were in our new room, the room was cozy and the additional amenities were good.  When we checked out, I let the employee know that we would be not returning. All she had to offer was an apology. Now being in the hospitality industry, one should try their hardest to win back any guest, but I'm assuming this does not apply for the GVR. It is Las Vegas after all, and I'm sure other people will fill their rooms.

I preface this review my noting that I do not gamble, nor have I stayed at Green Valley Ranch Resort & Spa. I have come on a number of occasions for the purpose of dining, watching movies and to enjoy some libations in the bars on property.   I don't frequent GVR mostly because I do not live in the area, but when I do visit, I'm reminded by how much I actually like this property. It's on the smaller side, which makes it more intimate and easy to navigate. It's clean and organized and the staff that I have encountered have always gone above and beyond to help direct me towards venues I'm trying to locate.

So many great things about this resort.   Loved staying offstrip for a quieter experience.     The good:.   Staff are great (see exception below).   Most staff here were fabulous.  The check in was smooth, the valet staff are lovely, one of the cleaning staff even offered to wait for me to get my Starbucks when she saw me hesitating to leave the guest access only area because I forgot my card.   The amenities here are awesome!  The pools are gorgeous and one pool has a sand bottom portion with a sand beach.     The only thing I will say needs to change is the pool staff.   For the most part the wait staff was okay but could definitely improve but what I found awful were the lifeguards.   The first day we were at the pool three lifeguards just talked amongst themselves and bottle flipped to keep themselves busy. Yes, bottle flipped - my 8 year kids favorite game.  There was even a point where a young child in the pool went face down in the water and the adult with them didn't notice and guess what? Neither did the lifeguards.   No kidding someone is going to die on their watch if they continue like this.  The second day here it was two lifeguards having a bromance looking at each other the whole time instead of at the pool.  I get that it's not that busy but it's a job that has some dangerous consequences if you aren't doing your job even for a moment.  Instead they were passing a life float between them for fun, talking about picking girls up at the bar to the point my husband had to leave becauae he didn't want to here their childish talk anymore.     Otherwise a fantastic stay.    I'd return here for sure.

The room my boyfriend stayed in for one night was a dump!  The room is so small, furniture is tacky (I wish I knew how to attach a picture) The room is dark, outlets don't work in the bathroom, television remote doesn't work! There's a bubbling sound coming from under the bathroom sink! Geez! It was like staying in a motel! It is not worth the rates that they charge for their rooms! I would not recommend GVR rooms, but I do love the restaurants in the hotel & the District.

Just say "NO" to having a small event (20-25 people) here.  You will get lost in the mix.  Our event was over priced and under served.   I travel a do small events around the country.  In the past 12 months I have been in 30 hotels and this one ranks in the bottom 3.  Many of the things such as introductions to Banquet captain, communication protocols for problem resolution and reviewing the contract on site before the event did not exist here.  Even the little things, like forks on the breakfast buffet for the $250.00 fruit tray would have been nice.  I'm not sure my clients enjoy eating with their fingers.   If you are looking for an event, avoid this resort.  I find my top 3 hotels are the Hilton, Marriott, and DoubleTree, with the DoubleTree having some of the best staff.  People make the event flawless, not $250.00 fruit trays.
